commentary.comment: The first half of this match is about to start.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his strike flies just a few inches over the bar.
Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Close! Daniel Gordon (Karlsruher) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Slobodan Rajkovic (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A dangerous towering header by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the left post. This corner kick didn't change the score.
Substitution. Lewis Holtby makes way for Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).

A nice cross arrived in the box from the corner kick and found the head of Manuel Gulde (Karlsruher). He steered the ball low towards the middle of the target, but one of the defenders is there to cover the goalkeeper and keep it out.
Substitution. Reinhold Yabo (Karlsruher) replaces Hiroki Yamada.

Dirk Orlishausen pulls off a fantastic save! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out.
The game has come to an end for Ivica Olic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nicolai Muller (Hamburger).

Goal! Reinhold Yabo (Karlsruher) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the back of the net. Rouwen Hennings assisted in the goal. 0:0.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!

A nice cross arrived in the box from the corner kick and found the head of Johan Djourou (Hamburger). He steered the ball towards the bar, but one of the defenders is there to cover the goalkeeper and keep it out.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Philipp Max will be replaced by Dennis Kempe (Karlsruher).
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Ivo Ilicevic is replaced by Cleber (Hamburger).
What a chance that is! Cleber (Hamburger) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the right post.
The game is interrupted. Gaeten Krebs (Karlsruher) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Substitution. Martin Stoll (Karlsruher) has come on for Gaeten Krebs.
Jonas Meffert (Karlsruher) is awarded a yellow card.
It's a goal! Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. The ball ends up inside the left post. Superb strike!
Manuel Gulde (Karlsruher) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Manuel Grafe lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Although Maximilian Beister (Hamburger) is just on the bench, Manuel Grafe has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
The end of the second half.
Extra time will now be played as the result of this match was not decided in normal time.
Cleber (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first period of extra time of this exciting match. There is a short break before the second half starts.
The second period of extra time has just started and both teams will probably play with a lot of cautiously as neither of them will want to risk losing the match by trying to win it.
It's in the back of the net! Cleber sprays a pass out to Nicolai Muller (Hamburger), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:2.
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) gets a yellow card, off the field.
Daniel Gordon (Karlsruher) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
Dimitrij Nazarov (Karlsruher) gets a yellow card.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Reinhold Yabo (Karlsruher) inside the box and he manages to steer it low to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Rene Adler makes a save in the nick of time to maintain the current score. The ball goes out of play. Karlsruher are awarded a corner kick.
Handball! A player from Hamburger SV handled the ball. That's a penalty to Karlsruher! They have a good chance to score now.
Rouwen Hennings (Karlsruher) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Rouwen Hennings (Karlsruher) doesn't take advantage of the chance to score from the penalty spot. He shoots to the bottom right corner, but Rene Adler leaps out to thwart his effort. Karlsruher have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
It's decided as the referee blows to signal the end of extra-time.
The first half has just begun.
Rouwen Hennings (Karlsruher) fires a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort beats the goalkeeper as it goes to the bottom right corner, deflecting in off the post.
Enrico Valentini (Karlsruher) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier. Hamburger SV get a free kick.
What was Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Karlsruher.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
What a chance that is! Manuel Torres (Karlsruher) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!
Crossbar! Dimitrij Nazarov (Karlsruher) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is coming onto the pitch as Heiko Westermann cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Lewis Holtby makes way for Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).
Dennis Diekmeier provides Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Markus Kauczinski has decided to substitute Reinhold Yabo and he is replaced by Gaeten Krebs (Karlsruher).
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Dominic Peitz (Karlsruher) for his harsh tackle.
The game is interrupted. Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Ivica Olic is replaced by Maximilian Beister (Hamburger).

Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 24 metres out. Dirk Orlishausen pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.
Markus Kauczinski has decided to introduce fresh legs, with  replacing Rouwen Hennings (Karlsruher).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Daniel Baier (Augsburg), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

What a chance that is! Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Weiner had an easy-decision to make.
Michael Weiner shows a yellow card to Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) for his blatant foul.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Weiner didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Granit Xhaka leaves the pitch and Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Weiner blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here is a change. Halil Altintop is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Tim Matavz (Augsburg).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Shawn Parker (Augsburg) replacing Alexander Esswein.
Michael Weiner shows a red card with no hesitation. Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
A substitution has been made. Patrick Herrmann goes off and Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Dominik Kohr is replaced by Sascha Molders (Augsburg).

What a beautiful moment! Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top right corner. Yann Sommer just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:1.
Shawn Parker showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Tim Matavz (Augsburg) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:2.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) unleashed a promising volley from the edge of the box, but he narrowly misses the target as his shot goes over the bar.
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard makes way for Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
A yellow card for a tackle by Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach). Michael Weiner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Weiner ignores the protests.
GOAL - 1:3! Tim Matavz found Sascha Molders (Augsburg) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Yann Sommer off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 22 metres out. Loris Karius stops the effort which is headed to the right post. Bayern Munich force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) handles the ball inside the penalty area. Bayern Munich are awarded a penalty kick!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) sends Loris Karius the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!

Dante (Bayern Munich) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.

Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Pep Guardiola makes a switch. Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) is coming on in place of Thomas Muller at the start of the second period.

GOAL! Superb work from Robert Lewandowski, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich), who beats Loris Karius with a brilliant shot into the right side of the net. 2:0.

Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Manuel Neuer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Daniel Brosinski is replaced by Shinji Okazaki (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) replaces Xabi Alonso.
The substitution has been made. Christian Clemens (Mainz) has replaced Yunus Malli.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) replaces Robert Lewandowski.

Loris Karius makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails under the crossbar. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Mainz.
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Loris Karius is alert and denies him.
Here comes a substitution. Christoph Moritz (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Johannes Geis.

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Loris Karius pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) attempts to test the goalkeeper after collecting a cross inside the penalty area. Luck doesn't appear to be on his side today as his attempt rattles the left post.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) receives a precise pass inside the box from Ilkay Gundogan and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 1:0.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). Shinji Kagawa plays a fantastic through ball and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the right side of the goal. It's now 2:0.
Goal! Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:1. He was ably assisted there by Zlatko Junuzovic.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Koen Casteels is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Goal - 3:1! Shinji Kagawa tees up Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) inside the box and he slams the ball past Koen Casteels.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Marnon Busch.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only crashes against the crossbar.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marco Reus as he is replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a change. Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) replaces Felix Kroos.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Milos Jojic (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Shinji Kagawa.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Zlatko Junuzovic and Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) gets in a shot, sending the ball inside the left post. 3:2.
It's time for a substitution. Sven Bender (Dortmund) comes on in place of Sebastian Kehl.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Janek Sternberg is replaced by Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Goal! Marco Russ displays great vision and sends a pass to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.

Julian Brandt passes to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:1.

OFF THE POST! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Today's referee Guido Winkmann rightly decides to book Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.

Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) and he smashes it into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change. Julian Brandt is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Stefan Kiessling will be replaced by Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen).
Thomas Schaaf has decided to make a change. Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace Marc Stendera.
The game has come to an end for Stefan Aigner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
We are about to witness a substitution. Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Tin Jedvaj.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal - 1:0! Marcel Risse laid the ball off to Yuya Osako (Koln), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal 1:1! Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri provides Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the right post. 1:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Peter Stoger makes a switch. Slawomir Peszko (1. FC Koln) is coming on in place of Miso Brecko at the start of the second period.
Substitution. Thomas Broker (Koln) replaces Anthony Ujah.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg), who attempted to smack the ball away after a cross, but instead he sends it into the right post of his own goal.
Here is a change. Daniel Caligiuri is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kazuki Nagasawa leaves the pitch and Adam Matuszczyk (Koln) comes on.
It is time for a substitution. Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) is on for Ivan Perisic.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Maximilian Arnold will be replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
That's it for today, Peter Gagelmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) picks up a yellow card for a foul. Hamburger SV have a free kick.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga is being substituted because of an injury. Bruno Labbadia sends Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) on the pitch.
Marcelo Diaz plays a lovely pass into Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
This would have been a magnificent goal from Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Goal 1:0! Ivica Olic (Hamburger) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
That will be all from Leroy Sane who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Julian Draxler (Schalke).

It's in the back of the net! Lewis Holtby sends a cross in from the set piece and Slobodan Rajkovic (Hamburger) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes inside the left post and the score changes to 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leon Goretzka (Schalke) comes onto the pitch for Roman Neustadter.
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Marco Hoger (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
It will be a substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Max Meyer walks off.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Heiko Westermann walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) tested Rene Adler with a strike from just outside the box, but the effort is saved. The linesman makes the right call and Schalke will have a corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) is replacing Ivica Olic.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Goal  1:0! Miiko Albornoz sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the left side of the goal.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) was probably a bit loose with his words to Wolfgang Stark, who decides to show him a yellow.
Lars Stindl (Hannover) unleashes a decent shot towards the roof of the net, but Roman Burki thwarts him with a nice save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hannover are going to take it.
Michael Frontzeck is forced to make a change. Edgar Prib is unable to continue due to injury, Kenan Karaman (Hannover) comes on.

Ron-Robert Zieler makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Felix Klaus (Freiburg) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of inside the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a fantastic save! Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Jimmy Briand (Hannover) gets booked.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Stefan Mitrovic (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch for Felix Klaus.
Here is a change. Karim Guede is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Christian Schulz (Hannover) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Leon Andreasen is replaced by Martins Felipe (Hannover).
Michael Frontzeck has decided to substitute Hiroshi Kiyotake and he is replaced by Marius Stankevicius (Hannover).
Substitution. Vladimir Darida leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
It's a goal! Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) scores. Unfortunately for him, it's an own goal!
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top of the net. He makes it 2:1.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Knut Kircher shows the yellow card to Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge. A free kick to Hertha Berlin.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) takes the free kick and curls the ball just over the crossbar. That was close!
Goal! Roberto Firmino plays it to Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Thomas Kraft. 1:0.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies just over the bar.
Half-chance! Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) plays a pass into the box, but Oliver Baumann reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Knut Kircher didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Salomon Kalou departs the field of play to be replaced by Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin).
Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance inside the box and fires the ball inside the left post.
Substitution. Valentin Stocker leaves the pitch and is replaced by Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin).

David Abraham (Hoffenheim) collects a rebound a long way out and doesn't hesitate to release a goal-bound hammer of a shot. His attempt is precise and towards the right post. It would have probably ended in the back of the net if it wasn't for Thomas Kraft and his brilliant save.
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:1.
Sascha Burchert (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card, off the field.
The referee signals a substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Anthony Modeste.
Here is a change. Genki Haraguchi is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
The manager makes a subsitution with Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) coming on for Roberto Firmino.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Marc Vucinovic (Paderborn) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the bottom left corner.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post.

Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart). This could have been a legendary goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. Marvin Bakalorz is replaced by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Michael Heinloth comes off for Jens Wemmer (Paderborn).

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Paderborn.
Close! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Huub Stevens has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Daniel Didavi.

Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) goes on a mazy run and tries his luck with a mid-range strike, but one of the defending players steps in and makes a block. Stuttgart force their opponents to concede a corner.

Goal! Alexandru Maxim displays great vision and sends a pass to Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
Marc Vucinovic will be replaced by Suleyman Koc (Paderborn).
That's a clear yellow card. Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) goes into the book.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Substitution. Alexandru Maxim makes his way off the pitch and Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as his replacement.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Huub Stevens prepares a substitution. Filip Kostic is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Lars Stindl (Hannover) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:1. He was ably assisted there by Jimmy Briand.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) tackles a bit over-zealously and Felix Zwayer blows for a foul. Augsburg are awarded a penalty kick!
The yellow card goes to Hiroki Sakai (Hannover).
Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Felix Zwayer lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
With a cheeky finish ala Antonin Panenka, Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) scores from the penalty spot.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
The end of the first half.
Felix Zwayer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Lars Stindl (Hannover) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Goal! Jimmy Briand displays great vision and sends a pass to Lars Stindl (Hannover), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
Here's the change. Markus Feulner leaves the pitch and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) will replace Halil Altintop.
Substitution. Leon Andreasen will be replaced by Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover).
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Hiroki Sakai (Hannover).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Sascha Molders (Augsburg) replaces Dominik Kohr.
The substitution has been made. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) has replaced Hiroshi Kiyotake.
Substitution. Martins Felipe (Hannover) replaces Jimmy Briand.
Sascha Molders (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) receives a yellow card from Felix Zwayer and because it's his second he will have an early bath.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Salif Sane (Hannover), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) sees a card red coloured card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Bernd Leno has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Oliver Baumann to dive and make a save. The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a pass and hits the ball towards the bottom right corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Oliver Baumann. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the bottom left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.
A substitution has been made. Heung-Min Son is replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).

Goal! Hakan Calhanoglu displays great vision and sends a pass to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
Substitution. Sebastian Rudy walks off the pitch and Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi is replaced by Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) gets on the end of a cross from Omer Toprak, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Jin-Su Kim did his best and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Roger Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Simon Rolfes.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Roberto Hilbert departs the field of play to be replaced by Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen).
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal disallowed! Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) scores but Tobias Welz blows his whistle for a foul.
Goal! Mitchell Weiser puts the ball on a plate for Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
Goal! Felix Klaus tees up Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Welz has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The free kick into the box finds Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who heads the ball towards the bottom left corner, but the keeper pulls off a fantastic reflex save. Great goalkeeping skills.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) will replace Xabi Alonso.
Karim Guede (Freiburg) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
OFF THE BAR! Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.
Bastian Schweinsteiger will be replaced by Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Sebastian Rode and he is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
That will be all from Felix Klaus who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
We are about to witness a substitution. Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is replacing Mensur Mujdza.
Admir Mehmedi goes off the pitch and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on.

Goal! Karim Guede displays great vision and sends a pass to Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:1.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

The players claim that John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) handled the ball and it seems they are right. The referee has issued a yellow card to John Brooks (Hertha Berlin). A free kick has been awarded to Eintracht Frankfurt.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hertha Berlin are going to take it.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle after Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card.

Florian Meyer blows for a foul after Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a rough challenge and the referee blows for a foul. Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Florian Meyer has ended it.
Referee Florian Meyer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the left post is thwarted by Kevin Trapp.
We are about to witness a substitution. Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Aleksandar Ignjovski.
A yellow card for a tackle by Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin). Florian Meyer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. A free kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a rough challenge and Florian Meyer blows his whistle for an infringement. Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Valentin Stocker leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).

Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Florian Meyer blows for a foul. Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised for holding. Florian Meyer signals a set piece. The booking goes to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Problems for Thomas Schaaf as Marc Stendera is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces him.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nikolce Noveski (Mainz). Gunter Perl doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) rises high to meet a cross and steers his header low to the right post. The goalkeeper makes an amazing save.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) connects with a cross and powers a header goalwards, but his effort goes just over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Shinji Okazaki and Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 1:0.
Substitution. Dusan Svento (Koln) in, Kazuki Nagasawa out.

Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt low to the middle of the target fails to beat Thomas Kessler, who makes a sensational save.
Nikolce Noveski (Mainz) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
Kevin Vogt (Koln) gets a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Miso Brecko. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Deyverson (Koln).
Gunter Perl shows the yellow card to Deyverson (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pablo De Blasis leaves the pitch and Junior Diaz (Mainz) comes on.
Here is a change. Adam Matuszczyk is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Halfar (1. FC Koln).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ja-Cheol Koo trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Yunus Malli (Mainz) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the right post is smartly dealt with by Thomas Kessler.
Goal! Jairo Samperio (Mainz) fires the rebound into the top left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.
Mergim Mavraj (Koln) gets a yellow card.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Nikolce Noveski is replaced by Sami Allagui (Mainz).
What a big chance! Yunus Malli (Mainz) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
CLOSE! Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
That was close by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.

Ambitious effort from Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
The game is over for Maxim Choupo-Moting. Julian Draxler (Schalke) comes on for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Jan Kirchhoff comes off for Leon Goretzka (Schalke).
The game has begun to heat up. Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Yellow card. Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Benedikt Howedes is substituted due to injury. Roberto Di Matteo gives a chance to Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke).

What an amazing save by Ralf Fahrmann! Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails. The ball goes behind for a corner. Paderborn will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) for Srdjan Lakic.
A substitution has been made. Suleyman Koc is replaced by Elias Kachunga (Paderborn).

Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) gets to the rebound outside the penalty box and unleashes a long-range shot towards the right post, but Ralf Fahrmann makes a decent save to stop the effort. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Paderborn will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!

Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Kruse guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The game has come to an end for Mario Vrancic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn).
Uwe Hnemeier (Paderborn) attempts to head the ball away after a cross into the penalty area, but instead he accidentally sends it inside the left post of his own goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn).
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Perfectly taken free kick! Rafael van der Vaart sends the ball in, Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header inside the left post. It's 0:0.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) finds the back of the net with a close-range shot into the middle of the goal!
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) scores from the corner kick. The ball slipped through the box to Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) and he slotted it past the goalkeeper.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Close! Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
The foul by Rene Adler (Hamburger) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
Ivica Olic (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) in, Pierre-Michel Lasogga out.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Rene Adler pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Substitution. Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) has come on for Marcell Jansen.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
What was Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
It is time for a substitution. Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) is on for Daniel Didavi.
That will be all from Martin Harnik who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Bruno Labbadia is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Johan Djourou (Hamburger) suffers an injury and Lewis Holtby comes on.
Huub Stevens has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Geoffroy Serey Die.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
What an opportunity! Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) latches on to a perfect cross from the wing and produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes narrowly over the crossbar!
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the bottom right corner, but Koen Casteels keeps it out with an amazing save.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! Corner kick. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) hits a shot towards goal after getting on the end of a cross and the goalkeeper fails to keep it out even though the ball is not struck perfectly!
Substitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) has come on for Fin Bartels.
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) takes a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but his effort is well blocked by the defender. Werder Bremen win a corner.
Philipp Bargfrede goes off the pitch and Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Fabian Johnson.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) tries his luck with a shot from long range, and his superb effort rattles the crossbar!
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Substitution. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Patrick Herrmann walks off.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 0:2.
A substitution has been made. Levin Oztunali goes off and Marnon Busch (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Substitution. Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Raffael.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Goal! Kevin De Bruyne displays great vision and sends a pass to Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
Diego Benaglio (Wolfsburg) jumps into a tackle and Marco Fritz blows his whistle for a foul. The referee gives a penalty to Dortmund!
Diego Benaglio (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is going to take the penalty!
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) sends Diego Benaglio the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) wastes an opportunity. He finds himself in acres of space and fires in a terrific shot from long range straight towards the left side of the target, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
The goalkeeper dives to deny Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), whose promising shot was aimed towards the left post.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Mitchell Langerak was forced into action to thwart Bas Dost (Wolfsburg). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out of play. Wolfsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan swings the cross over. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Naldo (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 2:1.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Neven Subotic (Dortmund) receives a yellow card.

Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Mitchell Langerak pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Wolfsburg force their opponents to concede a corner.

Great solo effort by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the left side of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Kevin Kampl walks off the pitch to be replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marco Reus (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Shinji Kagawa can be given a rest.
The foul by Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The game has come to an end for Marcel Schmelzer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund).
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Ricardo Rodriguez is replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Sokratis (Dortmund) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Mitchell Langerak easily deals with the threat.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) for a heavy challenge. Dortmund earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Substitution. Ivan Perisic makes his way off the pitch and Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) replacing Daniel Caligiuri.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Kazuki Nagasawa (1. FC Koln), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Goal! Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The game has come to an end for Anthony Ujah. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Dusan Svento (Koln).
Roberto Di Matteo has decided to substitute Kevin-Prince Boateng and he is replaced by Jefferson Farfan (Schalke).
Golden chance! Dusan Svento (Koln) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Max Meyer (Schalke) comes onto the pitch so that Julian Draxler can be given a rest.
Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Benedikt Howedes (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Jonas Hector (Koln) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Substitution. Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) replaces Kazuki Nagasawa.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) replaces Leon Goretzka.

Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Good work from FC Koln as they win a corner.

Goal! Yannick Gerhardt (1. FC Koln) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Ralf Fahrmann is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:0.
Yuya Osako goes off the pitch and Mergim Mavraj (Koln) comes on.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.

Goal! The ball is swung into the box from the resulting corner kick and finds Timm Klose (Wolfsburg), who jumps highest and tries his luck with a header from around the penalty spot. His effort is both strong and precise enough to go inside the right post. The score changes to 0:1.
It's in the back of the net! Ivan Perisic plays it into the box, and Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:2.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
It is time for a substitution. Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) is on for Michael Heinloth.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is cautioned by the referee.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) replaces Daniel Caligiuri.
The manager makes a subsitution with Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) coming on for Marvin Bakalorz.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) has come on for Mario Vrancic.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) replacing Ricardo Rodriguez.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Lukas Kruse makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.
Goal! The rebound fell to Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:3.
A substitution has been made. Ivan Perisic goes off and Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Goal! Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top right corner. It's 1:3.
Markus Schmidt is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The foul by Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Weiner. Mainz have a free kick.
Filip Kostic plays a lovely pass into Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly over the crossbar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nikolce Noveski (Mainz). Michael Weiner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) makes some space for a shot from 25 metres and sends the ball goalwards. Unfortunately for him, it crashes against the left post. It would have been a sublime goal.

Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Martin Schmidt decided to make a change. Christoph Moritz is replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz).
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) receives a pass and doesn't hesitate to shoot from around 30 metres. And it was an excellent choice. His superb effort goes in off the left post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Michael Weiner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) for Johannes Geis.
Huub Stevens prepares a substitution. Daniel Didavi is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Goal! Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 2:0.
Great chance! Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christian Clemens (Mainz) coming on for Niko Bungert.
Huub Stevens has decided to make a change. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Filip Kostic.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Geoffroy Serey Die cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That's it for today, Michael Weiner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Bernd Leno is alert and denies him with a nice save. B. Monchengladbach will take a corner kick.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) will take his place on the pitch.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Bernd Leno is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.

Bernd Leno makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the right side of the target. B. Monchengladbach win a corner.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Peter Gagelmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Peter Gagelmann has ended it.
Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
It's a goal! Patrick Herrmann plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Yellow card. Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a yellow card, off the field.
The substitution is prepared. Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Simon Rolfes.
Here comes a substitution. Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Stefan Kiessling.

Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Bernd Leno pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Patrick Herrmann leaves the pitch and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Peter Gagelmann shows the yellow card to Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) for a heavy challenge.
The game is interrupted. Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
It is time for a substitution. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Raffael.
Goal - 3:0! Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the left post. Fabian Johnson provided an assist for the goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fabian Johnson departs the field of play to be replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
Dante (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Pepe Reina (Bayern Munich) commits a rough challenge and Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Augsburg!
Pepe Reina (Bayern Munich) looks sheepishly at the ref as he knows what's going to happen after his poor tackle. And he's right! Sascha Stegemann sends him off the pitch with a straight red!
The manager has decided to make a tactical substitution following the red card and Philipp Lahm walks off the pitch to be replaced by Manuel Neuer (Bayern Munich).
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) fails to score from the penalty as his shot only hits the right post.
Substitution. Alexander Esswein makes his way off the pitch and Tobias Werner (Augsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) is first to a rebound inside the 6-yard box, but he misdirects his shot well wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.

Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayern Munich.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects an accurate pass and tries his luck from about 18 metres. He was very close to scoring, but the ball ends up hitting the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) comes on the pitch for Halil Altintop.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg feeds the ball through to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the middle of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Here comes a substitution. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Robert Lewandowski.
Here is a change. Thomas Muller is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).
Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul. Bayern Munich are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sascha Molders (Augsburg) for Raul Bobadilla.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Neven Subotic (Dortmund) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the left side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:0.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) comes on the pitch for Salomon Kalou.
Erik Durm (Dortmund) receives a precise pass inside the box from Henrikh Mkhitaryan and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the left side of the net. 2:0.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
Pal Dardai is forced to make a change. John Brooks is unable to continue due to injury, Johnny Heitinga (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
It's time for a substitution. Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) comes on in place of Marcel Schmelzer.
The foul by Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
CHANCE! Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the left post.
Substitution. Sven Bender (Dortmund) on for Shinji Kagawa.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Genki Haraguchi and he is replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes the free kick and beats the goalkeeper with a shot which goes inside the left post. Simply stunning!

Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Kevin Trapp guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Goal - 2:0! Marc Stendera laid the ball off to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

It's a goal! Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes it 3:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Bastian Oczipka and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Oliver Baumann was helpless.
Thomas Schaaf is forced to make a change. Slobodan Medojevic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Markus Gisdol decided to make a change. Ermin Bicakcic is replaced by Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Eugen Polanski comes off for Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).
Half-time substitution. Anthony Modeste will not participate anymore and Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) is coming on.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) unleashes a missile into the roof of the net via the free kick. Wonderful goal!
Caution goes to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Stefan Aigner comes off the pitch to be replaced by Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It is time for a substitution. Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) is on for Marc Stendera.
Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the top right corner. Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him with a nice save.
The expression of the referee Daniel Siebert is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Salif Sane (Hannover) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort just over the crossbar! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
What a huge chance for Jimmy Briand (Hannover). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Goal! Jimmy Briand gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Lars Stindl (Hannover), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 1:0.
The foul by Marcelo (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Philipp Bargfrede is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Izet Hajrovic comes off for Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen).
Jimmy Briand (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) is ready to enter the pitch as Hiroshi Kiyotake walks off.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Salif Sane (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) attempts to score from a mid-range free kick, but he curls his effort a few inches over the crossbar.
Jimmy Briand goes off the pitch and Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) comes on.
Lars Stindl (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Davie Selke trots off the pitch and is replaced by Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen).
That's it for today, Deniz Aytekin has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Felix Klaus (Freiburg) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the left-hand post. However, he couldn't beat Rene Adler, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save. Corner kick. Freiburg will have an opportunity.
Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper.
Goal - 0:1! Karim Guede tees up Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) inside the box and he slams the ball past Rene Adler.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Knut Kircher blows his whistle to start the second half.

Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the left post. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save. The ball goes out of play. Freiburg are awarded a corner kick.
Rene Adler pulls off a great save to deny Felix Klaus (Freiburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the top of the net.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) replaces Lewis Holtby.
Here comes a substitution. Karim Guede is given a rest as he is replaced by Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Mensur Mujdza is replaced by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
Substitution. Christian Gunter makes his way off the pitch and Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Matthias Ostrzolek is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Freiburg will take a corner kick.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) for his blatant foul. Hamburger SV get a free kick.
We are about to witness a substitution. Maximilian Beister (Hamburger) is replacing Zoltan Stieber.
Ivica Olic (Hamburger) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him.
Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) receives a perfect pass for a great chance inside the box and slots the ball past the goalkeeper.

Crossbar! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from around the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball crashed against the bar!
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Today's referee Thorsten Kinhofer rightly decides to book Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
The whistle blows and Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is booked for an infringement.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
CHANCE! Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Raffael.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The game is interrupted. Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
