Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
The foul by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Thorsten Kinhofer.
Substitution. Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) in, Fabian Lustenberger out.
Lucien Favre has decided to make a change. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Patrick Herrmann.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Marcel N'Djeng walks off the pitch to be replaced by Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin).
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Fabian Johnson is replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Ronny (Hertha Berlin) on for Valentin Stocker.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard slips it to Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 1:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) will replace Raffael.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Martin Schmidt is forced to make a change. Elkin Soto is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).
It's a goal! Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) scores. Unfortunately for him, it's an own goal!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Marcell Jansen (Hamburger).
Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) meets a precise pass with a nice touch on the edge of the box and produces a shot to the middle of the goal. What an excellent save by the goalkeeper!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The referee shows the yellow card to Niko Bungert (Mainz).
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Ivica Olic (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) was quite harsh and Peter Sippel didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo leaves the pitch and is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
It's a goal! Jairo Samperio plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Yunus Malli (Mainz). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
Here is a change. Ivo Ilicevic is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Peter Sippel had an easy-decision to make.
Peter Sippel shows the yellow card to Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
Julian Baumgartlinger will be replaced by Sami Allagui (Mainz).
Johannes Geis (Mainz) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Rene Adler to dive and make a save.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) replaces Ivica Olic.

Brilliant finish! Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Marcell Jansen, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:2.
We have witnessed a sending-off! Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Peter Sippel's decision is final.
A yellow card for a tackle by Sami Allagui (Mainz). Peter Sippel doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Close! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Bayern Munich win a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Great touch by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) sets the ball for the 25-metre free kick. He unleashes a wonderful strike that goes inside the left post. What a goal!
Substitution. Javi Martinez walks off the pitch and Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Philipp Lahm.
Dante (Bayern Munich) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The manager makes a subsitution with Lukas Gortler (Bayern Munich) coming on for Claudio Pizarro.

Lukas Gortler (Bayern Munich) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Bernd Leno to get hold of the ball. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
A substitution has been made. Stefan Kiessling goes off and Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Here is a change. Hakan Calhanoglu is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, but fails to dummy him and his effort is thwarted.

Goal Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen)! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) was put through by Karim Bellarabi and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 2:0.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card.
The referee gives a yellow card to Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) picks up a caution.

Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.

Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dusan Svento (Koln) will replace Yannick Gerhardt.
Here comes a substitution. Alexander Esswein is given a rest as he is replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).

What a great chance for Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header right under the bar, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Augsburg.

The first half has started.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Problems for Christian Streich as Mike Frantz is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) replaces him.
Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Goal! Jonathan Schmid displays great vision and sends a pass to Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Mitchell Langerak to get hold of the ball.
The foul by Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the right post.
And it's a goal by Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim)! He picked the ball up inside the box and drilled a low shot inside the left post.
Mats Hummels (Dortmund) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
Jakub Blaszczykowski is substituted due to injury. Jurgen Klopp gives a chance to Kevin Kampl (Dortmund).
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the right post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the left post.
Jochen Drees shows the yellow card to Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.
Kevin Kampl (Dortmund) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) has a shot blocked from inside the box. The referee blows his whistle, Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!
Close! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Erik Durm (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
It's time for a substitution. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) comes on in place of Shinji Kagawa.
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Anthony Modeste and he is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
Markus Gisdol is forced to make a change. David Abraham is unable to continue due to injury, Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) comes on.

It's unbelievable, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) blows a huge opportunity! He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific daisy-cutter from point blank range. His first-time effort is directed towards the middle of the target, but Oliver Baumann reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. Now Dortmund have a corner.
Substitution. Pirmin Schwegler makes way for Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal 1:0! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Leroy Sane (Schalke) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Sven Ulreich, who makes a comfortable save.
GOAL - 1:1! Daniel Ginczek found Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Ralf Fahrmann off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!

Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a precise pass. He pulls the trigger but only hits one of the opposition, who gets in the way of his effort. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Stuttgart.
What a chance that is! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but blazes it just over the crossbar.

Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ralf Fahrmann to get hold of the ball. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Stuttgart.
Daniel Ginczek feeds the ball through to Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker.
The manager makes a subsitution with Julian Draxler (Schalke) coming on for Jefferson Farfan.
Roberto Di Matteo has decided to make a change. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) replaces Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Here comes a substitution. Alexandru Maxim is given a rest as he is replaced by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart).
Roberto Di Matteo prepares a substitution. Leon Goretzka is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Goal! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:2. He was ably assisted there by Kevin-Prince Boateng.
The substitution has been made. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Filip Kostic.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
What a big chance! Max Meyer (Schalke) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Huub Stevens has decided to substitute Martin Harnik and he is replaced by Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart).
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) beats his own keeper to score a very unlucky own goal!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Thomas Schaaf is forced to make a change. Sonny Kittel is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.

Well-positioned Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Kevin Trapp reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Werder Bremen.
Robert Hartmann shows the yellow card to Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
The substitution has been made. Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) has replaced Izet Hajrovic.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) determinedly makes his way to the ball from the resulting set piece, but only manages to connect with his body. It's enough to beat the goalkeeper, however, and make it 0:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Slobodan Medojevic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) is cautioned by the referee.

Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball into the roof of the net, but an amazing dive from the goalkeeper denies him. The strike bounces off his gloves and crashes against the bar!

Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Viktor Skripnik is forced to make a change. Davie Selke is unable to continue due to injury, Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) comes on.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lukas Frode (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Zlatko Junuzovic.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What a save from Diego Benaglio! Joselu (Hannover) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Hannover.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne puts a cross into the box and finds Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 1:0.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) makes a run to receive the ball and produces a powerful from mid-range which deflects in off the crossbar, beating the surprised goalkeeper.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Michael Frontzeck probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Joselu. He is replaced by Jimmy Briand (Hannover).
Michael Frontzeck has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Leon Andreasen.

Edgar Prib showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Jimmy Briand (Hannover) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the middle of the goal. It's 2:1.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) fails to score from inside the six-yard box and his rebound goes away off the crossbar.
Edgar Prib (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
Salif Sane (Hannover) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He produces a superb first-time shot that goes in off the left post. What a goal!
Substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) on for Andre Schurrle.
Michael Frontzeck has decided to substitute Christian Schulz and he is replaced by Martins Felipe (Hannover).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bas Dost trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Maximilian Arnold is replaced by Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Diego Benaglio.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.

Edgar Prib (Hannover) collects the ball on the edge of the box and produces a precise shot which would have ended in the bottom right corner, if Diego Benaglio hadn't pulled off a wonderful save. The ball goes out of play and Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The foul by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.

Diego Benaglio earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.
Timm Klose is being substituted because of an injury. Dieter Hecking sends Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) on the pitch.
Here is a change. Ivan Perisic is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
What a big chance! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Here's the change. Patrick Herrmann leaves the pitch and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
GOAL! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Diego Benaglio, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:0.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) creates some space for himself and unleashes a strike from long range, but his effort sails just wide of the right post.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) scores with an unstoppable volley into the top right corner. No doubt about shots like that!

Suleyman Koc sends a superb cross into the box. Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom left corner, leaving Koen Casteels beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:0.
Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
Michael Heinloth (Paderborn) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Florian Meyer won't hear any protests. A free kick to Werder Bremen.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) picks up a yellow card.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the left post. Lukas Kruse guesses his intentions and denies him with a fine save. The linesman makes the right call and Werder Bremen will have a corner.
GOAL! Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) scores with a header from close range after Sebastian Prodl headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 2:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Levin Oztunali comes off for Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
Half-time substitution. Philipp Bargfrede will not participate anymore and Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) is coming on.

Michael Heinloth (Paderborn) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the top left corner. Koen Casteels shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. Paderborn have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the right post. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) sees a yellow card from Florian Meyer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Werder Bremen are awarded the free kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) is brought on as a substitute for Srdjan Lakic.
Viktor Skripnik prepares a substitution. Alejandro Galvez is replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
Goal - 2:2! Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Assani Lukimya provided an assist for the goal.
A second caution from Florian Meyer for Michael Heinloth (Paderborn) means that he has to leave the pitch early today. It's a red card.
Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) goes on a mazy run, gets into the box and from around the penalty spot he misses the target. What a chance that was!
Substitution. Mario Vrancic walks off the pitch and Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) comes on as a substitute.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Elias Kachunga and he is replaced by Christian Strohdiek (Paderborn).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Here comes a substitution. Gianluca Gaudino is given a rest as he is replaced by Sinan Kurt (Bayern Munich).
Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop. Now Hertha Berlin have a corner.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Salomon Kalou.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Thomas Muller is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Valentin Stocker makes way for Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
That will be all from Mario Gotze who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).
Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
Goal! Mitchell Weiser provides Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the top right corner. 1:0.
It will be a substitution. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Nico Schulz walks off.

Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) produced a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Sascha Burchert thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Jakub Blaszczykowski swings the cross over. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.

The referee blows his whistle after Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) does a good impression of a basketball player and handles the ball. PENALTY to Dortmund! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
With a cheeky finish ala Antonin Panenka, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) scores from the penalty spot.
Today's referee Michael Weiner rightly decides to book Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
Sven Bender (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Michael Weiner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang displays great vision and sends a pass to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
Michael Weiner shows a yellow card to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Michael Weiner has issued a yellow card to Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Michael Weiner blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on the pitch for Slobodan Medojevic.
It's a yellow card for Sokratis (Dortmund).
Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski leaves the pitch and is replaced by Marco Reus (Dortmund).
Marco Reus (Dortmund) gets on the end of a cross from Henrikh Mkhitaryan, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal.
Today's match ends for Sonny Kittel who will be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang walks off the pitch and Kevin Kampl (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) will take his place on the pitch.
It's time for a substitution. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) comes on in place of Henrikh Mkhitaryan.

Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 22 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) for his harsh tackle.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

What an opportunity! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the right side of the goal, but Bernd Leno reacts superbly to keep the ball out. FC Koln get a corner.

Dominic Maroh (Koln) escapes without any punishment from the referee after using excessive force to foul his opponent. The referee points to the penalty spot. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a penalty kick!
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the right post, but Timo Horn leaps out to thwart his attempt. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Heung-Min Son.
Kevin Wimmer (Koln) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
The substitution is prepared. Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Simon Rolfes.
Goal - 0:1! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Karim Bellarabi provided an assist for the goal.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) will take his place on the pitch.
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Yannick Gerhardt is replaced by Slawomir Peszko (1. FC Koln).
Anthony Ujah (Koln) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Miso Brecko as he is replaced by Bard Finne (Koln).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kazuki Nagasawa (Koln) will replace Matthias Lehmann.
What a goal! Anthony Ujah plays it to Bard Finne (1. FC Koln), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Bernd Leno into the left side of the goal. 1:1.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Ivica Olic (Hamburger) deflects his teammate's shot, which went to the opposite direction, by using his body. The goalkeeper reacted to an earlier shot and the deflection confused him, no chance of stopping that.

Matthias Ostrzolek showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header down into the middle of the net. It's 2:0.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the middle of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.

It's in the back of the net! Tobias Werner flights the free kick into the box, where Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) peels off his marker and heads straight into the left side of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:1.
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Tobias Welz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
Wow, what an escape. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The linesman points to the corner flag, Augsburg are going to take it.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He creates some space for the shot, but blazes it high over the crossbar. Very bad attempt.
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) unleashes a decent shot towards the roof of the net, but Marwin Hitz thwarts him with a nice save.
Substitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Markus Feulner walks off.
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Marwin Hitz, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge.
It's time for a substitution. Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) comes on in place of Ivo Ilicevic.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Halil Altintop is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg).

Brilliant finish! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:2.
Gooal! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Zoltan Stieber. He makes it 3:2.
Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) takes a shot from inside the box and hits the right post!
Substitution. Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) in, Rafael van der Vaart out.
Today's referee Tobias Welz rightly decides to book Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) receives a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Alexander Esswein walks off the pitch to be replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).

Rene Adler was forced into action to thwart Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick.
What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Gojko Kacar will be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Goal! Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:1. He was ably assisted there by Roberto Firmino.
Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him.
Gunter Perl blows his whistle for a foul after Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) hacks down one of his opponents. The referee blows the whistle and gives a penalty to Hannover!!
Caution goes to Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim).
Lars Stindl (Hannover) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Lars Stindl (Hannover) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His almost perfect header hits the left post and ricochets away off it.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is cautioned by the referee after being shown a yellow card for dissent.
Salif Sane (Hannover) was probably a bit loose with his words to Gunter Perl, who decides to show him a yellow.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Gunter Perl blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the top of the net. His effort is blocked by Ron-Robert Zieler with a brilliant diving save! Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
A big opportunity missed by Lars Stindl (Hannover). He got on the ball inside the box and thumped a splendid first-time shot on goal, but it went narrowly wide of the right post.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) picks up a yellow card.
Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Gunter Perl lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Salif Sane is substituted due to injury. Michael Frontzeck gives a chance to Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Here's the change. Anthony Modeste leaves the pitch and Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Didier Ya Konan walks off the pitch and Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! A great cross from Adam Szalai finds Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:2.
Joselu (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Gunter Perl and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) replaces Roberto Firmino.
Here is a change. Manuel Schmiedebach is going off and Michael Frontzeck gives the last tactical orders to Martins Felipe (Hannover).
Lars Stindl (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Gunter Perl didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Adam Szalai will be replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Roman Burki makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Stefan Mitrovic (Freiburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Wolfgang Stark has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Christian Streich makes a half-time substitution. Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) comes on in place of Stefan Mitrovic.
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) has come on in place of Christian Gunter.
Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) commits a rough challenge and Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for an infringement. The referee makes the call - penalty to Freiburg!
Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is going to take the penalty!
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) slams the penalty home into the roof of the net.
One of the defenders is in the right place at the right time and makes a vital stop to deny a close-range header from Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
An infringement by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) results in a yellow card and as it's the second time today, he also sees a red and is dismissed by Wolfgang Stark.
Huub Stevens makes a tactical change due to a red card. Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Alexandru Maxim.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Filip Kostic.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) replaces Sascha Riether.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:2.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) is arguing with the referee and is given a caution.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Ginczek trots off the pitch and is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Loris Karius leaps like a salmon to deny him. The referee signals a corner kick to Schalke.

What a great chance for Joel Matip (Schalke). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header right under the bar, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.

Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Jefferson Farfan (Schalke). This could have been a legendary goal.
Marco Hoger has picked up an injury and is replaced by Dennis Aogo (Schalke).
Leroy Sane (Schalke) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
Goal! Stefan Bell (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.

Stefan Bell (Mainz) jumps highest to meet the ball from the corner kick and finishes behind the helpless keeper with a powerful header into the middle of the net. The defence stare motionlessly at each other. What a peach of a goal that is. Stefan Bell (Mainz) has every right to celebrate!
Johannes Geis (Mainz) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His effort heads for the bottom right corner, but Ralf Fahrmann denies him. Mainz will take a corner kick.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.
Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Leon Goretzka (Schalke) has come on for Roman Neustadter.
Jefferson Farfan will be replaced by Julian Draxler (Schalke).
What an amazing save by Ralf Fahrmann! Jairo Samperio (Mainz) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot under the crossbar, but fails.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) gets to the rebound and from mid-range takes a shot which crashes against the crossbar!
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Elkin Soto (Mainz) replaces Yunus Malli.
Substitution. Jairo Samperio did his best and is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Mainz have a free kick.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) wasted a golden opportunity after expertly receiving a cross from the free kick and shooting from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was off and he hit the right post!
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!
Crossbar! Julian Draxler (Schalke) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Okazaki trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nikolce Noveski (Mainz).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Great ball in from Vieirinha. Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Ralf Fahrmann.
Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Half-chance! Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) plays a pass into the box, but Ralf Fahrmann reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the bottom left corner is saved by Ralf Fahrmann.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) makes some space for a shot from 28 metres and sends the ball goalwards. Unfortunately for him, it crashes against the crossbar. It would have been a sublime goal.

An amazing individual effort from Leroy Sane (Schalke) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 0:1. Diego Benaglio was helpless.
Diego Benaglio (Wolfsburg) was probably a bit loose with his words to Christian Dingert, who decides to show him a yellow.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Trasch trots off the pitch and is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Ralf Fahrmann makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
Roberto Di Matteo is forced to make a change. Leroy Sane is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Leon Goretzka (Schalke).
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Sead Kolasinac as he is replaced by Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke).
What a hit that is! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) scores a great goal from approximately 22 metres out. His effort goes straight into the bottom right corner and he makes it 1:1.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Andre Schurrle and he is replaced by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Max Meyer did his best and is replaced by Julian Draxler (Schalke).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) replaces Maximilian Arnold.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jannik Vestergaard is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen).
Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) makes room to connect with a cross, but his strike from the penalty spot isn't accurate at all and the ball goes well over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a change. Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) replaces Ozkan Yildirim.
The referee signals a substitution. Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Zoltan Stieber.
Referee Wolfgang Stark sees the trip by Valon Behrami (Hamburger) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. Penalty awarded! Werder Bremen will take a penalty kick.
Red card! Valon Behrami (Hamburger) is dismissed from the pitch by the referee.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Goal! Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) slams home the penalty with a precise shot into the top right corner.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) gets a yellow card for protesting.
Substitution. Rafael van der Vaart is replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Zlatko Junuzovic and he is replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The main referee, Wolfgang Stark, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card for dissent.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Tobias Werner (Augsburg) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Thorsten Kinhofer had an easy-decision to make.

Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Stuttgart are going to take it.
Thorsten Kinhofer shows a yellow card to Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
That's the end of the game for Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, who is replaced by Halil Altintop (Augsburg).
Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Thorsten Kinhofer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Tobias Werner provides Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort under the bar. 2:1.
Substitution. Daniel Schwaab makes way for Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Baba Rahman (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Thorsten Kinhofer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's referee Thorsten Kinhofer rightly decides to book Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) for his harsh tackle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Markus Feulner (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Thorsten Kinhofer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Huub Stevens prepares a substitution. Serey Die is replaced by Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart).
The manager makes a subsitution with Sascha Molders (Augsburg) coming on for Alexander Esswein.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Raul Bobadilla will be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Tayfun Korkut is forced to make a change. Leonardo Bittencourt is unable to continue due to injury, Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes on.

Brilliant finish! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Stefan Kiessling, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Tayfun Korkut gives a chance to Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) and Christian Schulz is off.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
Goal! Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 3:0.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Julian Brandt walks off.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) replaces Ceyhun Gulselam.
Goal! Lars Bender puts the ball on a plate for Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 4:0.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Roberto Hilbert departs the field of play to be replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
The substitution is prepared. Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lars Bender.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
The booking goes to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Stindl (Hannover). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) wastes an opportunity. He finds himself in acres of space and fires in a terrific shot from long range straight towards the left side of the target, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
A yellow card for a tackle by Mats Hummels (Dortmund). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.

It's a goal! Matthias Ginter plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Idir Ouali will be replaced by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Lukas Kruse makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
It's time for a substitution. Marc Vucinovic (Paderborn) comes on in place of Srdjan Lakic.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Kevin Kampl (Dortmund) replaces Jakub Blaszczykowski.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Goal - 3:0! Henrikh Mkhitaryan tees up Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Lukas Kruse.
Substitution. Marcel Schmelzer makes way for Jeremy Dudziak (Dortmund).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Uwe Hunemeier and he is replaced by Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Joo-Ho Park (Mainz) gets booked.
It's in the back of the net! Yunus Malli plays it into the box, and Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:1.

What a great touch by Jairo Samperio (Mainz)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Nikolce Noveski (Mainz) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. The strike heads towards the left post, but it's deflected away thanks to a wonderful intervention by one of the defenders.
Goal! Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:2.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Christian Streich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) comes on the pitch for Karim Guede.
Martin Schmidt makes a switch. Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz) is coming on in place of Ja-Cheol Koo at the start of the second period.
The referee signals a substitution. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Mike Frantz.
CHANCE! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Loris Karius, who produces an excellent reflex save.
Jairo Samperio will be replaced by Gonzalo Jara (Mainz).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Substitution. Stefan Mitrovic is replaced by Vladimir Darida (Freiburg).
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) finds some space on the edge of the penalty box and smashes the ball into the top right corner! What a beauty!
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
It's a goal! Yunus Malli (Mainz) does well to meet a cross inside the box and strikes a perfect header into the roof of the net.
Substitution. Yunus Malli did his best and is replaced by Elkin Soto (Mainz).
Goal! Nils Petersen gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 2:3.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

What a save from Timo Horn! Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The referee blows his whistle, Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Miso Brecko (1. FC Koln) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Thomas Kraft makes a great save to stop the effort going into the bottom right corner. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to FC Koln.
Jonas Hector (Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Knut Kircher had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Knut Kircher blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
A substitution has been made. Kazuki Nagasawa is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).
Substitution. Dusan Svento (Koln) in, Slawomir Peszko out.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) coming on for Nico Schulz.
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mergim Mavraj (Koln) replacing Anthony Ujah.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The foul by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
Dante (Bayern Munich) earns the yellow card.

That was a nice football moment. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom left corner. Manuel Neuer guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Oliver Baumann gets down to his right to keep it out.
Goal - 0:1! Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Robert Lewandowski provided an assist for the goal.

What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Pep Guardiola decided to make a change. Juan Bernat is replaced by Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich).

What a great touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
Gianluca Gaudino will be replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).

What an amazing save by Oliver Baumann! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails.

Oliver Baumann makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the right side of the target. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.

Lovely skill from Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) as he gets away from defenders and unleashes a shot from 23 metres out, but his effort goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Rafinha (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
A yellow card for a tackle by Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Anthony Modeste.
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Eugen Polanski and he is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) replacing Jeremy Toljan.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) replaces Robert Lewandowski.
This is definitely not what Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 0:2.
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier. That's a free kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Kevin Trapp, who pulls off a decent save!
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
CHANCE! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Oscar Wendt.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Yann Sommer dived superbly to block a header by Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the roof of the net, but Yann Sommer pulled off a remarkable save! Eintracht Frankfurt force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. A free kick to B. Monchengladbach.
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Yellow card. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent. Eintracht Frankfurt have a free kick.
Substitution. Slobodan Medojevic is replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Nelson Valdez plays a lovely pass into Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Lucien Favre has decided to substitute Raffael and he is replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann walks off the pitch and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Nelson Valdez doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fabian Johnson leaves the pitch and Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Kevin Trapp is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Raphael Wolf, so the score changes to 1:0.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) gets booked.
Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) is given a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Gunter Perl blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Viktor Skripnik makes a switch. Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) is coming on in place of Fin Bartels at the start of the second period.

Clemens Fritz showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom left corner. It's 1:1.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Levent Aycicek comes off the pitch to be replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
What a big chance! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Goal! Martin Harnik puts the ball on the head of Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), who has the easy task to score into an empty net. 2:1.
Yellow card. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The substitution has been made. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Filip Kostic.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Clemens Fritz and he is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen).
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card from Gunter Perl and because it's his second he will have an early bath.
Zlatko Junuzovic takes over corner duties and expertly finds Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the middle of the goal. The score is now 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexandru Maxim leaves the pitch and Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Superb finishing from Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart). Geoffroy Serey Die plays a fantastic through ball and finds Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 2:1.
Substitution. Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Geoffroy Serey Die.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Peter Sippel interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim). FC Koln are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) earns the yellow card.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Oliver Baumann to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Dominic Maroh (Koln) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
What a chance that is! Anthony Ujah (Koln) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
Kevin Vogt (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Peter Sippel has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Peter Sippel blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The substitution has been made. Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) has replaced Nadiem Amiri.
Goal - 2:0! Yuya Osako tees up Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) inside the box and he slams the ball past Oliver Baumann.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replaces Sven Schipplock.
Substitution. Jin-Su Kim makes his way off the pitch and Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) tries to threaten the goalkeeper as he takes the ball and fires from long range. The shot flies just over the crossbar!

Peter Sippel blows his whistle for a foul after Pawel Olkowski (Koln) hacks down one of his opponents. PENALTY! One of the players from Hoffenheim is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Pawel Olkowski (Koln) is sent off with a straight red card. He can't believe his eyes, but the referee's call is final.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) converts the spot kick with a blast into the roof of the net.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) is booked by the referee.
It's time for a substitution. Miso Brecko (Koln) comes on in place of Kazuki Nagasawa.
The game has come to an end for Anthony Ujah. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Matuszczyk (Koln).

Jonas Hector (Koln) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Oliver Baumann is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 3:1.
Yellow card. Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Yuya Osako comes off the pitch to be replaced by Thomas Broker (Koln).
The yellow card goes to Thomas Broker (Koln).
Sebastian Rudy takes over corner duties and expertly finds Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the middle of the goal. The score is now 2:1.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Rene Adler pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Goal Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg)! Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) was put through by Bas Dost and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.

Rene Adler hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The ball is out of play and Wolfsburg manage to earn a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Peter Knabel makes a switch. Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) is coming on in place of Marcelo Diaz at the start of the second period.
Ivica Olic (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals a substitution. Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Rafael van der Vaart.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Nicolai Muller (Hamburger).
A substitution has been made. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is replaced by Maximilian Beister (Hamburger).
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) scores after an assist by Bas Dost that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:2.
A substitution has been made. Ivan Perisic goes off and Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Substitution. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) has come on for Ricardo Rodriguez.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) was probably a bit loose with his words to Felix Zwayer, who decides to show him a yellow.
Was it necessary? Johan Djourou (Hamburger) is shown a second yellow card for dissent and has to leave the pitch. Felix Zwayer had no hesitation in issuing a red card!
Substitution. Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Kevin De Bruyne walks off.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Roman Weidenfeller is alert and denies him.
Goal! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. It's a free kick to Dortmund in a dangerous position.
It's in the back of the net! Patrick Herrmann is the provider as he slips the ball to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Great chance! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort. B. Monchengladbach earn a corner.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) misses a big chance after the ball is crossed into the penalty box, with his shot going well wide of the right post.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa walks off the pitch and Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
The ball slips through the box from the corner and Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) is standing in the right place to hit it with an accurate shot inside the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Schmelzer departs the field of play to be replaced by Jeremy Dudziak (Dortmund).
Goal! Jeremy Dudziak provides Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 3:1.
A substitution has been made. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang goes off and Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) comes on.
