The substitution has been made. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Fabian Johnson.
Lucien Favre has decided to substitute Raffael and he is replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud (B. Monchengladbach) has come on for Patrick Herrmann.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Dante (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a shot from the edge of the box which goes past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net. Thomas Muller provided the assistance with a headed pass. 1:0.
What a sweet touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Kevin Trapp to hold.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) misses a big opportunity after striking the ball towards the middle of the goal and the goalkeeper makes an easy save.

This was a piece of cake for Kevin Trapp. Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
The foul by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.

Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Pepe Reina thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) blows a big chance! He quickly whipped the ball from inside the box towards the net to beat the keeper, but his effort crashes against the left post.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) blows a good chance to score. He collects a pass inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the goal is brilliantly blocked. Great defending!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Substitution. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) in, Thiago Alcantara out.
Here's the change. Nelson Valdez leaves the pitch and Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
The referee signals a substitution. Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Stefan Aigner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Bamba Anderson.

OFF THE POST! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Lahm trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gianluca Gaudino (Bayern Munich).
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the box and rams the ball inside the right post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Holger Badstuber (Bayern Munich) for Rafinha.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Hakan Calhanoglu puts a cross into the box and finds Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Roger Schmidt makes a half-time substitution. Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Karim Bellarabi.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) scores a goal after a beautiful solo effort. His shot goes into the middle of the goal and behind the helpless goalkeeper.
Pablo De Blasis comes off the pitch to be replaced by Elkin Soto (Mainz).
A yellow card for a tackle by Elkin Soto (Mainz). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!
One of the Bayer Leverkusen players tripped an opponent and conceded a foul. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Mainz.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling walks off the pitch and Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
The substitution is prepared. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Julian Baumgartlinger.
Here's the change. Hakan Calhanoglu leaves the pitch and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Yunus Malli is replaced by Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz).
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a rough challenge and the referee blows for a foul. Mainz are about to take a penalty!
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) is going to take the penalty!
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) fires the penalty inside the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Marwin Hitz is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from just outside the box wasn't accurate enough and the ball bounced away off the bar!
Francisco Caiuby doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Tim Matavz (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.

It's a goal! Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Michael Heinloth and planted his close-range header into the middle of the goal. Marwin Hitz was helpless.
Goal! Raul Bobadilla tees up Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the top of the net. 1:1.

It's a goal! Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Florian Hartherz and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Marwin Hitz was helpless.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Dominik Kohr is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
Here is a change. Suleyman Koc is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Raul Bobadilla and he is replaced by Shawn Parker (Augsburg).
We are about to witness a substitution. Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) is replacing Srdjan Lakic.
Tim Matavz (Augsburg) plants a goal-bound header towards the top of the net after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away.
Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly over, almost brushing the crossbar.
Shawn Parker (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) argues strongly with the referee and is awarded a yellow card. A needless yellow card!
Shawn Parker (Augsburg) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully close to the right post!
Substitution. Christian Strohdiek (Paderborn) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Elias Kachunga walks off.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Max Meyer (Schalke) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Christian Gunter (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
The foul by Felix Klaus (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Marco Hoger (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Felix Klaus (Freiburg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went low towards the middle of the target, but Ralf Fahrmann was alert and the score remained the same. The ball is out of play. Freiburg win a corner kick.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.

Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Jochen Drees has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. Penalty awarded! Freiburg will take a penalty kick.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jochen Drees didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Ralf Fahrmann stops the ball from hitting the bottom left corner. Freiburg get a corner.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Roman Burki was alert and the score remains the same. Schalke force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Jefferson Farfan sends a terrific cross into the box. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.
It is time for a substitution. Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) is on for Felix Klaus.

A neat pass is well received by Max Meyer (Schalke), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Substitution. Julian Draxler (Schalke) on for Max Meyer.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players.
Substitution. Mike Frantz leaves the pitch and is replaced by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).

Christian Gunter (Freiburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Ralf Fahrmann, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Great solo effort by Julian Draxler (Schalke) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
A yellow card for a tackle by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg). Jochen Drees doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Jefferson Farfan did his best and is replaced by Sidney Sam (Schalke).
Here is a change. Admir Mehmedi is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Thomas Kraft doesn't have to worry about this one. Hiroki Sakai plays a pass into the feet of Jimmy Briand (Hannover), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
What a big chance! Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.

Good touch by Lars Stindl (Hannover) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.

Christian Schulz (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Free kick. Hertha Berlin will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Today's match ends for Jimmy Briand who will be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Joselu (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Didier Ya Konan.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Roy Beerens and he is replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
It's time for a substitution. Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Fabian Lustenberger.
Salif Sane (Hannover) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.
Goal 1:0! Christian Schulz (Hannover) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
A yellow card for a tackle by Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Hiroshi Kiyotake comes off the pitch to be replaced by Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) replacing Genki Haraguchi.

Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the left post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Salif Sane (Hannover), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Martins Felipe (Hannover) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
That's it for today, Marco Fritz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle. That's a free kick to Hertha Berlin.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) for his blatant foul. A free kick is awarded to Hertha Berlin.
Rafa (Paderborn) has tested the patience of referee Peter Sippel and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Hertha Berlin are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) takes the free kick from the edge of the box and the ball goes to the top of the goal.Lukas Kruse is alert and pulls off a save to deflect the ball onto the bar.
Goal! Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) zig-zags his way into the box and fires the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Peter Sippel had an easy-decision to make.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Michael Heinloth as he is replaced by Elias Kachunga (Paderborn).
Here is a change. Patrick Ziegler is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Roy Beerens cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Valentin Stocker and he is replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) produces a stunning solo run from the middle of the pitch, all the way to the penalty area. He unleashes a decent strike which goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Lukas Rupp will be replaced by Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) was quite harsh and Peter Sippel didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
A brilliant individual effort! Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
What a hit! Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Substitution. Marvin Plattenhardt leaves the pitch and is replaced by Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin).
Alban Meha (Paderborn) produces a shot from a mid-range free kick. His effort is directed under the crossbar but is caught by the goalkeeper.
Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) reacts quickly to get to the rebound and from close range hits the left post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Joel Matip (Schalke) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
Leon Goretzka is substituted due to injury. Roberto Di Matteo gives a chance to Dennis Aogo (Schalke).
Half-chance! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) plays a pass into the box, but Ralf Fahrmann reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Matija Nastasic (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Joel Matip (Schalke) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. It's a free kick to Augsburg in a dangerous position.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Roberto Di Matteo probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Christian Fuchs. He is replaced by Jefferson Farfan (Schalke).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Marwin Hitz is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Florian Meyer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Schalke win a free kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Abdul Baba Rahman (Augsburg) replaces Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Augsburg will take a free kick.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Markus Feulner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
The game has come to an end for Max Meyer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke).
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Tim Matavz (Augsburg) coming on for Tobias Werner.
That's it for today, Florian Meyer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.

The foul by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Knut Kircher. Bayern Munich earn a free kick. Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) decides to speed play up by quickly sending the free kick into the box.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Knut Kircher didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Roman Weidenfeller pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
An unlucky rebound falls to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) and he scores with a bullet header.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Bastian Schweinsteiger will be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).

Golden chance! Marco Reus (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jakub Blaszczykowski walks off.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) replacing Kevin Kampl.
Here's the change. Philipp Lahm leaves the pitch and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Knut Kircher shows the yellow card to Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Ilkay Gundogan is replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Thomas Muller.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) takes the resulting free kick from 23 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the bottom left corner, but Manuel Neuer is alert and keeps the ball out.
A yellow card for a tackle by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich). Knut Kircher doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

It's a goal! Karim Bellarabi plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) for his blatant foul. Bayer Leverkusen get a free kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. It's a free kick to Bayer Leverkusen in a dangerous position.

It's a goal! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) makes it 2:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Gonzalo Castro and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Rene Adler was helpless.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The game is over for Zoltan Stieber. Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) comes on for the second half.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. His dangerous effort is blocked by Rene Adler, who makes a glorious save!
The foul by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.

It's unbelievable, Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a huge opportunity! He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific daisy-cutter from point blank range. His first-time effort is directed towards the middle of the target, but Rene Adler reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Goal! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 3:0.
Substitution. Petr Jiracek will be replaced by Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger).
Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayer Leverkusen.
Fantastic team goal! Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) was set free in the area by Karim Bellarabi and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 4:0.
The game has come to an end for Tin Jedvaj. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here is a change. Nicolai Muller is going off and Peter Knabel gives the last tactical orders to Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger).

Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and glances off the left-hand post.
Stefan Kiessling will be replaced by Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Karim Bellarabi makes way for Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen).

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the box and immediately fires a first-time effort. He produces a poor shot which goes well over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.

Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.

Edgar Prib (Hannover) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Edgar Prib (Hannover) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hannover will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Martins Felipe (Hannover) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the right post.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Ron-Robert Zieler to dive and make a save. Eintracht Frankfurt have been awarded a corner kick.

Perfectly taken free kick! Bastian Oczipka sends the ball in, Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low inside the left post. It's 1:0.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and the score remained the same.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Stindl (Hannover). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.

Lars Stindl (Hannover) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the roof of the net, but Kevin Trapp is alert and denies him with a nice save. Hannover win a corner.
Goal! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:0. He was ably assisted there by Haris Seferovic.
Lars Stindl (Hannover) connects with a pass but sees his shot from the edge of the box blocked.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) will replace Edgar Prib.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) replacing Jimmy Briand.
Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) blows a big chance from close range. World class save by the goalkeeper. Hannover have a corner.
Hiroshi Kiyotake takes over corner duties and expertly finds Marcelo (Hannover), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header low into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Thomas Schaaf prepares a substitution. Takashi Inui is replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the left side of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and made a comfortable save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Eintracht Frankfurt.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Goal! Lars Stindl slips it to Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) on the edge of the box and he finds the top left corner with a great effort. The score is 2:2.
A substitution has been made. Haris Seferovic is replaced by Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Lars Stindl (Hannover) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to substitute Hiroshi Kiyotake and he is replaced by Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
The game has come to an end for Stefan Aigner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the right post, but Ron-Robert Zieler is prepared and dives to thwart him.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Sascha Riether (Freiburg) receives the caution after an awful tackle. A free kick to FC Koln.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Deyverson (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle.
Slawomir Peszko (Koln) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. FC Koln are awarded a free kick.

Oliver Sorg showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Mike Frantz (Freiburg) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom right corner. It's 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
It's time for a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) comes on in place of Deyverson.
Substitution. Mike Frantz makes way for Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Daniel Halfar (Koln) replacing Pawel Olkowski.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) replaces Nils Petersen.
Substitution. Slawomir Peszko is replaced by Bard Finne (Koln).
OFF THE POST! Marcel Risse (Koln) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot which smashes against the right post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) is replacing Felix Klaus.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card. A free kick is awarded to FC Koln.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 20 metres out. Timo Horn stops the effort which is headed for the bottom right corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Goal! Roberto Firmino displays great vision and sends a pass to Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
Thorsten Kinhofer blows the whistle, David Abraham (Hoffenheim) is penalised for a foul. B. Monchengladbach are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Oscar Wendt, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
Goal! Max Kruse passes the ball to the feet of Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:3.

Oliver Baumann gets a well deserved ovation! Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) produces a decent first-time strike towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Brilliant finish! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Max Kruse, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:4.
What was David Abraham (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Patrick Herrmann is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) on for Sven Schipplock.
Here is a change. Kevin Volland is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim).
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Thorsten Kinhofer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Raffael walks off.
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute David Abraham and he is replaced by Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim).
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 23 metres out. Oliver Baumann pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal.
A substitution has been made. Granit Xhaka goes off and Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Yann Sommer pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is booked.
Thorsten Kinhofer shows the yellow card to Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Yellow card. Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) produces a stunning solo run from the middle of the pitch, all the way to the penalty area. He unleashes a decent strike which goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Raphael Wolf reacts well to deny a long-range free kick from Johannes Geis (Mainz) towards the bottom left corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is replacing Davie Selke.

Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Loris Karius is alert and denies him. The referee blows his whistle, Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) misses a great chance after producing a powerful header towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies him with a world-class save.
What was Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Here is a change. Pablo De Blasis is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Pierre Bengtsson (Mainz).
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
Yunus Malli (Mainz) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Today's match ends for Levent Aycicek who will be replaced by Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen).
It's time for a substitution. Sami Allagui (Mainz) comes on in place of Ja-Cheol Koo.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Michael Weiner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Close! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.

Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Diego Benaglio pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the left post, but was stopped by the goalkeeper. The referee signals a corner kick to Stuttgart.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Tobias Welz blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Wolfsburg!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) steps up and confidently directs the penalty into the left side of the goal!

Filip Kostic sends a superb cross into the box. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Diego Benaglio beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Sven Ulreich.
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Substitution. Geoffroy Serey Die walks off the pitch and Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Josuha Guilavogui and he is replaced by Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg).
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Caligiuri.
Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) has received a yellow card for his foul.

Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes inside the left post and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 2:1.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.
The substitution has been made. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Martin Harnik.
The foul by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Welz.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) controls the ball with an excellent first touch on the edge of the penalty box after receiving a splendid pass and smashes the ball into the top right corner!
Kevin De Bruyne slides a brilliant pass into Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Substitution. Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Alexandru Maxim.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) replacing Kevin De Bruyne.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the middle of the target, but Yann Sommer pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) escapes his marker to meet a cross and heads to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent reflex save to deny him.
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Pep Guardiola is forced to make a change. Arjen Robben is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).

It's in the back of the net! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) fires a brilliant volley low into the middle of the net from the edge of the box, leaving the goalkeeper helpless. Patrick Herrmann provided the assist. What a finish! 0:1.
Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) slams the ball towards the middle of the goal, but it fails to surprise Yann Sommer and he's equal to it.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
Here's the change. Xabi Alonso leaves the pitch and Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Mario Gotze.

What a sweet touch by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) after latching on to a fine pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and unleashes a cannonball towards the middle of the net. The goalkeeper makes a reflex save, pushing the ball onto the post.
Here is a change. Andre Hahn is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach).

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Christoph Kramer, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
A substitution has been made. Raffael is replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Yann Sommer dived superbly to block a header by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Yann Sommer pulled off a remarkable save!

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Manuel Neuer pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. It will be a corner kick for B. Monchengladbach.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Patrick Herrmann as he is replaced by Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Gooal! Johannes Geis takes over corner duties. Niko Bungert (Mainz) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 1:0.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just over the crossbar.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) takes a mid-range free kick and his stunning strike crashes against the crossbar.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) releases a promising shot from the free kick on the edge of the box. His effort towards the middle of the goal is comfortably saved by Loris Karius.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Dieter Hecking decided to make a change. Sebastian Jung is replaced by Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg).
Dieter Hecking has made a change at the break. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) has come on in place of Josuha Guilavogui.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the left post. Aim better, sir.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) collects a precise pass inside the penalty area, keeps his cool, then drills the ball beyond the goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner off the woodwork.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) attempts a nice header from inside the penalty area, but his effort is blocked.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Loris Karius was alert and the score remained the same.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luiz Gustavo departs the field of play to be replaced by Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pablo De Blasis leaves the pitch and Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) comes on.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Wolfgang Stark's book.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Peter Gagelmann had an easy-decision to make.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Bernd Leno to get hold of the ball. Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.
Goal - 0:1! Simon Rolfes laid the ball off to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen), who shot from close range into the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Leroy Sane cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Roger Schmidt has made a change at the break. Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on in place of Kyriakos Papadopoulos.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Heung-Min Son comes off for Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen).
Christian Fuchs (Schalke) missed a big chance! He produces a stunning volley from inside the box, but his effort goes not far wide of the right post.
Marco Hoger (Schalke) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The referee signals a substitution. Leon Goretzka (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Roman Neustadter.

Bernd Leno was forced into action to thwart Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Here is a change. Max Meyer is going off and Roberto Di Matteo gives the last tactical orders to Jefferson Farfan (Schalke).
A substitution has been made. Stefan Kiessling goes off and Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card!
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.
Booking. Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a caution from the referee.

Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) and he blasts it inside the right post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Dominic Maroh (Koln) attempts to threaten the goalkeeper from a long-range free kick. He produces a stunning blast, which only just whistles wide of the left post.
What a chance that is! Anthony Ujah (Koln) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Robert Hartmann blows his whistle to start the second half.

That was close by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
A substitution has been made. Pawel Olkowski is replaced by Yuya Osako (Koln).
Golden chance! Yuya Osako (Koln) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) replaces Davie Selke.
What a chance for Yuya Osako (Koln) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball goes inches over the crossbar.
Here is a change. Janek Sternberg is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen).

Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Timo Horn guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The main referee, Robert Hartmann, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card for dissent.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Slawomir Peszko as he is replaced by Daniel Halfar (Koln).
Deyverson (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
A substitution has been made. Anthony Ujah goes off and Bard Finne (Koln) comes on.
A yellow card for bad language! Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) commits a rough challenge and Robert Hartmann blows his whistle for an infringement. A penalty is given to FC Koln!
Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) slides the penalty home, curling the ball into the top left corner! A well-placed shot!
Viktor Skripnik has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) replacing Zlatko Junuzovic.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Roman Burki pulls off a great save to deny Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Markus Weinzierl gives a chance to Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) and Nikola Djurdjic is off.
What a wasted chance that is! A precise cross into the box found Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg), whose header floated just over the bar.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) replaces Mike Frantz.
Sascha Riether (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
We are about to witness a substitution. Tim Matavz (Augsburg) is replacing Dong-Won Ji.
Oliver Sorg plays a neat ball into the path of Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg), who makes room for a shot and sends in a low drive which bounces in off the right post! 1:0.
Here is a change. Dominik Kohr is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Golden chance! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Jonathan Schmid is replaced by Vladimir Darida (Freiburg).
Goal! Vladimir Darida displays great vision and sends a pass to Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 2:0.
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Nicolas Hofler and he is replaced by Julian Schuster (Freiburg).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Marco Reus slips it to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
What a goal! Leonardo Bittencourt plays it to Lars Stindl (Hannover), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Roman Weidenfeller into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) wastes a big opportunity! He controls the ball after a nice low pass and shoots from a promising distance. His poor effort goes miles wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) seems to have forgotten that he has already received a yellow card as he is surprised when the referee shows him a second one!
It's in the back of the net! Marco Reus sprays a pass out to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:2.
Here is a change. Oliver Kirch is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Jeremy Dudziak (Dortmund).
Goal! Shinji Kagawa plays the ball into the area and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of it to glance a header into the back of the net. He makes it 1:3.
Salif Sane (Hannover) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Today's match ends for Jimmy Briand who will be replaced by Miiko Albornoz (Hannover).
Substitution. Christian Schulz makes way for Edgar Prib (Hannover).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sven Bender (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Ilkay Gundogan can be given a rest.

Great touch by Marco Reus (Dortmund) as he received a precise pass on the edge of the box. His powerful shot bounced off the goalkeepers gloves and hit the post. It will be a corner kick for Dortmund.

Stunning strike! Lars Stindl (Hannover) latches on to a precise through ball from Hiroshi Kiyotake before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the top right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 2:3.
The manager makes a subsitution with Leon Andreasen (Hannover) coming on for Hiroki Sakai.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) is coming onto the pitch as Marco Reus cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) strikes a volley towards goal, but one of the defenders blocks his effort. The ball goes out of play. Paderborn are awarded a corner kick.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) for a tough tackle.
Today's match ends for Sven Schipplock who will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
RED CARD! Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Markus Schmidt. He can have an early bath.
Problems for Markus Gisdol as Tarik Elyounoussi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and David Abraham (Hoffenheim) replaces him.
Here comes a substitution. Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) is brought on as a substitute for Jens Wemmer.
Alban Meha (Paderborn) fires the resultant free kick towards the left post, but the keeper makes a brilliant save and denies him the chance to score.
Substitution. Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Lukas Rupp walks off.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
The foul by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
Substitution. Roberto Firmino makes his way off the pitch and Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Alban Meha (Paderborn) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 25 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the left post.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) is coming onto the pitch as Mahir Saglik cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Geoffroy Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

An absolutely sensational volley by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went straight into the top left corner. All credit to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), excellent finish.
It's time for a substitution. Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Geoffroy Serey Die.
Timo Werner is being substituted because of an injury. Huub Stevens sends Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) on the pitch.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) displays good awareness in the six-yard box and finds an unusual way to score by using his body to knock the ball behind the keeper. He makes it 0:0.

Alexandru Maxim sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 2:1.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
It's a goal! Filip Kostic plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 3:1.
Yellow card! It's like Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Jochen Drees agrees and books him.
Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Jochen Drees after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) on for Daniel Ginczek.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Cleber (Hamburger) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his decent header crashes against the right post and ricochets away!
Goal! No, wait. It's disallowed for a foul by Ivica Olic (Hamburger).
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Pal Dardai makes a half-time substitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Anis Ben-Hatira.
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) on for Ivo Ilicevic.

What a save from Rene Adler! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising low header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Valon Behrami (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Cleber (Hamburger) is booked.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) produces a good strike that sails to the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net.
The referee signals a substitution. Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Rafael van der Vaart.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) replacing Valentin Stocker.
Christian Dingert blows his whistle and Cleber (Hamburger) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.

It's in the back of the net! Marvin Plattenhardt flights in the free kick and the ball finds the head of Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin), whose excellent bullet header from the centre of the box goes into the right side of the goal. 0:1.
The substitution is prepared. Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Salomon Kalou.
Substitution. Dennis Diekmeier leaves the pitch and is replaced by Maximilian Beister (Hamburger).
A yellow card for a tackle by Lewis Holtby (Hamburger). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the box but his shot is blocked.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Ron-Robert Zieler is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) collects a pass and has an effort from 22 metres out, but it flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.

Goal! Thorgan Hazard displays great vision and sends a pass to Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Jochen Drees starts the second half.
Joselu (Hannover) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach will have a goal kick.

Salif Sane (Hannover) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Yann Sommer. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hannover.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the right-hand post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Manuel Schmiedebach departs the field of play to be replaced by Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a great save to deny Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Goal Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach)! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) was put through by Max Kruse and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Substitution. Edgar Prib makes his way off the pitch and Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
Lucien Favre has decided to make a change. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Thorgan Hazard.
That's the end of the game for Max Kruse, who is replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).
A substitution has been made. Patrick Herrmann is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!

CHANCE! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Daniel Caligiuri. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) gets a shot from around 25 metres out after his fine solo run. The ball went just wide of the left post! The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.

Christian Gunter (Freiburg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the top right corner. Diego Benaglio has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The referee signals a corner kick to Freiburg.

Mike Frantz (Freiburg) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Christian Streich makes a switch. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is coming on in place of Vladimir Darida at the start of the second period.
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Immanuel Hohn (Freiburg) has come on in place of Marc Torrejon.

CLOSE! Felix Klaus (Freiburg) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post! The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Roman Burki makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom right corner.

Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Diego Benaglio. The linesman points to the corner flag, Freiburg are going to take it.
Poor challenge! Roman Burki (Freiburg) is penalised for tripping and Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Wolfsburg.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) is going to take the penalty!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) coolly converts the penalty, sending the ball into the top right corner.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Vieirinha and he is replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Bas Dost walks off the pitch to be replaced by Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Felix Klaus leaves the pitch and is replaced by Dani Schahin (Freiburg).
Here is a change. Daniel Caligiuri is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg).
Goal - 3:0! Kevin De Bruyne laid the ball off to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Neven Subotic (Dortmund) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Deyverson (1. FC Koln) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.
A substitution has been made. Henrikh Mkhitaryan goes off and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) comes on.
Here is a change. Shinji Kagawa is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Kevin Kampl (Dortmund).

Marco Reus (Dortmund) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom right corner, but Timo Horn pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The referee signals a corner kick to Dortmund.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets a yellow card. The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
The substitution has been made. Yuya Osako (Koln) has replaced Deyverson.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and he is replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Substitution. Slawomir Peszko makes his way off the pitch and Dusan Svento (Koln) comes on as his replacement.
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Markus Schmidt didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Risse trots off the pitch and is replaced by Miso Brecko (Koln).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Jonas Hofmann just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) replaces him.
Pablo De Blasis finds Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) with a sweet pass inside the penalty box, who then smashes the ball inside the left post. What a clinical finish to make it 0:1.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) has a sight of goal and shoots from long range but his ambitious effort flies just over the bar.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Loris Karius guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Markus Weinzierl gives a chance to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) and Dong-Won Ji is off.
Substitution. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Dominik Kohr walks off.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.
The substitution is prepared. Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Pablo De Blasis.
Today's match ends for Halil Altintop who will be replaced by Shawn Parker (Augsburg).

A header by Shawn Parker (Augsburg) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Loris Karius, who makes a nice save. Augsburg force a corner. They send men into the box.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) dribbles into the box and slams the ball into the roof of the net. The goalkeeper had no chance. Sensational solo goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Elkin Soto (Mainz) will replace Yunus Malli.
Knut Kircher is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What a huge chance for Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Christian Strohdiek (Paderborn) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) is given a yellow card.
What a magnificent shot by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt). Unfortunately for him, his free kick effort rattles the right post.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores a goal! A perfectly produced cross puts him one-on-one with the goalkeeper and he plants a brilliant header down in the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper beaten!

Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Alexander Meier, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:0.
Alban Meha (Paderborn) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 20 metres out, but it flew just over the bar.
The foul by Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Mahir Saglik is replaced by Elias Kachunga (Paderborn).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Stefan Kutschke comes off for Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn).
Goal - 3:0! Marc Stendera laid the ball off to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Suleyman Koc and he is replaced by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
Substitution. Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Marc Stendera out.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Haris Seferovic.

Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. Paderborn earn a corner.
Problems for Thomas Schaaf as Carlos Zambrano is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces him.
Goal! Takashi Inui tees up Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the top of the net. 4:0.
The referee gives a yellow card to Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) for a tough tackle.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Elias Kachunga (Paderborn), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Timon Wellenreuther blocks a long-range effort from Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) towards the middle of the goal.
Goal! The rebound fell to Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) is yellow-carded.
Goal! Leroy Sane (Schalke) skips past challenges and from close range brilliantly chips the ball over Thomas Kraft. 1:1. Wonderful individual effort.
Michael Weiner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Christian Fuchs (Schalke) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Thomas Kraft.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
This is a yellow card! Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Substitution. Leon Goretzka (Schalke) has come on for Max Meyer.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Anis Ben-Hatira is replaced by Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) replacing Fabian Lustenberger.
The manager makes a subsitution with Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) coming on for Per Skjelbred.
Here is a change. Leroy Sane is going off and Roberto Di Matteo gives the last tactical orders to Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke).
