Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the middle of the target, but Timon Wellenreuther easily deals with the threat.
Goal! Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:1.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Joel Matip (Schalke) scores from a quite difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the left post. Excellent finish.
That's it for today, Michael Weiner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Gunter Perl blows the whistle, Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger) is penalised for a foul. The referee gives a penalty to Hoffenheim!
Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger) receives a red card after his horrific challenge and is sent off!
The manager has decided to make a tactical substitution following the red card and Mohamed Gouaida walks off the pitch to be replaced by Rene Adler (Hamburger).
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.

Excellent touch by Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Gunter Perl didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Cleber (Hamburger) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than low towards the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Joe Zinnbauer is forced to make a change. Heiko Westermann is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Gojko Kacar (Hamburger).
Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
That's the end of the game for Sven Schipplock, who is replaced by Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).
Here is a change. Matthias Ostrzolek is going off and Joe Zinnbauer gives the last tactical orders to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger).
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) is booked.
Fantastic team goal! Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) was set free in the area by Pirmin Schwegler and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replaces Roberto Firmino.
It's a goal! Kevin Volland plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 3:0.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Eugen Polanski is replaced by Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim).
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His effort heads for the top right corner, but Rene Adler denies him.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Raphael Wolf, who pulls off a comfortable save! Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.

Raphael Wolf was forced into action to thwart Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the left side of the net.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Rafinha (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Thorsten Kinhofer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) scores from a 18-metre free kick. He curled the ball inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Thorsten Kinhofer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
That's the end of the game for Levin Oztunali, who is replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
Thorsten Kinhofer shows a yellow card to Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Goal! Thomas Muller plays the ball into the area and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of it to glance a header into the back of the net. He makes it 0:3.

What a big chance! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
Here is a change. Mario Gotze is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
A substitution has been made. Santiago Garcia is replaced by Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Jerome Boateng walks off the pitch and Dante (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) replaces Rafinha.
Fin Bartels comes off the pitch to be replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Thomas Muller puts the ball on a plate for Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:4.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Bernd Leno pulls off a great save to deny Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a yellow card. Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) changes the direction of the ball using his hand, but he is angry when the referee gives a foul against him.

Roberto Hilbert produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) rises high to head the ball low into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:0.

Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Huub Stevens probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Filip Kostic. He is replaced by Jerome Kiesewetter (VfB Stuttgart).

Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.

An amazing individual effort from Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball low into the middle of the goal and makes it 3:0. Sven Ulreich was helpless.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the left post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Fantastic team goal! Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) was set free in the area by Hakan Calhanoglu and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 4:0.
Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) on for Gotoku Sakai.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Roberto Hilbert.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes onto the pitch for Karim Bellarabi.
Substitution. Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) in, Geoffroy Serey Die out.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Josip Drmic goes off and Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
The foul by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.

Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.

Alban Meha (Paderborn) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Bernd Leno to dive and make a save. Corner kick. Paderborn will have an opportunity.
The end of the first half.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Emir Spahic will be replaced by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen).
Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) fires the ball at goal from inside the area, but it's well blocked.
Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The substitution has been made. Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) has replaced Patrick Ziegler.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Josip Drmic.
Today's match ends for Suleyman Koc who will be replaced by Jens Wemmer (Paderborn).

It's in the back of the net! Gonzalo Castro flights the free kick into the box, where Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) peels off his marker and heads straight into the left side of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 0:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Michael Heinloth departs the field of play to be replaced by Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn).
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Karim Bellarabi will be replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Lukas Kruse makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) makes contact with a cross but fails to connect perfectly. His low drive heads straight towards the middle of the goal where the goalkeeper makes a decent save to deny him. The linesman makes the right call and Bayer Leverkusen will have a corner.
Goal! Gonzalo Castro gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 0:2.

Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Bernd Leno is alert and denies him with a nice save. Paderborn force their opponents to concede a corner.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom right corner.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Slawomir Peszko (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Knut Kircher ignores the protests.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
GOAL! Deyverson (1. FC Koln) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Kevin Trapp, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:0.
Slawomir Peszko (Koln) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Deyverson (Koln) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.

Kevin Trapp was forced into action to thwart Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Knut Kircher starts the second half.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) connects with a cross from the side and steers a header from around the penalty spot towards the goal. The ball goes in the right direction, but it's stopped by one of the defenders. Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner kick.

Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:1.
Here comes a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Deyverson.

Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic save! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Kevin Vogt passes to Marcel Risse (Koln), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:1.
Makoto Hasebe goes off the pitch and Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Goal! Anthony Ujah slips it to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) on the edge of the box and he finds the right side of the net with a great effort. The score is 3:1.
Anthony Ujah (Koln) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. Although the shot low to the middle of the goal isn't very precise, it ends up in the net.
Thomas Schaaf prepares a substitution. Lucas Piazon is replaced by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Knut Kircher after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Mergim Mavraj (Koln) has come on for Anthony Ujah.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Marcel Risse and he is replaced by Dusan Svento (Koln).
Kevin Wimmer (Koln) is penalised for holding. Knut Kircher signals a set piece. PENALTY! One of the players from Eintracht Frankfurt is about to take a penalty kick.
Kevin Wimmer (Koln) is sent off! Several teammates attempts to argue with the referee, but the decision has been made - it's beyond the point of no return.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Johannes Geis (Mainz) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 27 metres out. Yann Sommer pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal.

Ibrahima Traore sends a superb cross into the box. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Loris Karius beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His almost perfect header hits the bar and ricochets away off it.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Martin Schmidt decided to make a change. Christian Clemens is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (Mainz).
Today's match ends for Ibrahima Traore who will be replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).

Fabian Johnson produces a sweet pass and picks out Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:1!
Substitution. Martin Stranzl is replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
The foul by Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.

Johannes Geis (Mainz) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes inside the left post and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:2.

OFF THE POST! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Nice headed pass by Stefan Bell to Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), who latches on to it and puts the ball into the back of the net with a fine header. 2:2.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.

Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the right side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him. The referee points to the corner flag and Mainz will take a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) replaces Yunus Malli.
Lucien Favre has decided to make a change. Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Raffael.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
The main referee, Manuel Grafe, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) spurns a big chance! He makes himself some space to meet a cross and from near the penalty spot sends a header well wide of the left post!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.
Substitution. Andre Schurrle will be replaced by Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg).
Dong-Won Ji goes off the pitch and Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) comes on.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) didn't hesitate to knock his opponent down with a harsh sliding tackle. Manuel Grafe could probably show him a yellow, but he only goes with blowing the whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Augsburg! Great chance to score from.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) doesn't take advantage of the chance to score from the penalty spot. He shoots to the bottom right corner, but Diego Benaglio leaps out to thwart his effort.
Goal! Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Josuha Guilavogui cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The substitution is prepared. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ricardo Rodriguez.
Here is a change. Raul Bobadilla is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg).

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the right side of the goal. Marwin Hitz is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. Wolfsburg will take a corner kick.
Here comes a substitution. Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Halil Altintop.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Naldo (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 23 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the top right corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Christian Streich gives a chance to Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) and Immanuel Hohn is off.
Julian Schuster goes off the pitch and Mike Frantz (Freiburg) comes on.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Here comes a substitution. Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Levin Oztunali.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) will replace Franco Di Santo.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Maximilian Philipp is replaced by Dani Schahin (Freiburg).
The referee signals a substitution. Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Zlatko Junuzovic.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Joe Zinnbauer is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Johan Djourou suffers an injury and Ronny Marcos (Hamburger) comes on.
Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss!

Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Roman Weidenfeller is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
What was Valon Behrami (Hamburger) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Gagelmann ignores the protests.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Peter Gagelmann has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Jurgen Klopp decided to make a change. Shinji Kagawa is replaced by Kevin Kampl (Dortmund).
Joe Zinnbauer has decided to substitute Valon Behrami and he is replaced by Gojko Kacar (Hamburger).
Marco Reus sends a terrific cross into the box. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Today's referee Peter Gagelmann rightly decides to book Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Peter Gagelmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Cleber (Hamburger) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang makes way for Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) replacing Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
Substitution. Mohamed Gouaida is replaced by Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger).
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Peter Gagelmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Kevin Kampl (Dortmund) collects the ball from the corner kick and aims towards the top right corner. His effort from the edge of the box is clinically blocked by the defending player.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Jimmy Briand displays great vision and sends a pass to Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the left post.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) replaces Dante.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Welz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A substitution has been made. Mario Gotze is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Artur Sobiech will be replaced by Joselu (Hannover).
Marcelo (Hannover) deprives his opponent of the ball, but the referee blows his whistle for a foul. He's not happy with the decision! Bayern Munich are awarded a penalty kick!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Today's referee Tobias Welz rightly decides to book Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Jimmy Briand.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Xabi Alonso is replaced by Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich).

Goal! Franck Ribery clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the left side of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler had no chance of stopping that. 1:3.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is leaving the pitch, and Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) will replace him.
The foul by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Welz.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Christian Fuchs (Schalke) latches on to a precise cross and hammers the ball goalwards, but it flies just wide of the right post.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) connects with an accurate pass inside the box and fires the ball to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players steps in to block the effort.

Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the left post, but is stopped by a great save from Timon Wellenreuther and the score remains the same.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) rises above the defenders and places a towering header low towards the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann is prepared and thwarts him.
Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

It's in! Marco Hoger spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Christian Fuchs (Schalke) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. The score is now 1:0.
The foul by Christian Fuchs (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
Oliver Baumann hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Max Meyer (Schalke) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.
A substitution has been made. Christian Fuchs is replaced by Atsuto Uchida (Schalke).

Goal! Max Meyer (Schalke) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the middle of the net. Maxim Choupo-Moting assisted in the goal. 2:0.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Markus Gisdol makes a switch. David Abraham (Hoffenheim) is coming on in place of Anthony Modeste at the start of the second period.
That was close. Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal Max Meyer (Schalke)! Max Meyer (Schalke) was put through by Maxim Choupo-Moting and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 3:0.
The substitution is prepared. Leon Goretzka (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marco Hoger.
Markus Gisdol has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replacing Steven Zuber.
Goal - 3:1! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Adam Szalai provided an assist for the goal.

Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the left side of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is leaving the pitch, and Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) will replace him.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
Roberto Di Matteo has decided to substitute Klaas-Jan Huntelaar and he is replaced by Joel Matip (Schalke).
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels low towards the middle of the target, but Timon Wellenreuther easily deals with the threat.
That was close by Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Johnny Heitinga (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
What was Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Pal Dardai probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Johnny Heitinga. He is replaced by Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin).

Thomas Kraft (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) finds some space deep inside the box to fire a volley into the back of the net, leaving the keeper helpless. A stunning goal!
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!
Goal! Levin Oztunali sends a precise cross into the box, Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:1.

It's in the back of the net! Kevin De Bruyne sends a superb cross into the box. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the left post, leaving Raphael Wolf beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:2.

A neat pass is well received by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. Werder Bremen win a corner.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) has scored an own goal! No one would like to be in his shoes right now.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.

Goal! Kevin De Bruyne passes the ball to the feet of Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 3:3.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne puts the ball on a plate for Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:4.
It's in the back of the net! Bas Dost sprays a pass out to Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:5.
Yellow card. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Josuha Guilavogui.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) replaces Bas Dost.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Lukas Kruse. 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.

A brilliant cross into the box finds Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who directs his header to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes an astonishing save.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) for Marvin Bakalorz.
Booking. Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) receives a caution from the referee.

Substitution. Ibrahima Traore is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).

It's in the back of the net! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Lukas Kruse. He makes it 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raffael departs the field of play to be replaced by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach).

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) accepts a pass deep inside the box and after a nice touch sends the ball towards the bottom left corner. It is a pretty sweet shot, but one of the defenders changes the trajectory of the ball and deflects it onto the post. What an unlucky moment for Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach). He must have smashed a mirror recently.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.

Kevin Trapp pulls off a great save to deny Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Jaroslav Drobny is alert and denies him.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) makes a rough challenge and Florian Meyer blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Eintracht Frankfurt! Great chance to score.
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) slams home the penalty with a precise shot which goes inside the right post.
Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) failed to convert a mid-range free kick and sends the ball narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.

Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Kevin Trapp to dive and make a save. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.
Fantastic team goal! Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) was set free in the area by Nicolai Muller and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:1.
Substitution. Maximilian Beister (Hamburger) in, Artjoms Rudnevs out.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.

Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.

Maximilian Beister (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Kevin Trapp guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.

Johan Djourou (Hamburger) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Florian Meyer blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY! One of the players from Eintracht Frankfurt is about to take a penalty kick.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fails to score from the penalty spot! His effort only crashes against the crossbar.
Florian Meyer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.

Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) wastes a promising chance as he unleashes a first-time shot from mid-range which hits the crossbar!
Marco Reus (Dortmund) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

It's in the back of the net! Ilkay Gundogan is the provider as he slips the ball to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:0.
Here's the change. Ilkay Gundogan leaves the pitch and Sven Bender (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.

Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

What a sensational goal that would have been! Yunus Malli (Mainz) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the left post.

Nice individual effort by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a shot to the middle of the goal, but Loris Karius does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.

Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Goal! Arjen Robben launched the corner kick and superbly found the head of Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich), whose accurate effort from near the penalty spot went straight into the left side of the goal. It's 1:0.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Timo Horn is alert and denies him.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Timo Horn guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the left post. Wonderful goal!

A neat pass is well received by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot.
Arjen Robben swings the cross over. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) heads the ball low inside the left post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) and Yuya Osako is off.

Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) connects with a cross on the edge of the box, controls the ball and pulls the trigger. Manuel Neuer makes a beautiful save to deny his effort which would have ended in the bottom right corner. The ball is out of play. FC Koln will have a chance to score from a corner.

Marcel Risse (Koln) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Manuel Neuer easily deals with the threat. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. FC Koln will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Franck Ribery produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 3:1.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Thomas Muller will be replaced by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).
It will be a substitution. Daniel Halfar (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Kevin Vogt walks off.
Daniel Halfar (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.

Manuel Neuer hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Daniel Halfar (1. FC Koln) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores after an assist by Arjen Robben that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 4:1.
Substitution. Bastian Schweinsteiger makes way for Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Anthony Ujah is replaced by Deyverson (1. FC Koln).
Excellent touch by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save.
Rafinha sends a terrific cross into the box. Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Timo Horn, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
GOAL! Andre Schurrle meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:0.

It's a goal! Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Valentin Stocker and planted his close-range header into the top of the net. Diego Benaglio was helpless.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Kevin De Bruyne slides a brilliant pass into Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

What a great touch by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg)! He picks up a precise pass and produces a long-range shot, but his fabulous effort smashes off the right post!

Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top right corner. Thomas Kraft pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play. Wolfsburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
