Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) blows a clear opportunity to score as he rattles the right post from point-blank range.
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick!
Joe Zinnbauer is forced to make a change. Ivica Olic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. A free kick is awarded to B. Monchengladbach.
Slobodan Rajkovic (Hamburger) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Felix Zwayer rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Gojko Kacar (Hamburger).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Ibrahima Traore cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs tees up Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Substitution. Andre Hahn is replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Here is a change. Mohamed Gouaida is going off and Joe Zinnbauer gives the last tactical orders to Ashton Gotz (Hamburger).
It is time for a substitution. Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Christoph Kramer.
The game has come to an end for Gojko Kacar. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Heiko Westermann (Hamburger).

Yann Sommer earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) receives the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort, but it goes well over the top.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
GOAL! The corner is whipped in and Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
The referee Felix Zwayer awards Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) a yellow card.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Miiko Albornoz sends a superb cross into the box. Joselu (Hannover) latches on to it and from close range plants a header in off the inside of the left post, leaving Timo Horn beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Anthony Ujah (Koln) finds some space inside the box and scores with a crashing header into the roof of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Gunter Perl blows for a foul. The yellow card is received by Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Gunter Perl has ended it.
The whistle blows and Gunter Perl starts the second half.
Maurice Hirsch (Hannover) brings an opponent down and Gunter Perl interrupts the game. Yellow card. Maurice Hirsch (Hannover) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.

Dominic Maroh (Koln) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the right post!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Daniel Halfar (Koln) comes onto the pitch so that Marcel Risse can be given a rest.

Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Timo Horn to dive and make a save. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
Joao Pereira (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Gunter Perl didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Edgar Prib (Hannover) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Miiko Albornoz will be replaced by Christian Pander (Hannover).

Gunter Perl blows his whistle for a foul after Salif Sane (Hannover) hacks down one of his opponents. The referee shows the yellow card to Salif Sane (Hannover). FC Koln are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
It's a yellow card for Kevin Vogt (Koln).
Pawel Olkowski (Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
The manager makes a subsitution with Deyverson (Koln) coming on for Yuya Osako.
RED CARD! Joao Pereira (Hannover) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Gunter Perl. He can have an early bath.
Here is the reaction to a red card. Tayfun Korkut makes a tactical substitution, Jimmy Briand leaves the pitch and Leon Andreasen (Hannover) comes on.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. The ball went to the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz made an easy save.
Goal! Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) tries his luck from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort, but it is well blocked by the defender.

Bernd Leno doesn't have to worry about this one. Halil Altintop plays a pass into the feet of Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the left post.

Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) bursts into the penalty area with the ball at his feet after a wonderful individual effort that left fans breathless and in awe. However, he sends the ball in a completely different direction than intended, well wide of the target.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Welz has ended it.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Markus Weinzierl decided to make a change. Dong-Won Ji is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Marwin Hitz.
Here comes a substitution. Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Julian Brandt.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) collects a sweet pass and lashes the ball into the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper rooted to the spot.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Bernd Leno.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Heung-Min Son will be replaced by Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen).
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Goal! Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Marwin Hitz. 1:2.
Substitution. Shawn Parker (Augsburg) replaces Dominik Kohr.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a change. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Josip Drmic.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the left post is thwarted by Marwin Hitz.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg) replacing Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
Goal! The rebound fell to Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:2.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies onto the right post!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
A yellow card for a tackle by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg). Peter Gagelmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Peter Gagelmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! The ball from the resulting free kick arrives at the feet of Immanuel Hohn (Freiburg) inside the box, and he fires a lovely shot into the right side of the goal.
Peter Gagelmann shows the yellow card to Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Nice piece of skill by Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim). He perfectly collected a pass from Anthony Modeste, then unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went inside the left post. The score is 1:1.
Substitution. Pirmin Schwegler did his best and is replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Peter Gagelmann's book.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Today's match ends for Maximilian Philipp who will be replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg).
Today's referee Peter Gagelmann rightly decides to book Karim Guede (Freiburg) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Karim Guede will be replaced by Dani Schahin (Freiburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Modeste trots off the pitch and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Sejad Salihovic is replaced by Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).
Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) receives a red card after his awful challenge. He completely lost his temper and referee Peter Gagelmann sends him off the pitch.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
Goal! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Haris Seferovic. The score is 0:1.
It's in the back of the net! Shinji Okazaki sprays a pass out to Christian Clemens (Mainz), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!
Goal! Pablo De Blasis plays a pass to the feet of Yunus Malli (Mainz), and he shoots into the top right corner from inside the box. It's 3:1.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
Felix Brych shows the yellow card to Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) for a heavy challenge.
A yellow card for a tackle by Niko Bungert (Mainz). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The game has come to an end for Marco Russ. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) has come on for Christian Clemens.
Substitution. Shinji Okazaki walks off the pitch and Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee.

Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card in the hand of Felix Brych. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) is sent from the pitch.
We are about to witness a substitution. Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Lucas Piazon.
That will be all from Yunus Malli who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Elkin Soto (Mainz).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

It's a goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Arjen Robben. The score is now 0:1.

Goal! Franck Ribery displays great vision and sends a pass to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) in, Elias Kachunga out.

Florian Hartherz (Paderborn) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Bastian Dankert has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. The referee gives a penalty to Bayern Munich!
Bastian Dankert shows a red card with no hesitation. Florian Hartherz (Paderborn) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) steps up and confidently directs the penalty into the left side of the goal!

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Lukas Kruse, who pulls off a stunning save! Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mirnes Pepic (Paderborn) comes onto the pitch for Marvin Bakalorz.
What a goal! Arjen Robben plays it to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Lukas Kruse into the bottom right corner. 0:4.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Xabi Alonso will be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Rafa and he is replaced by Mario Vrancic (Paderborn).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) for Rafinha.
Goal! Sebastian Rode gets to the ball, slips Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 0:5.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dante (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Juan Bernat can be given a rest.

Goal! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. Franck Ribery assisted in the goal. 0:3.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

Timon Wellenreuther receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed low to the middle of the goal.
Marco Hoger links up with Roman Neustadter (Schalke), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
Joel Matip (Schalke) blows a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.
The referee gives a yellow card to Matija Nastasic (Schalke).
Close! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) takes the resultant free kick from 22 metres out and his shot goes just wide of the right post.
Max Meyer (Schalke) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 23 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up low in the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Felix Platte walks off the pitch and Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Viktor Skripnik decides to make a substitution. Felix Kroos will be replaced by Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) for Davie Selke.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) comes onto the pitch after Joel Matip signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) replaces Fin Bartels.
Roberto Di Matteo has decided to make a change. Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) replaces Max Meyer.

Perfectly taken free kick!Zlatko Junuzovic sends a cross in and Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the top of the net and the score changes to 1:1.

That was a nice football moment. Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Raphael Wolf guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! The referee points to the corner flag and Schalke will take a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the top right corner, but Sven Ulreich pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
What a hit! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the right post. 0:1.
Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. The referee gives a penalty kick to Stuttgart!!
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Goal Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund)! Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) was put through by Shinji Kagawa and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Kevin Kampl is replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund).
Huub Stevens has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Carlos Gruezo.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Shinji Kagawa as he is replaced by Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund).
Huub Stevens has decided to substitute Adam Hlousek and he is replaced by Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart).
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) for a tough tackle.
It's time for a substitution. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Daniel Schwaab.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Marco Reus (Dortmund) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 1:3.
That will be all from Marco Reus who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Matthias Ginter (Dortmund).
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic gets up really well from the corner and heads the ball into the six-yard box where Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) glances a header into the net. 2:3.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The whistle blows and Christian Schulz (Hannover) is booked for an infringement.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Jochen Drees starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Christian Schulz is replaced by Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
Michael Heinloth (Paderborn) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Alban Meha (Paderborn) creates himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot which is blocked by a defender.
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Jimmy Briand will be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).

What a wonderful finish! Marcelo (Hannover) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom left corner. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
Today's match ends for Marvin Bakalorz who will be replaced by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Patrick Ziegler trots off the pitch and is replaced by Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn).

Florian Hartherz sends a superb cross into the box. Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom left corner, leaving Ron-Robert Zieler beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
Salif Sane (Hannover) gets a yellow card.

Alban Meha (Paderborn) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top of the net and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:2.
Here's the change. Elias Kachunga leaves the pitch and Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) comes on as a substitute.
Joao Pereira (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jochen Drees had an easy-decision to make.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) has a golden opportunity after receiving a fantastic pass. He keeps his cool and lashes the ball in off the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) comes on the pitch for Nico Schulz.
Close! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:2.
Here comes a substitution. Ronny (Hertha Berlin) has had enough and is replaced by Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin).
Thorsten Kinhofer shows a yellow card to Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
The game is interrupted. Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Salomon Kalou goes off the pitch and Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Thorsten Kinhofer had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Maximilian Philipp makes his way off the pitch and Florian Kath (Freiburg) comes on as his replacement.
Oliver Sorg is being substituted because of an injury. Christian Streich sends Julian Schuster (Freiburg) on the pitch.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. His low strike heads towards the middle of the target, but it's deflected away thanks to a brilliant intervention by one of the defenders.
Roman Burki (Freiburg) gets a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Felix Klaus can be given a rest.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The foul by Marco Hoger (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Marco Hoger (Schalke) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Kevin Trapp is alert and denies him.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
Marco Hoger (Schalke) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot, but is thwarted by a decent save from Kevin Trapp.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Thomas Schaaf probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Sonny Kittel. He is replaced by Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

It's a goal! Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Timothy Chandler and planted his close-range header into the top of the net. Timon Wellenreuther was helpless.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Tranquillo Barnetta walks off the pitch to be replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
The game has come to an end for Kevin-Prince Boateng. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Felix Platte (Schalke).
The referee signals a substitution. Sidney Sam (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Christian Fuchs.
Today's referee Marco Fritz rightly decides to book Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Timon Wellenreuther, who pulls off a stunning save!
A substitution has been made. Marc Stendera is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Haris Seferovic out.
Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Marco Fritz's book.
That's it for today, Marco Fritz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Kevin Wimmer (Koln) picks up a yellow card.
Yuya Osako (Koln) picks up a yellow card.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Marcel Risse (Koln) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Anthony Ujah makes his way off the pitch and Slawomir Peszko (Koln) comes on as his replacement.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Slawomir Peszko (Koln) for his blatant foul.
Today's match ends for Ibrahima Traore who will be replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Deyverson (1. FC Koln) replaces Yuya Osako.
Here is a change. Raffael is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
It is time for a substitution. Kazuki Nagasawa (Koln) is on for Marcel Risse.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the left post.
The referee shows the yellow card to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Here comes a substitution. Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) has had enough and is replaced by Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Diego Benaglio stops the ball from going inside the left post. Bayer Leverkusen get a corner.
Vieirinha showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) beats the keeper with a stunning low drive from a long-range free kick into the bottom left corner. Truly outstanding!
Goal! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom right corner. 0:3.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Stefan Kiessling will not participate anymore and Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Hakan Calhanoglu.
Half-time substitution. Roger Schmidt decided to make a change. Lars Bender is replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
Yellow card. Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Goal! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:3.
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) runs towards the box and controls the ball after a good cross. He sends it inside the net with a perfect strike beyond the goalkeeper.
Goal! Ricardo Rodriguez puts the ball on a plate for Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:4.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) dribbles into the box and fires the ball inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. Sensational solo goal.
The manager makes a subsitution with Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) coming on for Andre Schurrle.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Diego Benaglio is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 4:4.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) replacing Maximilian Arnold.
Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a second yellow card and is sent off.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is leaving the pitch, and Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) will replace him.
It's in the back of the net! Vieirinha plays it into the box, and Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 4:4.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper. The linesman makes the right call and Bayern Munich will have a corner.

Ronny Marcos (Hamburger) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. The referee gives a penalty to Bayern Munich after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Jaroslav Drobny made an astonishing save!
Goal! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:0.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch after Ivica Olic signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Today's referee Michael Weiner rightly decides to book Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) goes on a great solo run and swirls around the opponents in the middle of the pitch before smashing the ball goalwards from long range. He hits it wonderfully, sending it off the left post past the goalkeeper.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) finds himself in a good shooting position after his nice solo run and pulls the trigger to direct the ball inside the right side of the goal.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 5:0.

Goal! Thomas Muller displays great vision and sends a pass to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 6:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ronny Marcos leaves the pitch and Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) comes on.
Substitution. Rafael van der Vaart did his best and is replaced by Petr Jiracek (Hamburger).
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Mehdi Benatia is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Here's the change. Thomas Muller leaves the pitch and Gianluca Gaudino (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Jaroslav Drobny.
Goal! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 7:0.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) replaces Arjen Robben.
Jaroslav Drobny makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the roof of the net by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) after a cross from the side.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
Goal Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich)! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) was put through by Claudio Pizarro and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 8:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) for a tough tackle.
CLOSE! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
That was close by Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Oliver Baumann. He makes it 1:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart). Tobias Welz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Welz has ended it.
Tobias Welz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nadiem Amiri.

Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Sven Ulreich makes a great save to stop the effort going into the middle of the goal. Good work from Hoffenheim as they win a corner.
David Abraham (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Welz ignores the protests.

Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Sven Ulreich has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save.
Moritz Leitner comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Here is a change. Sven Schipplock is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim).

Sven Ulreich was forced into action to thwart Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. Some classy goalkeeping by Oliver Baumann stops the ball out of the bottom right corner.
It is time for a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) is on for Florian Klein.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) collects a pass and finds himself in a good position to strike from the edge of the box, but his attempt is blocked. Hoffenheim force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that David Abraham can be given a rest.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) left the pitch, and Serey Die (VfB Stuttgart) is coming on to help his team.

Superb finishing from Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim). Kevin Volland plays a fantastic through ball and finds Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 1:1.
Tobias Welz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) celebrates a stunning goal. He manages to win himself just enough space to meet the resulting set piece inside the box and produces a perfect header into the top of the net.
Gooal! Raul Bobadilla takes over corner duties. Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the middle of the net. 1:1.

Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Werder Bremen.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the left side of the goal. The score is 3:1.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) comes on the pitch for Clemens Fritz.

What a great touch by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
Markus Weinzierl is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg suffers an injury and Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) comes on.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Raul Bobadilla and he is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) has a big opportunity! He finds some space for a shot inside the penalty box after collecting a lofted pass and sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar.
It is time for a substitution. Shawn Parker (Augsburg) is on for Halil Altintop.
Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) is leaving the pitch, and Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) will replace him.
Goal! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top of the net. He makes it 3:2.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) decides to have a direct shot at goal from the free kick, but the ball hits the right post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Franco Di Santo will be replaced by Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen).
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Christian Dingert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Elkin Soto (Mainz) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards goal. To the amazement of all, it goes all the way into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1 with this magnificent strike.
What a chance that is! Marco Reus (Dortmund) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!

Stefanos Kapino makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the left side of the target.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and produces a ferocious strike towards the left post, but his shot is well held by the goalkeeper. The ball is out of play and Dortmund manage to earn a corner.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort that sails well over the crossbar and ends in the stands. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.

What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Dortmund.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) gets on the end of the corner and powers a header into the bottom left corner.
Goal - 2:1! Kevin Kampl tees up Marco Reus (Dortmund) inside the box and he rolls the ball past Stefanos Kapino.
The substitution has been made. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) has replaced Jonas Hofmann.
Goal - 2:2! Yunus Malli (Mainz) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Elkin Soto provided an assist for the goal.

What a chance for Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Here's the change. Kevin Kampl leaves the pitch and Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Fantastic team goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) was set free in the area by Marco Reus and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 3:2.
Shinji Kagawa will be replaced by Matthias Ginter (Dortmund).
Kasper Hjulmand prepares a substitution. Elkin Soto is replaced by Christian Clemens (Mainz).
Goal! Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 4:2.
The substitution is prepared. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Shinji Okazaki.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Marco Reus will be replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Stefanos Kapino, who makes a comfortable save.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Halil Altintop provides Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Kevin Trapp guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee signals a corner kick to Augsburg.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Problems for Markus Weinzierl as Paul Verhaegh is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) replaces him.
This is a yellow card! Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Kevin Trapp thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.

What a goal! Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker plays it to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Kevin Trapp low into the middle of the net. 2:0.
Goal! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Thomas Schaaf probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Takashi Inui. He is replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
That will be all from Bamba Anderson who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Goal! Carlos Zambrano displays great vision and sends a pass to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:2.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch for Tobias Werner.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Raul Bobadilla is replaced by Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg).
The referee gives a yellow card to Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.
Thomas Schaaf is forced to make a change. Carlos Zambrano is unable to continue due to injury, Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

It's a goal! Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box low into the middle of the target. The assist goes to Fin Bartels and the score changes to 1:0.

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Bernd Leno shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Handball by Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen). Peter Sippel rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!
A yellow card for bad language! Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the left post.

What a chance that is! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the right post!
An unlucky rebound falls to Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) and he scores with a bullet header.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Peter Sippel has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Hakan Calhanoglu comes off for Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Alejandro Galvez limps off the pitch to be replaced by Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Levin Oztunali (Werder Bremen) will replace Davie Selke.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Stefan Kieling (Bayer Leverkusen) left the pitch, and Josip Drmi (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on to help his team.
Tempers flare after Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
It is time for a substitution. Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Julian Brandt.
Viktor Skripnik decides to make a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic will be replaced by Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Jaroslav Drobny hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Lars Stindl (Hannover) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hannover are going to take it.

Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) commits a minor foul to interrupt the attacking move of his opponent and is warned by the referee that he will get a yellow card if he does it again. PENALTY! One of the players from Hannover is about to take a penalty kick.

Joselu (Hannover) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the bottom right corner. His effort isn't powerful enough, though, allowing Jaroslav Drobny to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Marcelo Marcelo (Hannover), who attempted to smack the ball away after a cross, but instead he sends it under the crossbar of his own goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Joe Zinnbauer has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Ashton Gotz (Hamburger) comes on the pitch for Heiko Westermann.
Joe Zinnbauer makes a half-time substitution. Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) comes on in place of Rafael van der Vaart.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Tayfun Korkut probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Hiroki Sakai. He is replaced by Joao Pereira (Hannover).
Goal! Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Ron-Robert Zieler. 2:0.
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!
Here's the change. Christian Schulz leaves the pitch and Artur Sobiech (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
Marcelo (Hannover) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
Artur Sobiech (Hannover) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the roof of the net, and thus alter the score to 1:0.

Joselu (Hannover) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Jaroslav Drobny makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the top right corner. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
It will be a substitution. Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) is ready to enter the pitch as Ronny Marcos walks off.
It's time for a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) comes on in place of Hiroshi Kiyotake.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle.
Close effort! Lars Stindl (Hannover) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post.
Manuel Grafe is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Bard Finne (Koln) latches on to an accurate pass into the box and immediately unleashes a low shot goalwards. His effort is well saved by the keeper.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.

CHANCE! Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot to the bottom right corner, but Timo Horn produces an excellent save. Paderborn force their opponents to concede a corner.
Alban Meha (Paderborn) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Brd Finne (Kln) left the pitch, and Marcel Risse (Kln) is coming on to help his team.
Here is a change. Anthony Ujah is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Suleyman Koc departs the field of play to be replaced by Jens Wemmer (Paderborn).
Peter Stoger prepares a substitution. Dusan Svento is replaced by Kazuki Nagasawa (1. FC Koln).
The substitution is prepared. Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Elias Kachunga.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It is time for a substitution. Mirnes Pepic (Paderborn) is on for Alban Meha.
That's it for today, Christian Dingert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang feeds Marco Reus (Dortmund), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 0:1.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.

Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) collects a rebound a long way out and doesn't hesitate to release a goal-bound hammer of a shot. His attempt is precise and towards the right post. It would have probably ended in the back of the net if it wasn't for Roman Weidenfeller and his brilliant save.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Christian Streich probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Nils Petersen. He is replaced by Dani Schahin (Freiburg).
Half-time substitution. Jonathan Schmid will not participate anymore and Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is coming on.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) is punished with the yellow card.
Goal - 0:2! Ilkay Gundogan tees up Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Roman Burki.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Mike Frantz (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Kevin Kampl (Dortmund) left the pitch, and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) is coming on to help his team.

It's a goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the bottom right corner. The assist goes to Shinji Kagawa and the score changes to 0:3.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass and takes a low shot from the edge of the box which is straight at Roman Burki, who makes a comfortable save.
Here's the change. Marco Reus leaves the pitch and Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) replaces Ilkay Gundogan.
Substitution. Pavel Krmas did his best and is replaced by Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
CHANCE! Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Valentin Stocker.
Loris Karius (Mainz) brings his opponent down. Deniz Aytekin has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Hertha Berlin.
Loris Karius (Mainz) knows very well what he has done, despite his innocent look, and the referee sends him off the pitch with a straight red!
The substitute is ready due to the red card. Stefanos Kapino (Mainz) comes on to replace Christian Clemens.
Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Post! Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) pounces on the rebound inside the penalty box and tries to prod home! He's unlucky as the ball only rattles the left post.
Goal! Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Kasper Hjulmand makes a half-time substitution. Niko Bungert (Mainz) comes on in place of Gonzalo Jara.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) seems to have forgotten that he has already received a yellow card as he is surprised when the referee shows him a second one!
That will be all from Valentin Stocker who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Here is a change. Per Skjelbred is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) left the pitch, and Sami Allagui (Mainz) is coming on to help his team.
It will be a substitution. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Roy Beerens walks off.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) gets a yellow card.
Yellow card. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Goal Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich)! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) was put through by Mitchell Weiser and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the top left corner. 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Pep Guardiola gives a chance to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and Mitchell Weiser is off.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Daniel Schwaab is replaced by Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).

Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) is penalised for holding. Florian Meyer signals a set piece. A free kick has been awarded to Bayern Munich. The referee shows the yellow card to Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart).

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top right corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 0:2.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) for Oriol Romeu.
The substitution has been made. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Adam Hlousek.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net.

Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
That will be all from Arjen Robben who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Andre Schurrle sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.

Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. Wolfsburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
What was Andre Schurrle (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Tarik Elyounoussi is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) will replace Pirmin Schwegler.
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri is replaced by Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg).

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Diego Benaglio makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Vieirinha leaves the pitch and is replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
Yellow card. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Stunning strike! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise through ball from Bas Dost before unleashing an unstoppable shot inside the left post from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 3:0.
Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne is replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

It's a goal! Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Kevin-Prince Boateng. The score is now :.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Wolfgang Stark has ended it.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Max Kruse will be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Here comes a substitution. Leroy Sane (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Here is a change. Patrick Herrmann is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Tranquillo Barnetta walks off the pitch and Dennis Aogo (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Dennis Aogo (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That's all for today as the game is over.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Goal! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.
Jurgen Klopp is forced to make a change. Kevin Grosskreutz is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Neven Subotic (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tobias Werner leaves the pitch and Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) comes on.
Marco Fritz shows a red card with no hesitation. Christoph Janker (Augsburg) can have an early bath and think about his challenge. Dortmund win a free kick.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Dong-Won Ji will be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Marco Reus will be replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund).

Substitution. Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg) in, Raul Bobadilla out.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the top right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Alex Manninger, who pulls off a stunning save! Dortmund win a corner.
What a save from Alex Manninger! Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) receives a low pass just outside the box and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Timo Horn pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.

Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) takes the set piece from long distance and tries to beat the goalkeeper with a projectile of a shot. Timo Horn stops the ball from reaching the top of the net by deflecting it onto the bar. Great save! Stuttgart earn a corner.

Here is a change. Slawomir Peszko is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Bard Finne (1. FC Koln).

Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin) rises high to connect with the ball inside the six-yard box from the corner kick, but his decent header only hits the left post and ricochets away!
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin). Jochen Drees doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Thomas Kraft, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

The second half has just started.
Goal! Wendell puts a cross into the box and finds Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space around the penalty spot to connect with a fine free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches over the bar.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Hakan Calhanoglu as he is replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).

This was a piece of cake for Thomas Kraft. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Here is a change. Roy Beerens is going off and Jos Luhukay gives the last tactical orders to Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin).

Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jochen Drees didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:1.
What an amazing save by Raphael Wolf! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the middle of the target, but fails.

Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) sends a pass into the box, but the opposition's defence is alert to the danger and makes a clearance. The referee blows his whistle, Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.
GOAL! The corner comes over and Adam Szalai wins a simple header before Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) nods the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Raphael Wolf.

Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the roof of the net is blocked by Raphael Wolf, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The linesman makes the right call and Hoffenheim will have a corner.
Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Viktor Skripnik has made a change at the break. Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) has come on in place of Levin Oztunali.
Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Oliver Baumann. He makes it 1:2.

Substitution. Adam Szalai will be replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi will be replaced by Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim).
Today's referee Guido Winkmann rightly decides to book Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pirmin Schwegler trots off the pitch and is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim).

Franco Di Santo will be replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Guido Winkmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
