Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Hamburger SV!
Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Lukas Kruse to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent. Paderborn win a free kick.
Nicolai Mller (Hamburger) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee. Paderborn win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.

Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the underside of the crossbar is, however, superbly saved by Lukas Kruse! The ball goes out of play. Hamburger SV are awarded a corner kick.

What a huge opportunity! Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the middle of the target. The amazing Jaroslav Drobny deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post.
Substitution. Petr Jiracek makes his way off the pitch and Marcelo Diaz (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Lukas Rupp is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Mario Vrancic (Paderborn).
A substitution has been made. Rafael van der Vaart goes off and Gojko Kacar (Hamburger) comes on.
Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alban Meha (Paderborn) will replace Marvin Bakalorz.
Jens Wemmer will be replaced by Mahir Saglik (Paderborn).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Ivica Olic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
What a hit! Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the top right corner. 0:3.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) collects the ball on the edge of the box and produces a precise shot which would have ended in the top left corner, if Roman Burki hadn't pulled off a wonderful save.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

What a wonderful finish! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom left corner. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.

Roman Burki gets a well deserved ovation! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) produces a decent first-time strike towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Lucien Favre makes a switch. Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) is coming on in place of Martin Stranzl at the start of the second period.
Booking. Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) receives a caution from the referee.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Marc Torrejon (Freiburg).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Felix Klaus is replaced by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
The referee signals a substitution. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Patrick Herrmann.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball from the resulting corner but blazes it well over the bar.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Bastian Dankert signals. That's a penalty to Schalke! They have a good chance to score now.
Bastian Dankert shows a red card with no hesitation. Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot into the bottom right corner. Manuel Neuer anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
Close! Sidney Sam (Schalke) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out.
Pep Guardiola is forced to make a tactical change due to a red card. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Dante (Bayern Munich).
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Roberto Di Matteo makes a switch. Timon Wellenreuther (Schalke) is coming on in place of Fabian Giefer at the start of the second period.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Thomas Muller.
Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.

The ball was swung towards the box by Xabi Alonso from the corner kick. He perfectly found the head of Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), who planted a long-range header down inside the right post to make the score 0:0.
Sidney Sam takes the corner and Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leroy Sane (Schalke) replaces Sidney Sam.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) for his blatant foul.
Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. The referee signals a corner kick to Wolfsburg.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Gunter Perl has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Dieter Hecking decided to make a change. Ivan Perisic is replaced by Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Gunter Perl didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. A free kick has been awarded to Eintracht Frankfurt.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Takashi Inui, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:0.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Stendera leaves the pitch and Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt. Wolfsburg are awarded a free kick.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Marcel Schafer, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

Lars Stindl (Hannover) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Loris Karius made a crucial save!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Joselu (Hannover) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Jimmy Briand (Hannover) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Loris Karius, so the score changes to 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Salif Sane (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Thorsten Kinhofer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
OFF THE POST! Johannes Geis (Mainz) fires the ball from the free kick, but it only rattles the left post.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Yunus Malli (Mainz), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

Jimmy Briand (Hannover) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Loris Karius to get hold of the ball.
Here's the change. Christian Clemens leaves the pitch and Elkin Soto (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Kasper Hjulmand has decided to make a change. Nicolas Castillo (Mainz) replaces Sami Allagui.
Jimmy Briand comes off the pitch to be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).
What a sweet touch by Yunus Malli (Mainz) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Ron-Robert Zieler to hold.
Goal! Elkin Soto (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Artur Sobiech (Hannover) replacing Hiroshi Kiyotake.
Joselu (Hannover) rises high to head a nice lofted cross low towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Loris Karius makes a comfortable save.
Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Niko Bungert (Mainz) in, Yunus Malli out.
That's the end of the game for Manuel Schmiedebach, who is replaced by Maurice Hirsch (Hannover).
Thorsten Kinhofer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Markus Feulner (Augsburg) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Florian Meyer no option but to blow his whistle. It's a yellow card for Markus Feulner (Augsburg).

Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Oliver Baumann leaps like a salmon to deny him. Oliver Baumann pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Daniel Baier (Augsburg) fired on target from the rebound. His effort from inside the box was directed low to the middle of the goal.

What a chance that is! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Halil Altintop (Augsburg) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:0.
David Abraham (Hoffenheim) earns the yellow card.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) executes the resulting free kick. His knuckleball confuses the goalkeeper and ends up in the back of the net.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Augsburg) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Substitution. Alexander Esswein will be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
GOAL! Pirmin Schwegler curls the free kick into the box. Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Alex Manninger and into the top right corner. 2:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Sejad Salihovic goes off the pitch and Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Anthony Modeste will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).

Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: Treat others as you want to be treated. He makes a bad challenge and leaves Florian Meyer with no other option than to blow for a foul. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card.

Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) makes a yard for himself as he picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and quickly sends a shot towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a remarkable save to keep the ball from hitting the net. What a save! The referee points to the corner flag and Augsburg will take a corner.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) replacing Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
The game has come to an end for Eugen Polanski. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed just over the crossbar!
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) brings his opponent down. Florian Meyer has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card.
The manager makes a subsitution with Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) coming on for Tobias Werner.

David Abraham (Hoffenheim) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Alex Manninger anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the bottom left corner. The linesman referee is pointing towards the corner flag. It will be a corner kick.
What an outstanding solo effort by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Jannik Vestergaard (Werder Bremen) receives a quality pass and unleashes a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just over the crossbar. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the left post. His promising effort is kept out by Thomas Kraft, who pulls off a stunning save!
Felix Brych blows the whistle, Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) is penalised for a foul. Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Felix Brych pulls out a yellow card.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the bottom right corner, but Thomas Kraft answers with a superb save to deny him. Now Werder Bremen have a corner.
Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) jumps into a tackle and Felix Brych blows his whistle for a foul. The whistle is blown for an infringement and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card!

The whistle blows and Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) is booked for an infringement. An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen). Felix Brych saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul.
Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) brings his opponent down. Felix Brych has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card.

Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the right side of the goal, but Thomas Kraft was alert and made a comfortable save. Werder Bremen get a corner.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen). Theodor Gebre Selassie plays a fantastic through ball and finds Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the top left corner. It's now 1:0.
What a big chance! Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Brych has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Jos Luhukay decided to make a change. Nico Schulz is replaced by Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Peter Niemeyer comes off for Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin).

Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) trips an opposition player and Felix Brych signals a foul. Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) gets booked.

Thomas Kraft makes a brilliant save! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes straight under the crossbar but is saved by the keeper! The ball is out of play. Werder Bremen will have a chance to score from a corner.
Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) commits a rough foul. Felix Brych stops the game and makes a call. Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is booked by the referee. Referee Felix Brych sees the trip by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Levin Oztunali walks off the pitch to be replaced by Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Clemens Fritz displays great vision and sends a pass to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 2:0.
Jos Luhukay has decided to make a change. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) replaces Ronny.
The game has come to an end for Franco Di Santo. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen).
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Thomas Kraft is alert and denies him.
Here comes a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic is given a rest as he is replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Knut Kircher shows the yellow card to Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge. Bayer Leverkusen have a free kick from a promising distance.
What a great touch by Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) as he controls a fine pass into the box and fires the ball to the left post, but the effort is brilliantly blocked.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Kevin Kampl (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Jurgen Klopp decided to make a change. Lukasz Piszczek is replaced by Neven Subotic (Dortmund).

Bernd Leno can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Ciro Immobile (Dortmund). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
A substitution has been made. Kevin Grosskreutz goes off and Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) comes on.
It is time for a substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Josip Drmic.
Here is a change. Hakan Calhanoglu is going off and Roger Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) replaces Ciro Immobile.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Marc Stendera and Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets in a shot, sending the ball inside the left post. 0:1.
It's time for a substitution. Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) comes on in place of Sascha Riether.

Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the right post, but is stopped by a great save from Roman Burki and the score remains the same.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Kevin Trapp (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Julian Schuster comes off for Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Oliver Sorg has come on in place of Sascha Riether (Freiburg).
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Felix Zwayer blows his whistle after Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. Freiburg are awarded a penalty kick!
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Christian Gunter (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
Goal - 2:1! Felix Klaus tees up Nils Petersen (Freiburg) inside the box and he curls the ball into the right side of the net and past Kevin Trapp.
Here comes a substitution. Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Admir Mehmedi.
It's a goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 3:1.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The substitution has been made. Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Stefan Aigner.
Here is a change. Takashi Inui is going off and Thomas Schaaf gives the last tactical orders to Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It will be a substitution. Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) is ready to enter the pitch as Makoto Hasebe walks off.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) meets a cross inside the box, but his header is blocked by an opposing player.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 4:1.
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The referee shows the yellow card to Slawomir Peszko (Koln).
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Joe Zinnbauer has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) replacing Nicolai Muller.
Slobodan Rajkovic (Hamburger) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.

Marcel Risse (Koln) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Jaroslav Drobny is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
The referee signals a substitution. Dusan Svento (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Slawomir Peszko.
Substitution. Petr Jiracek makes his way off the pitch and Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
Joe Zinnbauer decides to make a substitution. Mohamed Gouaida will be replaced by Maximilian Beister (Hamburger).
Marcel Risse (Koln) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Jaroslav Drobny with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:2.
Substitution. Marcel Risse is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).
It's a yellow card for Johan Djourou (Hamburger).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Pablo De Blasis produces a great pass that finds Yunus Malli (Mainz) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 0:0.
Rafa (Paderborn) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

What a great touch by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Pablo De Blasis plays a pass to the feet of Yunus Malli (Mainz), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 2:0.
Substitution. Christian Strohdiek is replaced by Mario Vrancic (Paderborn).
Srdjan Lakic (Paderborn) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Suleyman Koc.
Goal - 3:0! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Yunus Malli provided an assist for the goal.
We are about to witness a substitution. Sami Allagui (Mainz) is replacing Shinji Okazaki.
Substitution. Moritz Stoppelkamp makes way for Alban Meha (Paderborn).
Substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger walks off the pitch and Niko Bungert (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Kasper Hjulmand decides to make a substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Elkin Soto (Mainz).
The ball from the free kick finds its way to Sami Allagui (Mainz) who finds himself some space and scores with a thunderous header into the bottom right corner. An incredible long-range header!
An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn). Robert Hartmann saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul. Mainz are awarded a penalty kick!
Johannes Geis (Mainz) steps up and confidently directs the penalty into the left side of the goal!

Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Jens Wemmer (Paderborn), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. The linesman makes the right call and Paderborn will have a corner.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Fabian Giefer (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) for his blatant foul.

Christian Fuchs passes to Marco Hoger (Schalke), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.

Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt to the middle of the target fails to beat Ron-Robert Zieler, who makes a sensational save. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
The foul by Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Joselu (Hannover) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
Substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Maxim Choupo-Moting walks off.

Matija Nastasic (Schalke) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.
It's time for a substitution. Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) comes on in place of Maurice Hirsch.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Stindl (Hannover). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Here is a change. Marco Hoger is going off and Roberto Di Matteo gives the last tactical orders to Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke).
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Today's referee Sascha Stegemann rightly decides to book Roman Neustadter (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
The substitution is prepared. Salif Sane (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Manuel Schmiedebach.
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Miiko Albornoz will be replaced by Christian Pander (Hannover).
Substitution. Max Meyer did his best and is replaced by Joel Matip (Schalke).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) picked up a yellow card from referee.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart).
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Yann Sommer stops the ball from hitting the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar.
Substitution. Timo Werner makes his way off the pitch and Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as his replacement.
Goal! Branimir Hrgota provides Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort under the bar. 0:1.
Here is a change. Moritz Leitner is going off and Huub Stevens gives the last tactical orders to Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Daniel Schwaab cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Yellow card. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Branimir Hrgota departs the field of play to be replaced by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
Lucien Favre decides to make a substitution. Julian Korb will be replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
OFF THE BAR! Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) finds some space to meet the corner kick and unleashes a shot that only crashes against the bar!
Substitution. Max Kruse leaves the pitch and is replaced by Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach).
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Kevin De Bruyne is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 1:0.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) gets a yellow card.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) picks up a rebound just outside the box, steadies himself and unleashes a shot that deflects off the post into the top right corner of the target, beating the helpless goalkeeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) replaces Sebastian Rode.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Manuel Neuer with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.
GOAL! Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time. He had a good position inside the box and scored from a rebound.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The manager makes a subsitution with Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) coming on for Robert Lewandowski.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) replaces Thomas Muller.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) unleashes a sweet first-timer from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal. The goalkeeper stops the shot with a quick save. Bayern Munich force their opponents to concede a corner.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) scores a superb goal as he dribbles past defenders and arrows the ball straight into the top left corner of the goal. An absolutely fantastic solo effort.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Ivan Perisic will be replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Diego Benaglio is alert and denies him.
A substitution has been made. Bas Dost is replaced by Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Wolfsburg.
It is time for a substitution. Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) is on for Daniel Caligiuri.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
That's it for today, Tobias Welz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Roman Burki pulls off a great save to deny Joselu (Hannover), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. Hannover have a corner.
Jimmy Briand (Hannover) rises high to connect with the ball inside the six-yard box from the corner kick, but his decent header only hits the left post and ricochets away!
Joselu (Hannover) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Maurice Hirsch (Hannover) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Sascha Riether (Freiburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Goal! Mike Frantz (Freiburg) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Christian Gunter.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Sascha Riether is replaced by Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg).
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!

Ron-Robert Zieler makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Yellow card. Felix Klaus (Freiburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Here is a change. Maurice Hirsch is going off and Tayfun Korkut gives the last tactical orders to Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).
Roman Burki pulls off a great save to deny Lars Stindl (Hannover) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Mike Frantz cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Vladimir Darida is replaced by Marc Torrejon (Freiburg).

Goal! Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) jumps highest inside the box to meet the resulting corner from Jonathan Schmid. His well-placed header ends up in the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. 2:0.
Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Lars Stindl. The score is 2:1.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Joselu (Hannover) slots the ball through the middle of the defence and it somehow ends up going into the goal after the goalkeeper makes a mistake!
Lars Stindl (Hannover) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Roman Burki is alert and denies him.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Edgar Prib (Hannover) for Hiroshi Kiyotake.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Oh, what an awful moment for John Brooks (Hertha Berlin). He was trying to clear a dangerous pass to safety from inside the box, but sent the ball into his own net.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) makes a rough challenge and Peter Sippel blows his whistle for a foul. The referee blows his whistle for an unfair challenge and points to the penalty spot! It will be a penaly kick for Hoffenheim.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) sends Thomas Kraft the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Peter Sippel blows his whistle after Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. Hoffenheim are given a penalty!
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
What was Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) gets on the end of a cross from Nico Schulz, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Hajime Hosogai.
That's the end of the game for Ronny, who is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
Jos Luhukay decides to make a substitution. Peter Pekarik will be replaced by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! Roberto Firmino puts the ball on a plate for Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:4.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Volland leaves the pitch and Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Peter Sippel and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It's a goal! Roberto Firmino plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:5.
Substitution. Sejad Salihovic walks off the pitch and Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. David Abraham (Hoffenheim) replaces Pirmin Schwegler.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card from the referee for dissent.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Daniel Halfar sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Dominic Maroh (Koln) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:1.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) jumps for a cross and plants a crashing header into the middle of the net. Even though the goalkeeper was standing near, he couldn't make a save.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. His dangerous effort is blocked by Timo Horn, who makes a glorious save!
OFF THE BAR! Daniel Halfar (Koln) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
The manager makes a subsitution with Simon Zoller (Koln) coming on for Marcel Risse.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) replaces Junior Malanda.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Josuha Guilavogui will be replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Dusan Svento as he is replaced by Adam Matuszczyk (Koln).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) replaces Ivan Perisic.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the left side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:1.
The substitution has been made. Yuya Osako (Koln) has replaced Adam Matuszczyk.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg). It's a penalty for B. Monchengladbach!
Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) is presented with a great chance to score and drills a shot in off the bottom of the left post.
Great chance! Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the left side of the goal. Alex Manninger is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and sends in a superb strike that finds its way under the crossbar and hits the net.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) in, Andre Hahn out.
Here is a change. Branimir Hrgota is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.
The foul by Baba Rahman (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
Substitution. Julian Korb did his best and is replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Raul Bobadilla is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Alex Manninger guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Ronny Philp (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Alexander Esswein walks off.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Erik Thommy (Augsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Halil Altintop cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
A yellow card for a tackle by Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Bernd Leno makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom left corner. Now Eintracht Frankfurt have a corner.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle for a foul after Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) hacks down one of his opponents. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a penalty kick!
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Wolfgang Stark has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a yellow card. The referee Wolfgang Stark made the right call.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle. A free kick has been awarded to Bayer Leverkusen.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Marc Stendera walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Simon Rolfes will be replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) for Heung-Min Son.
Here comes a substitution. Takashi Inui is given a rest as he is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Lars Bender plays a lovely pass into Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Great touch by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Timo Hildebrand (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Substitution. Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Haris Seferovic.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but is stopped by a great save from Jaroslav Drobny and the score remains the same. The linesman makes the right call and Schalke will have a corner.
CHANCE! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a fine save! Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header low towards the middle, but the effort is kept out.

That was a nice football moment. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom left corner. Jaroslav Drobny guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) probably spotted the goalkeeper off his line, but his long-range effort flew just a few inches wide of the right post.
Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Jaroslav Drobny pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

Christian Fuchs (Schalke) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the right post.
What a huge chance for Petr Jiracek (Hamburger). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His header is aimed towards the middle of the net, but Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a comfortable save to thwart him.
Valon Behrami (Hamburger) is booked for saying more than Markus Schmidt was willing to tolerate.
What a chance that is! Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Markus Schmidt has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Roberto Di Matteo decided to make a change. Christian Fuchs is replaced by Kaan Ayhan (Schalke).
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) unleashes a decent strike heading to the bottom right corner, but the keeper dives like Superman and keeps it out.
Ralf Fahrmann hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.

Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a decent low shot from the edge of the box towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
The referee signals a substitution. Leroy Sane (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Tranquillo Barnetta.
Marco Hoger (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Markus Schmidt ignores the protests.
Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger) collects the ball on the edge of the box and produces a precise shot which would have ended inside the right post, if Ralf Fahrmann hadn't pulled off a wonderful save.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Cleber (Hamburger) is given a yellow card.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the right post. A few inches to the left and it could have been a sweet goal!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) is given a yellow card.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) takes the resulting free kick from 18 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the roof of the net, but Lukas Kruse is alert and keeps the ball out. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Stuttgart.

Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Sven Ulreich. The referee signals a corner kick to Paderborn.
Great ball in from Timo Werner. Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) takes the resulting free kick from 30 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the left side of the goal, but Lukas Kruse is alert and keeps the ball out. The referee points to the corner flag and Stuttgart will take a corner.
Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

What a chance that is! Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) leaps high near the penalty spot and gets a header in from the free kick. The attempt goes down towards the right post, but the goalkeeper dives and thwarts the effort. It was a difficult header and it's always tough to put the ball inside the net from positions like that. The ball goes out for a corner. Paderborn can continue in their attacking effort.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
We are about to witness a substitution. Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) is replacing Martin Harnik.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Daniel Didavi cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alban Meha (Paderborn) comes onto the pitch so that Mario Vrancic can be given a rest.
Substitution. Timo Werner makes way for Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) replacing Moritz Stoppelkamp.

Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) shows good awareness deep inside the box and jumps high to meet a perfect cross from the set piece. He steers a fine header goalwards, but finds the keeper prepared. No doubt about the wonderful save that he made. Stuttgart have a corner.
Lukas Rupp comes off the pitch to be replaced by Mahir Saglik (Paderborn).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) finds himself in a very promising position after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and fires the ball inside the right post!
Markus Schmidt has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Jurgen Klopp makes a half-time substitution. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) comes on in place of Sebastian Kehl.
The substitution is prepared. Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Melvyn Lorenzen.
What a hit! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike wasn't accurate at all and the ball went well wide of the left post.
The score has changed  1:0. Ilkay Gundogan sends a fantastic cross into the box from the corner. Mats Hummels (Dortmund) jumps highest and plants a header down inside the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) will replace Lukasz Piszczek.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him.

OFF THE POST! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Here is a change. Fin Bartels is going off and Viktor Skripnik gives the last tactical orders to Oliver Husing (Werder Bremen).
The manager makes a subsitution with Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) coming on for Zlatko Junuzovic.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Goal - 1:0! Pablo De Blasis tees up Elkin Soto (Mainz) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Manuel Neuer.

Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) struck with a superb free kick from the edge of the box, sending the ball in off the inside of the left post. The goalkeeper didn't have a chance. Simply glorious! It's 1:0.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.
The foul by Elkin Soto (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer. Bayern Munich get a free kick.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) unleashes a promising shot towards the left side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Manuel Neuer thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests. That's a free kick to Bayern Munich.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) replaces Mario Gotze.
Kasper Hjulmand prepares a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Junior Diaz (Mainz).
Substitution. Pablo De Blasis will be replaced by Patrick Pflucke (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli departs the field of play to be replaced by Petar Sliskovic (Mainz).
It's in the back of the net! Thomas Muller plays it into the box, and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the middle of the net. 1:2.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Franck Ribery will be replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich).
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) brings his opponent down. Robert Hartmann has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. B. Monchengladbach are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
It must be a yellow card. It is. Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
It's a goal! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) finds some space in the penalty area and precisely shoots inside the right post.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. He bends the ball into the top right corner. A technically stunning goal.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Patrick Herrmann (B. Moenchengladbach) left the pitch, and Thorgan Hazard (B. Moenchengladbach) is coming on to help his team.
Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) is booked.

A perfect lofted pass from Max Kruse finds Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Raphael Wolf had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Cedric Makiadi.
Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card in the hand of Robert Hartmann. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) is sent from the pitch.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to make a change. Oliver Husing (Werder Bremen) replaces Davie Selke.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) gets a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) comes on in place of Roel Brouwers.

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Raphael Wolf made a crucial save! B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
Here comes a substitution. Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Philipp Bargfrede.
Here is a change. Max Kruse is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! Thorgan Hazard plays a pass to the feet of Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) and he shoots low into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 4:1.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Mitchell Langerak is alert and denies him.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) is furious with himself for wasting a glorious chance. He pounces on the rebound around the penalty spot and drags a shot well wide of the left post.
Goal! Ciro Immobile puts a cross into the box and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) struck a 19-metre free kick into the middle of the goal. The goalkepeer should have saved that.

Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Diego Benaglio, who makes a glorious save!

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal, but it is bravely blocked by a self-sacrificing defender. Wolfsburg force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.

Mitchell Langerak pulls off a great save to deny Vieirinha (Wolfsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. The linesman points to the corner flag, Wolfsburg are going to take it.

Diego Benaglio hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Dortmund will take a corner kick.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Mats Hummels (Dortmund) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. The strike heads towards the left post, but it's deflected away thanks to a wonderful intervention by one of the defenders. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Dortmund.
Dieter Hecking is forced to make a change. Vieirinha is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) comes on.
A brilliant individual effort! Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.

Neven Subotic (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Welz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. Dortmund win a free kick.
It is time for a substitution. Oliver Kirch (Dortmund) is on for Ilkay Gundogan.
A wonderful pass found its target. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) received it well and shot from about 20 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and inside the left post.
Substitution. Luiz Gustavo will be replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
That will be all from Ivan Perisic who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg).
Naldo (Wolfsburg) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the left side of the goal. The score is 2:2.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ronny sends a cross in from the free kick. John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) wins the ball and smashes it low into the middle of the goal, increasing the score to 0:1.
The foul by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.
We are about to witness a substitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Roy Beerens.
Thomas Schaaf decides to make a substitution. Marco Russ will be replaced by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) meets a cross inside the box and produces a powerful header. His effort is so precise Timo Hildebrand is unable to stop it from glancing off the post and going in the right side of the target. The score changes to 0:2.
Goal! Anis Ben-Hatira plays a pass to the feet of Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 0:3.
It's in the back of the net! Haris Seferovic plays it into the box, and Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:3.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge. A free kick has been awarded to Hertha Berlin.

A perfect lofted pass from Makoto Hasebe finds Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Thomas Kraft had no chance of stopping that. 1:3.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Substitution. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Ronny walks off.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It will be a substitution. Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) is ready to enter the pitch as Makoto Hasebe walks off.
Today's referee Guido Winkmann rightly decides to book Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle. A free kick is awarded to Hertha Berlin.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Anis Ben-Hatira and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) gets in a shot, sending the ball into the top left corner. 2:4.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bastian Oczipka departs the field of play to be replaced by Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here is a change. Julian Schieber is going off and Jos Luhukay gives the last tactical orders to Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin).

The ball hits the back of the net! Bamba Anderson showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it into the middle of the net  3:4.
Goal! Stefan Aigner puts a cross into the box and finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 4:4.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) is punished with the yellow card.

Bernd Leno can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.

Oliver Baumann was forced into action to thwart Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Bayer Leverkusen.
Heung-Min Son links up with Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Oliver Baumann is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. It will be a corner kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
The whistle blows and Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked for an infringement. Daniel Siebert interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) rises high to connect with a lofted pass inside the box, but one of his opponents is in the right place at the right time to thwart him.
Substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi makes his way off the pitch and Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but it's just a bit too high and misses the bar by a whisker.
A substitution has been made. Hakan Calhanoglu goes off and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Oliver Baumann is alert and denies him.
Goal! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) scores after an assist by Julian Brandt that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

A neat pass is well received by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim), who is lurking on the edge of the box and produces a low drive directed towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Substitution. Sebastian Rudy is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Gonzalo Castro will be replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) replaces Adam Szalai.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. Bayer Leverkusen have a corner.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom left corner, but Bernd Leno was alert and the score remains the same.
We are about to witness a substitution. Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Karim Bellarabi.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! The ball is out of play. Bayer Leverkusen win a corner kick.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Mario Vrancic clips a neat ball into the box towards Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn), whose header from the centre of the box goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Rafa (Paderborn) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and fires at goal from near the penalty spot, but his effort only hits the left-hand post!
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Kaan Ayhan (Schalke), who attempted to smack the ball away, but instead he sends it inside the right post of his own goal.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Lukas Kruse. 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Roberto Di Matteo decided to make a change. Jan Kirchhoff is replaced by Felipe Santana (Schalke).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dennis Aogo (Schalke) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Marco Hoger (Schalke) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Lukas Kruse was alert and made an amazing save! The ball is out of play. Schalke win a corner kick.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) for a tough tackle. Free kick. Schalke will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Substitution. Max Meyer is replaced by Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke).
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Marco Fritz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
What a sweet touch by Dennis Aogo (Schalke) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Lukas Kruse to hold. Schalke get a corner.
A substitution has been made. Marco Hoger goes off and Christian Fuchs (Schalke) comes on.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) replaces Mahir Saglik.
That was close by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
Brilliant finish. Roman Neustadter (Schalke) plants a low header into the middle, leaving the goalkeeper beaten.
Great ball in from Alban Meha. Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Rafa is given a rest as he is replaced by Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn).
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Lukas Rupp will be replaced by Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn).

What a great chance for Elias Kachunga (Paderborn). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header towards the foot of the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Today's referee Jochen Drees rightly decides to book Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Juan Bernat, but he hits a shot just wide of the left post.

Roman Burki can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich). The ball would have probably ended up inside the right post.
Problems for Pep Guardiola as Mehdi Benatia is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) replaces him.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) finds some space inside the box and scores with a terrific header low inside the left post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jochen Drees ignores the protests.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom left corner. His promising effort is kept out by Roman Burki, who pulls off a stunning save!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Jochen Drees has ended it.
Jochen Drees blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Christian Streich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) comes on the pitch for Oliver Sorg.
Pep Guardiola makes a switch. Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) is coming on in place of Robert Lewandowski at the start of the second period.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets to the rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the right post and makes it 1:0.
Christian Streich is forced to make a change. Felix Klaus is unable to continue due to injury, Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) comes on.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Xabi Alonso and he is replaced by Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich).
Dante (Bayern Munich) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Roman Burki, who pulls off a stunning save!
Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar.

Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it under the roof. Unfortunately for him, Roman Burki makes a great save to stop his effort. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bayern Munich.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Pavel Krmas will be replaced by Christopher Jullien (Freiburg).

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Roman Burki anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the left side of the target.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Mainz have a goal ruled out for offside!
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Kevin Vogt (1. FC Koln) has tested the patience of referee Florian Meyer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Mainz earn a free kick.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Johannes Geis (Mainz).
