Daniel Halfar (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marcel Risse.
Here is a change. Sami Allagui is going off and Kasper Hjulmand gives the last tactical orders to Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Junior Diaz (Mainz) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. It's a free kick to FC Koln in a dangerous position.
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Matthias Lehmann (Koln) for his blatant foul.
Kasper Hjulmand has decided to make a change. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) replaces Jairo Samperio.

This shall not pass! Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender. FC Koln will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Kasper Hjulmand decides to make a substitution. Junior Diaz will be replaced by Philipp Wollscheid (Mainz).
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Goal Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart)! Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) was put through by Alexandru Maxim and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pierre-Michel Lasogga trots off the pitch and is replaced by Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.
Felix Brych shows a red card with no hesitation. Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
OFF THE BAR! Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Felix Brych has issued a yellow card to Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger).
Joe Zinnbauer prepares a substitution. Valon Behrami is replaced by Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger).
Here's the change. Alexandru Maxim leaves the pitch and Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
A yellow card for a tackle by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Martin Harnik.
Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) attempts to send over a cross in order to find one of his teammates, but an opposition defender averts the danger by intercepting the effort.
Today's match ends for Cleber who will be replaced by Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Great touch by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save! The ball is out of play and Augsburg manage to earn a corner.
After a few rebounds the ball finds its way to Salif Sane (Hannover), who is standing inside the box in the right place and he places it into the bottom right corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Joselu (Hannover) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Joselu (Hannover) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Daniel Baier (Augsburg) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Christian Dingert blows his whistle for an infringement. The referee points to the penalty spot. Hannover are awarded a penalty kick!
Joselu (Hannover) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
Nikola Djurdjic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
The game has come to an end for Markus Feulner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Erik Thommy (Augsburg).
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Daniel Baier (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.

Ron-Robert Zieler hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Substitution. Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Manuel Schmiedebach walks off.
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Miiko Albornoz will be replaced by Christian Pander (Hannover).
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Hiroshi Kiyotake departs the field of play to be replaced by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Rafa (Paderborn) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him and his teammates, it's into his own goal!
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Christian Strohdiek (Paderborn) for his blatant foul. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Wolfsburg.

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the bottom left corner, but Lukas Kruse pulls off a superb save. The ball is out of play. Wolfsburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Andre Breitenreiter decided to make a change. Daniel Bruckner is replaced by Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn).
Naldo (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee. The referee makes the call - penalty to Paderborn!
Alban Meha (Paderborn) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.

Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Lukas Kruse shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
A header by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Lukas Kruse, who makes a nice save.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is obviously very disappointed with his shot from the rebound. He aims exactly at the goalkeeper's gloves. This should have been an easy goal! The ball is out of play and Wolfsburg manage to earn a corner.
Substitution. Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Sebastian Jung walks off.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) replaces Ivan Perisic.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Moritz Stoppelkamp is replaced by Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the right side of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn) comes onto the pitch so that Elias Kachunga can be given a rest.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Bas Dost will be replaced by Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).

Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his low effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Diego Benaglio. The linesman points to the corner flag, Paderborn are going to take it.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the roof of the net.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Peter Gagelmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Stefan Kieling (Bayer Leverkusen) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Now Bayer Leverkusen with a corner.

It's a goal! Thorgan Hazard delivers a teasing cross from the resulting corner and the ball falls into the space where Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) is lurking. His precise shot from close range goes into the bottom right corner and it's 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Peter Gagelmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The main referee, Peter Gagelmann, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) is given a yellow card for dissent.

Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) for Heung-Min Son.
Peter Gagelmann shows a yellow card to Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Hakan Calhanoglu.
A substitution has been made. Patrick Herrmann is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Here is a change. Thorgan Hazard is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Max Kruse.
Whoa! Such gestures are commonly penalised and Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) duly receives a yellow card.
That's it for today, Peter Gagelmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Sami Allagui (Mainz) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom left corner is thwarted by Sven Ulreich. The ball goes behind for a corner. Mainz will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) beats the goalkeeper with a superb 22-metre free kick. His shot goes inside the left hand post and ends in the back of the net.
A yellow card for a tackle by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Bastian Dankert starts the second half.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Bastian Dankert lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
The manager makes a subsitution with Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Oriol Romeu.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
The substitution is prepared. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Florian Klein.
Kasper Hjulmand decides to make a substitution. Sami Allagui will be replaced by Filip Djuricic (Mainz).
Goal! Alexandru Maxim slips it to Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 1:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Elkin Soto (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Yunus Malli cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Kasper Hjulmand prepares a substitution. Jairo Samperio is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
The ball from the resulting corner kick slipped through the box to Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), who instantly fires a low shot towards the left side of the goal, but his effort is blocked. So unlucky.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Filip Djuricic (Mainz), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Timo Werner goes off the pitch and Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
CLOSE! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Manuel Neuer (Bayern Munich), who makes a comfortable save.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the left post is thwarted by Alex Manninger.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
Franck Ribery swings the cross over. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.

Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the right side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.

It's in the back of the net! Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) rises high to meet the free kick from Franck Ribery and heads home from the six-yard box, sending the ball in off the bottom of the right post. 0:1.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes himself some space on the edge of the penalty area and pulls the trigger. His accurate effort goes in off the left post and the score changes to 0:0.
Substitution. Nikola Djurdjic makes his way off the pitch and Sascha Molders (Augsburg) comes on as his replacement.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) did a great job as he collected a nice pass and managed to slam the ball into the bottom left corner from about 22 metres out. His finish was totally clinical, it even glanced off the post on its way in.
That's the end of the game for Tobias Werner, who is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Alex Manninger is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 0:4.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

The referee blows his whistle as Ronny Marcos (Hamburger) was too aggressive in his challenge. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Freiburg.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the bottom left corner, but it's not enough to beat Jaroslav Drobny who easily stops the effort.
Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is replaced by Julian Schuster.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the bottom right corner. The effort, however, is blocked by Jaroslav Drobny, who pulls off a stunning save!

Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Cleber (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.

The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Problems for Jurgen Klopp as Henrikh Mkhitaryan is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) replaces him.

Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Mitchell Langerak is just a bystander as the ball flies into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:0.

Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Mitchell Langerak made a crucial save!
Gunter Perl has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
Jurgen Klopp makes a switch. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) is coming on in place of Sebastian Kehl at the start of the second period.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot towards the roof of the net. His promising effort is kept out by Thomas Kraft, who pulls off a stunning save!
Anis Ben-Hatira goes off the pitch and Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Jos Luhukay prepares a substitution. Per Skjelbred is replaced by Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin).
John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) earns the yellow card.

Here is a change. Neven Subotic is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).

Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the top right corner is denied by a decent save from Thomas Kraft. The ball goes behind for a corner. Dortmund will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Thomas Kraft (Hertha Berlin) gets booked.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Wow, what an escape. Max Meyer (Schalke) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The ball goes out of play and Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.
Christian Fuchs plays a lovely pass into Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Kevin Wimmer (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Brych has ended it.
The second half has just started.

Yannick Gerhardt produces a sweet pass and picks out Anthony Ujah (Koln) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:0!
Dusan Svento (1. FC Koln) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Ralf Fahrmann is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The game has come to an end for Tranquillo Barnetta. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Christian Clemens (Schalke).
Felix Brych blows his whistle after Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. That is a penalty kick for FC Koln.
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) steps up to take the penalty and brilliantly fires the ball into the top left corner.
Substitution. Marcel Risse leaves the pitch and is replaced by Dominic Maroh (Koln).

Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Ralf Fahrmann makes a decent save to deny his effort directed low to the middle of the target.
The substitution has been made. Leroy Sane (Schalke) has replaced Christian Fuchs.
Substitution. Dusan Svento makes his way off the pitch and Thomas Broker (Koln) comes on as his replacement.
It will be a substitution. Sidney Sam (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Max Meyer walks off.
Atsuto Uchida displays his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross deep into the box. Leroy Sane (Schalke) gets onto the scoresheet by superbly heading it into the roof of the net  1:2.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Joselu (Hannover) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Richard Strebinger makes a great save to stop his effort.
Goal! Lars Stindl (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Tobias Welz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him. Werder Bremen earn a free kick.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) takes a wonderful free kick and curls the ball into the top left corner with an absolutely phenomenal strike!
Here's the change. Janek Sternberg leaves the pitch and Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) comes on as a substitute.
The match has reached half-time.
Tobias Welz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Spectacular goal! Melvyn Lorenzen (Werder Bremen) brilliantly darts into the box to latch on to a cross and buries the ball into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper stunned!
Melvyn Lorenzen goes off the pitch and Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) comes on.

Hiroshi Kiyotake is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Joselu (Hannover) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 2:2.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 2:3.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Welz ignores the protests.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A substitution has been made. Manuel Schmiedebach goes off and Salif Sane (Hannover) comes on.
Viktor Skripnik decides to make a substitution. Levent Aycicek will be replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Fantastic team goal! Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) was set free in the area by Alejandro Galvez and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 3:3.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Hiroshi Kiyotake will be replaced by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Jimmy Briand is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).
Tobias Welz shows the yellow card to Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Markus Gisdol is forced to make a change. Niklas Sule is unable to continue due to injury, Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) comes on.
What was Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.

It's in the back of the net! Roberto Firmino slips the ball through to Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Goal! Bastian Oczipka puts a cross into the box and finds Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 1:1.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Anthony Modeste.

A nice lofted cross finds Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) unmarked. He takes an excellent touch and gets in a shot that goes towards the middle of the net. An easy save for the goalkeeper, though. The ball is out of play. Hoffenheim will have a chance to score from a corner.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound and converts it into an easy goal.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Jochen Drees didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee signals a substitution. Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Takashi Inui.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) converts a killer cross with a powerful low shot that goes into the middle of the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Stendera leaves the pitch and Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) replaces Tarik Elyounoussi.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Stefan Aigner did his best and is replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Eintracht Frankfurt get a free kick.
That's the end of the game for Sebastian Prodl, who is replaced by Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

OFF THE POST! Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a nice cross deep inside the 18-yard box and produces a fine header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper is well positioned and punches the ball away, deflecting it onto the post.
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the rebound into the top left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.

A perfectly taken corner kick. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of it and produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot into the bottom right corner, increasing the score of today's match  1:1.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:1.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Raphael Wolf limps off the pitch to be replaced by Richard Strebinger (Werder Bremen).
CHANCE! Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
What a great touch by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen)! He picks up a precise pass and produces a long-range shot, but his fabulous effort smashes off the right post!
Great touch by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) as he receives a precise pass deep in the box. He rips a snap shot and the ball bounces off the goalkeeper's gloves and hits the post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) and he fired home from close range. The score is 3:1.
Felix Kroos goes off the pitch and Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) comes on.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a perfect cross from Bastian Oczipka deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a low shot into the middle of the goal. The score has changed to 4:1.
Fin Bartels provides Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Goal! Takashi Inui tees up Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the right side of the goal. 5:2.
Here's the change. Takashi Inui leaves the pitch and Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Thomas Schaaf prepares a substitution. Alexander Meier is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) is leaving the pitch, and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace him.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle. A free kick has been awarded to Eintracht Frankfurt.

Crossbar! Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from around the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball crashed against the bar!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked. The ball is out of play. Hamburger SV will have a chance to score from a corner.
Goal! Cleber (Hamburger) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
CHANCE! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the left post.
Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Nicolai Muller (Hamburger), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Nikolce Noveski (Mainz) handles the ball inside the penalty area. Hamburger SV are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
Kasper Hjulmand decides to make a substitution. Junior Diaz will be replaced by Elkin Soto (Mainz).

Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Loris Karius guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Ja-Cheol Koo as he is replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Kasper Hjulmand has decided to make a change. Yunus Malli (Mainz) replaces Filip Djuricic.
Elkin Soto (Mainz) makes room to connect with a cross, but his strike from the penalty spot isn't accurate at all and the ball goes well over the bar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) replaces Rafael van der Vaart.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) rises high to beat the goalkeeper with a perfect header. He heads the ball into the roof of the net.
Here is a change. Artjoms Rudnevs is going off and Joe Zinnbauer gives the last tactical orders to Gojko Kacar (Hamburger).
A substitution has been made. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is replaced by Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) breaks into the penalty area but his shot is blocked.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle. There is a free kick near the sideline to Bayern Munich.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Pep Guardiola has made a change at the break. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) has come on in place of Mario Gotze.
Goal! Xabi Alonso provides Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 1:0.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Here comes a substitution. Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Lars Bender.
Roger Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Heung-Min Son will be replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Knut Kircher lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Stefan Kiessling.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) for Thomas Muller.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Knut Kircher and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Here's the change. Robert Lewandowski leaves the pitch and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
The foul by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.

Perfectly taken free kick! Thorgan Hazard sends the ball in, Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low in the back of the net. It's 1:0.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. Some classy goalkeeping by Thomas Kraft stops the ball out of the bottom right corner.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and drills a good shot to the middle of the goal. Thomas Kraft shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop the effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ronny (Hertha Berlin) for Nico Schulz.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

It's a goal! Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Anis Ben-Hatira and planted his close-range header into the bottom right corner. Yann Sommer was helpless.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the left side of the goal, but Thomas Kraft was alert and made a comfortable save.
Goal Raffael (B. Monchengladbach)! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) was put through by Alvaro Dominguez and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Booking. Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin) receives a caution from the referee.
The game has come to an end for Raffael. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Today's referee Marco Fritz rightly decides to book Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.
The substitution has been made. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) has replaced Anis Ben-Hatira.
Jos Luhukay decides to make a substitution. Hajime Hosogai will be replaced by Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.

Thomas Kraft makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of inside the left post. B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.

Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Thomas Kraft makes a brilliant save! The ball goes out of play. B. Monchengladbach are awarded a corner kick.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Goal! The rebound fell to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) and he fired home from close range. The score is 3:1.
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard walks off the pitch and Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Max Kruse is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).

An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach). Marco Fritz saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul. Penalty awarded! Hertha Berlin will take a penalty kick.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Marco Fritz lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
What a big chance! Dusan Svento (Koln) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
It's in the back of the net! Pawel Olkowski plays it into the box, and Anthony Ujah (Koln) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the right post. 1:0.
Pawel Olkowski (Koln) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

Pawel Olkowski (Koln) sends a lofted cross into the penalty area. Unfortunately for him, the opponent's defence deals with his cross comfortably and intercepts it. Kevin Vogt (Koln) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.

A neat pass is well received by Jonas Hector (Koln), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot. The referee blows his whistle, FC Koln are awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Peter Stoger has made a change at the break. Adam Matuszczyk (1. FC Koln) has come on in place of Dusan Svento.
Goal! Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.

What a big chance! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
The substitution has been made. Thomas Broker (Koln) has replaced Marcel Risse.
Substitution. Sascha Molders (Augsburg) has come on for Nikola Djurdjic.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Tobias Werner can be given a rest.
It's time for a substitution. Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) comes on in place of Dominik Kohr.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Stunning strike! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise through ball from Ivan Perisic before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:1.
Goal! Jimmy Briand produces a brilliant lofted pass and Joselu (Hannover) gets on the end of it to finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Lars Stindl (Hannover) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Hannover will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Ivica Olic and he is replaced by Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).
Here is a change. Jimmy Briand is going off and Tayfun Korkut gives the last tactical orders to Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).
Hiroshi Kiyotake goes off the pitch and Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes on.
It's in the back of the net! Ivan Perisic puts the ball on a plate for Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:2.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Marcelo (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Ceyhun Gulselam is replaced by Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
It will be a substitution. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Vieirinha walks off.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Markus Schmidt ignores the protests.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
The referee signals a substitution. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Ivan Perisic.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
The foul by Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
Markus Schmidt is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Peter Sippel blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from Freiburg is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) gives no chance to the keeper and converts the penalty with a sharp low drive into the left side of the net.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Andre Breitenreiter makes a half-time substitution. Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) comes on in place of Patrick Ziegler.
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Peter Sippel didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
What a chance! The ball rebounds out to Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) and his strike from the edge of the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Here is a change. Marvin Bakalorz is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Mario Vrancic (Paderborn).
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
The substitution is prepared. Karim Guede (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sebastien Freis.
Lukas Kruse pulls off a great save to deny Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Sippel ignores the protests.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mike Frantz (Freiburg) replaces Admir Mehmedi.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Jens Wemmer is replaced by Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn).
Substitution. Pavel Krmas makes way for Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg).
Goal! Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the bottom left corner.
The foul by Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Peter Sippel.
The booking goes to Karim Guede (Freiburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Tranquillo Barnetta floats a lovely ball in from the free kick to Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke), and he slots the ball into the bottom left corner to increase the score to 0:1.
An unlucky rebound falls to Max Meyer (Schalke) and he scores with a bullet header.
Gooal! Tranquillo Barnetta takes over corner duties. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the top right corner. 0:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Moritz Leitner.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Sven Ulreich with a fabulous save.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Huub Stevens has made a change at the break. Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) has come on in place of Sercan Sararer.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Klein leaves the pitch and Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.

Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Sven Ulreich, who pulls off a decent save! Schalke will take a corner kick.

A perfect lofted pass from Tranquillo Barnetta finds Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Sven Ulreich had no chance of stopping that. 0:3.
Christian Clemens (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Max Meyer.

Ralf Fahrmann was forced into action to thwart Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out for a corner. Stuttgart can continue in their attacking effort.
Here comes a substitution. Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Tranquillo Barnetta.
Substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting makes his way off the pitch and Leroy Sane (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
That's it for today, Florian Meyer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
It's a goal! Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 1:0.
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
The foul by Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) comes on the pitch for Sven Schipplock.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Nice individual effort by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.

Mats Hummels (Dortmund) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. Dortmund have a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

A great individual effort by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) as he made a yard for himself and shot from the edge of the box. His attempt went towards the right side of the goal, but Oliver Baumann made a sensational reflex save and punched the ball onto the post! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Dortmund.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang plays a lovely pass into Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Pirmin Schwegler goes off the pitch and Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a change. Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) replaces Sebastian Rudy.
Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) squandered a big chance from inside the box, firing his volley narrowly over the bar. What a waste. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Adrian Ramos walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund).
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Felix Zwayer lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ilkay Gundogan trots off the pitch and is replaced by Matthias Ginter (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Superb finishing from Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt). Marco Russ plays a fantastic through ball and finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:0.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Felix Wiedwald is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) jumps for a header from a cross on the edge of the box and produces a decent effort towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper manages to block the attempt.

Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the right post.

This was a piece of cake for Felix Wiedwald. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) misses a great chance. He gets to the rebound inside the box and sees his shot smash against the left post!
Shinji Kagawa slides a brilliant pass into Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Felix Wiedwald pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Lukasz Piszczek and he is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
A big opportunity missed by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt). He got on the ball inside the box and thumped a splendid first-time shot on goal, but it went narrowly wide of the left post.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.

Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) strikes a promising volley towards goal, but one of the defenders is quick enough to step in and make a crucial block. It will be a corner kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.

Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Felix Wiedwald is alert and denies him with a nice save. Dortmund force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Stendera trots off the pitch and is replaced by Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Stefan Aigner sends a terrific cross into the box. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just wide of the right post.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Shinji Kagawa walks off the pitch to be replaced by Milos Jojic (Dortmund).
Substitution. Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Sebastian Kehl walks off.
Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.

Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) has the opportunity to threaten the opponent's goal via a free kick on the edge of the box. He hits a fine strike towards the top right corner, but Felix Wiedwald denies him with a great save. Dortmund force a corner. They send men into the box.
Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) is yellow-carded.
The game has come to an end for Takashi Inui. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Today's match ends for Stefan Aigner who will be replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!

What a great chance for Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) jumps above the defenders in order to convert a lofted cross with a nice header. Diego Benaglio makes a reflexive save to block his effort from hitting the net.
Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.

A great touch by Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) as he latches on to a brilliant cross inside the box. He drills a low shot towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper reacts superbly to keep the ball out. What a stunning reflex save!
A goal, which was scored by Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg), was disallowed due to offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andre Hahn trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
A substitution has been made. Max Kruse goes off and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) was probably a bit loose with his words to Wolfgang Stark, who decides to show him a yellow.
Substitution. Ivan Perisic did his best and is replaced by Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Arnold leaves the pitch and Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Havard Nordtveit (B. Moenchengladbach) left the pitch, and Branimir Hrgota (B. Moenchengladbach) is coming on to help his team.
Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Substitution. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) in, Ivica Olic out.
That's it for today, Wolfgang Stark has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) fires a rebound from close range onto the bar!
A yellow card for a tackle by Hiroki Sakai (Hannover). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) sends an accurate low shot inside the right post from the 17-metre free kick.
Goal! Jin-Su Kim passes the ball to the feet of Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 2:0.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Christian Schulz (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
A wonderful header! Lars Stindl (Hannover) leaps high for a rebound and nicely beats the goalkeeper.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Brych has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Hiroki Sakai.

Goal! Jimmy Briand displays great vision and sends a pass to Joselu (Hannover), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:2.
What a hit that is! Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) scores a great goal from approximately 21 metres out. His effort goes straight into the left side of the goal and he makes it 3:2.
Here's the change. Steven Zuber leaves the pitch and Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.

Perfectly taken free kick!Pirmin Schwegler sends a cross in and Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes low into the middle of the net and the score changes to 4:2.
Pirmin Schwegler comes off the pitch to be replaced by Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim).
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Hannover are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Substitution. Jimmy Briand walks off the pitch and Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Sven Schipplock did his best and is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim).
Lars Stindl (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Manuel Schmiedebach makes way for Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
Goal! Artur Sobiech puts the ball on a plate for Lars Stindl (Hannover), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 4:3.

What a chance that is! Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Joselu (Hannover) gets a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Tim Matavz doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch to replace him.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) fires the resultant free kick towards the left post, but the keeper makes a brilliant save and denies him the chance to score. The referee points to the corner flag and Augsburg will take a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Cleber (Hamburger) is coming onto the pitch as Heiko Westermann cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs displays great vision and sends a pass to Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Jochen Drees has ended it.
The whistle blows and Jochen Drees starts the second half.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
It's in the back of the net! Baba Rahman plays it into the box, and Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:1.
Ashton Gotz (Hamburger) receives a yellow card. We are about to witness a penalty kick. The referee points directly to the penalty spot.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Jochen Drees has issued a yellow card to Cleber (Hamburger).
Substitution. Nicolai Muller makes his way off the pitch and Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rafael van der Vaart trots off the pitch and is replaced by Julian Green (Hamburger).

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
Substitution. Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Halil Altintop walks off.
Substitution. Raul Bobadilla makes way for Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
Baba Rahman (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jochen Drees had an easy-decision to make.
Tempers flare after Julian Green (Hamburger) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Jochen Drees is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Thorsten Kinhofer blows his whistle after Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. PENALTY to FC Koln! Great chance to score.
Thorsten Kinhofer shows the yellow card to Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the top of the net.

Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Timo Horn makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom left corner. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling walks off the pitch and Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Thorsten Kinhofer ignores the protests.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Dusan Svento (Kln) is leaving the pitch, and Sawomir Peszko (Kln) will replace him.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 2:1.
The game is interrupted. Kevin Wimmer (Koln) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Timo Horn is alert and denies him with a nice save.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Lars Bender cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yuya Osako (Koln) comes onto the pitch so that Miso Brecko can be given a rest.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bard Finne (Koln) will replace Dominic Maroh.
Fantastic team goal! Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) was set free in the area by Heung-Min Son and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the right side of the net. 3:1.
Substitution. Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Hakan Calhanoglu walks off.

An absolutely sensational volley by Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went in just under the crossbar. All credit to Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen), excellent finish.

Goal Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen)! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) was put through by Josip Drmic and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 5:1.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Thomas Muller plays a lovely pass into Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
What a hit that is! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) scores a great goal from approximately 20 metres out. His effort goes straight into the left side of the goal and he makes it 0:1.

What a big chance! Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Anis Ben-Hatira as he is replaced by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Julian Schieber did his best and is replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
A goal, which was scored by Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin), was disallowed due to offside.
Substitution. Mario Gotze leaves the pitch and is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch so that Valentin Stocker can be given a rest.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Thomas Muller walks off the pitch to be replaced by Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich).
Great chance! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a hit! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the middle of the net. 1:0.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) makes a yard for himself as he picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and quickly drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper pulls off a comfortable save to keep the ball from hitting the net. Mainz have been awarded a corner kick.

It's unbelievable, Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) blows a huge opportunity! He is totally unmarked and fires a first-time shot towards goal from a few yards out, but Loris Karius reacts superbly to keep the ball out.

It's a goal! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box low into the middle of the target. The assist goes to Max Meyer and the score changes to 2:0.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Loris Karius guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Goal! The rebound fell to Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Gunter Perl has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Jan Kirchhoff comes off for Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke).
A wonderful pass found its target. Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) received it well and shot from about 25 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and inside the right post.
Substitution. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Sami Allagui walks off.
Fantastic team goal! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) was set free in the area by Maxim Choupo-Moting and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom right corner. 4:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli (Mainz) replaces Junior Diaz.
Marco Hoger (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests.
Substitution. Elkin Soto (Mainz) has come on for Joo-Ho Park.
A yellow card for a tackle by Roman Neustadter (Schalke). Gunter Perl doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leroy Sane (Schalke) will replace Max Meyer.
Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) takes the resulting free kick from 30 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the right side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann is alert and keeps the ball out.
Roberto Di Matteo has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christian Clemens (Schalke) replacing Christian Fuchs.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A goal, which was scored by Davie Selke (Werder Bremen), was disallowed due to offside.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) takes the free kick from mid-range and finds the back of the net with the goalkeeper rooted to the spot.

Lukas Kruse can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Davie Selke (Werder Bremen). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) for a tough tackle.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Patrick Ziegler comes off for Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) tried his luck from a long-range free kick, but the effort came back off the left post!
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Wonderful finish from Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen). He drills a low shot precisely into the bottom left corner. No chance for the goalkeeper.
Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
The substitution has been made. Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) has replaced Mario Vrancic.

Janek Sternberg (Werder Bremen) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top left corner. Lukas Kruse pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball goes out of play. Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.

Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Raphael Wolf makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. Paderborn have been awarded a corner kick.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) for Izet Hajrovic.
Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alban Meha (Paderborn) will replace Moritz Stoppelkamp.

Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Lukas Kruse stops the ball from going into the top of the net. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Werder Bremen.

Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) receives a sweet pass into the box that puts him in a one-on-one against the goalkeeper. He accepts this chance and rips a shot into the top left corner. Brilliant finish!
Substitution. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) has come on for Levent Aycicek.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Alejandro Galvez and he is replaced by Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen).
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Lukas Kruse stops the ball from going inside the left post.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Knut Kircher had an easy-decision to make.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
Unbelievable miss! Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) jumps for a header from a cross and puts the ball past the helpless goalkeeper.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.

A wonderful pass found its target. Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) received it well and shot from about 30 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner.
Sven Ulreich pulls off a great save to deny Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) looks on in disbelief after missing his chance. He fires the rebound onto the crossbar!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
The whistle blows and Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is booked for an infringement.
Goal! Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 1:2.
Substitution. Felix Klaus will be replaced by Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg).

Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the roof of the net is blocked by Sven Ulreich, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play. Freiburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Sercan Sararer as he is replaced by Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart).

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) meets a perfect cross from Moritz Leitner on the edge of the penalty area and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike straight into the bottom left corner. It's 1:1.
