What an awful challenge. The referee Manuel Grafe has no other option than to send Stefan Mitrovic (Freiburg) off the pitch. Red card! Another situation results in a direct free kick for Stuttgart.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) has too much to say to the referee and receives a caution.

The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance! The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sebastien Freis leaves the pitch and Dani Schahin (Freiburg) comes on.
Moritz Leitner goes off the pitch and Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.

Superb finishing from Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart). Gotoku Sakai plays a fantastic through ball and finds Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a close-range shot past the goalkeeper. It's 1:2.
The referee signals a substitution. Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Admir Mehmedi.
Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Carlos Gruezo.

Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Roman Burki pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball goes out for a corner. Stuttgart can continue in their attacking effort.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Thorsten Kinhofer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. A free kick has been awarded to Augsburg.
RED CARD! Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Thorsten Kinhofer. He can have an early bath.
Sven Ulreich pulls off a great save to deny Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Thorsten Kinhofer shows a yellow card to Tobias Werner (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Daniel Ginczek will be replaced by Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart).
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) has a good opportunity as he meets a cross on the edge of the six-yard box and heads it towards the target. One of the defenders stands on the goal line and manages to keep the ball out.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) is given a yellow card. Stuttgart earn a free kick.
The manager makes a subsitution with Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg) coming on for Sascha Molders.
Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) touches the ball with his hand inside the box! Augsburg are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) takes the penalty and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom the right corner!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Thorsten Kinhofer had an easy-decision to make.
Armin Veh has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sercan Sararer (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Moritz Leitner.
Armin Veh decides to make a substitution. Martin Harnik will be replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
A substitution has been made. Markus Feulner goes off and Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) comes on.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) will replace Tobias Werner.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Raphael Wolf pulls off a great save to deny Mohamed Gouaida (Hamburger), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee. Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) takes the ball and sets it for the free kick.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Jaroslav Drobny shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Free kick. Werder Bremen will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. Hamburger SV will take a corner kick.
Substitution. Izet Hajrovic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen).
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Lewis Holtby will be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
Substitution. Nils Petersen makes his way off the pitch and Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) comes on as his replacement.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.

Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the bottom right corner, but Jaroslav Drobny produces a fine save to deny him.
Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Joe Zinnbauer has decided to substitute Nicolai Muller and he is replaced by Ashton Gotz (Hamburger).
Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) will replace Rafael van der Vaart.
The substitution has been made. Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) has replaced Theodor Gebre Selassie.
Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
RED CARD! Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Felix Zwayer. He can have an early bath.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) goes on a mazy run, gets into the box and from around the penalty spot he misses the target. What a chance that was!
An unfortunate moment for Raphael Wolf (Werder Bremen), who has scored an own goal.

Raphael Wolf pulls off a great save to deny Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. The linesman makes the right call and Hamburger SV will have a corner.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.

Anthony Ujah (Koln) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) displayed brilliant individual skill before blasting in a shot from inside the box. His terrific effort went straight into the bottom left corner, via a ricochet off the post. Timo Horn had no chance. The score sheet now reads 0:1.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Yannick Gerhardt comes off for Yuya Osako (Koln).
Anthony Ujah (Koln) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Thomas Kraft with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
The manager makes a subsitution with Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) coming on for Valentin Stocker.

What a chance that is! Anthony Ujah (Koln) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Daniel Halfar (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Dusan Svento.
Substitution. Anis Ben-Hatira makes way for Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) left the pitch, and Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is coming on to help his team.
What a chance that is! Pawel Olkowski (Koln) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Brilliant goal! Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) gets on the scoresheet with a perfectly taken free kick. The ball goes inside the right post.
Miso Brecko goes off the pitch and Bard Finne (Koln) comes on.

Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The ball goes out for a corner. Hertha Berlin can continue in their attacking effort.
The yellow card is received by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) fires in a first-time projectile from about 18 metres. Felix Wiedwald stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the bottom left corner.

A huge opportunity wasted! Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) produces a header from a rebound inside the six-yard box. His effort is denied by one of the defenders who is well positioned and clears the ball to safety.
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge. B. Monchengladbach earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but Yann Sommer dives superbly to deny him. His shot went towards the right side of the goal.

Max Kruse slides a brilliant pass into Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and drills a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Felix Wiedwald has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Yann Sommer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Yann Sommer was forced into action to thwart Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Goal! Haris Seferovic tees up Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:1.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Yann Sommer thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Goal! The rebound fell to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:2.
The foul by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
Andre Hahn goes off the pitch and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Thomas Schaaf prepares a substitution. Marc Stendera is replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

A wonderful pass found its target. Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) received it well and shot from about 19 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the bottom right corner.
Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. A free kick has been awarded to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Lucien Favre decides to make a substitution. Havard Nordtveit will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to substitute Stefan Aigner and he is replaced by Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom right corner is thwarted by Yann Sommer. The ball goes out for a corner. Eintracht Frankfurt can continue in their attacking effort.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
A substitution has been made. Haris Seferovic goes off and Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.

Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 23 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the top right corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Peter Gagelmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Peter Gagelmann shows the yellow card to Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge. Hoffenheim have a free kick from a promising distance.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) strikes a shot towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.

Arjen Robben produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises high to head the ball into the bottom left corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:0.
Peter Gagelmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Thomas Muller will be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) left the pitch, and Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) is coming on to help his team.
Substitution. Kevin Volland leaves the pitch and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Jerome Boateng is replaced by Dante (Bayern Munich).

Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Manuel Neuer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich).
It's in the back of the net! Robert Lewandowski picks out Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 3:0.
Substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi makes his way off the pitch and Jin-Su Kim (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Goal - 4:0! Bastian Schweinsteiger laid the ball off to Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich), who unleashed a strong shot from close range into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The foul by Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Peter Gagelmann.
Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Peter Gagelmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) does well to meet a cross from Karim Bellarabi, but he directs his shot just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Stefan Kiessling plays a lovely pass into Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Bernd Leno was alert and made an amazing save! Hannover will take a corner kick.
What a chance! Lars Stindl (Hannover) blasts a first-time shot from inside the box that rattles the left post.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Edgar Prib (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Simon Rolfes comes off for Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) scores after an assist by Gonzalo Castro that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

Lars Stindl (Hannover) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Bernd Leno, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.

It's in the back of the net! Hiroshi Kiyotake flights in the free kick and the ball finds the head of Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover), whose excellent bullet header from the centre of the box goes into the right side of the goal. 1:2.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ron-Robert Zieler to get hold of the ball.
What an opportunity! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) disappointed the fans as he smashed a first-time shot from inside the box against the right post!

Bernd Leno pulls off a great save to deny Lars Stindl (Hannover), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the top of the net. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.

Goal! Roberto Hilbert produces a great pass that finds Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 0:1.
Here is a change. Edgar Prib is going off and Tayfun Korkut gives the last tactical orders to Miiko Albornoz (Hannover).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Artur Sobiech (Hannover) replaces Lars Stindl.
The foul by Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Ceyhun Gulselam is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover).
Substitution. Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Karim Bellarabi walks off.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Stefan Kiessling walks off the pitch to be replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
Johannes Geis floats a lovely ball in from the free kick to Junior Diaz (Mainz), and he slots the ball into the bottom left corner to increase the score to 1:0.

A perfect lofted pass from Admir Mehmedi finds Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Loris Karius had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Jonathan Schmid takes over corner duties and expertly finds Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 1:1.
That will be all from Jairo Samperio who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Sami Allagui (Mainz).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Karim Guede is replaced by Dani Schahin (Freiburg).
Substitution. Filip Djuricic (Mainz) in, Yunus Malli out.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Here is a change. Felix Klaus is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Admir Mehmedi cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Kasper Hjulmand decides to make a substitution. Junior Diaz will be replaced by Nikolce Noveski (Mainz).
Goal! Stefan Bell (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:2.
That's it for full time as Daniel Siebert ends the second half.
The match has just started.

It's a goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) scores with a brilliant shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Erik Durm. The score is now 0:0.
What a big chance! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Andre Breitenreiter is forced to make a change. Uwe Hunemeier is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Michael Heinloth (Paderborn).
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang feeds the ball through to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Andre Breitenreiter has made a change at the break. Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) has come on in place of Idir Ouali.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the top right corner, but Lukas Kruse easily deals with the threat. The ball goes behind for a corner. Dortmund will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That will be all from Shinji Kagawa who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund).
Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the goalkeeper.
Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
Marco Reus has picked up an injury and is replaced by Milos Jojic (Dortmund).
Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
What was Florian Hartherz (Paderborn) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Hartherz leaves the pitch and Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) comes on.
Suleyman Koc takes over corner duties and expertly finds Mahir Saglik (Paderborn), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 1:2.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan comes off the pitch to be replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Stunning strike! Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) latches on to a precise through ball from Marco Hoger before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 1:0.
Goal - 2:0! Kevin-Prince Boateng tees up Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Diego Benaglio.
Christian Fuchs (Schalke) beats the keeper with a superb shot from a long-range free kick.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.
Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Christian Trasch comes off for Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg).
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) for Josuha Guilavogui.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) replaces Ivica Olic.
Substitution. Jan Kirchhoff will be replaced by Joel Matip (Schalke).
Goal! Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:2.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the right of the target.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar will be replaced by Kaan Ayhan (Schalke).
Naldo (Wolfsburg) leaps high to meet a lofted pass around the penalty spot, but his header crashes against the crossbar!
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

A brilliant individual effort! Marco Reus (Dortmund) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach will have a goal kick.

OFF THE POST! Marco Reus (Dortmund) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Henrikh Mkhitaryan passes to Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund), but he produces a wild shot from the edge of the box which goes high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for B. Monchengladbach.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and fires in from the penalty spot, but his effort zooms just over the bar.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Yann Sommer to dive and make a save. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Havard Nordtveit is replaced by Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach).
It's a goal! Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) scores. Unfortunately for him, it's an own goal!

What a great touch by Marco Reus (Dortmund)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
Substitution. Raffael walks off the pitch and Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa will be replaced by Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund).
We are about to witness a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Patrick Herrmann.
Erik Durm (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Sokratis (Dortmund) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Sokratis has picked up an injury and is replaced by Matthias Ginter (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Reus trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
A yellow card for a tackle by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a great save to block a header from Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) after a nice lofted cross.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Knut Kircher after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg)! Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) was put through by Kevin De Bruyne and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Knut Kircher and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Here's the change. Marcell Jansen leaves the pitch and Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Nicolai Muller is replaced by Julian Green (Hamburger).
Substitution. Rafael van der Vaart leaves the pitch and is replaced by Valmir Nafiu (Hamburger).
Substitution. Aaron Hunt did his best and is replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) has come on for Josuha Guilavogui.
The game has come to an end for Ivica Olic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) collects a pass and has an effort from 25 metres out, but it flies just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom right corner, but Thorsten Kirschbaum easily deals with the threat.

This should have been a goal! Sercan Sararer (VfB Stuttgart) sends a killer pass into the box, but Martin Harnik can't trick the opposition's defence and loses possession. It's a throw-in for Stuttgart.

Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) jumped highest to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Zlatko Junuzovic. His header was precise and ended up in the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:0.
Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Great ball in from Sercan Sararer. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.

Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) will replace Eljero Elia.

The ball hits the back of the net! Zlatko Junuzovic delivers a superb cross from the corner kick, Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) finds himself some space inside the box and unleashes an unstoppable shot. His effort goes in off the right post. 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Sercan Sararer.
That's the end of the game for Daniel Schwaab, who is replaced by Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart).

That was close by Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Gotoku Sakai swings the cross over. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
A goal, which was scored by Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen), was disallowed due to offside.
The substitution is prepared. Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Fin Bartels.
Viktor Skripnik has decided to substitute Felix Kroos and he is replaced by Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen).
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Goal Tobias Werner (Augsburg)! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) was put through by Halil Altintop and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Markus Feulner (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The game has begun to heat up. Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Jens Wemmer (Paderborn) forces a pass into the box, but Marwin Hitz is alert and does a great job to rob him of the ball.
Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Jens Wemmer leaves the pitch and is replaced by Marc Vucinovic (Paderborn).
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) for his blatant foul.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

It's a goal! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Paul Verhaegh and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Lukas Kruse was helpless.
Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) has an effort on goal, but he misses to the right of the goal. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) in, Suleyman Koc out.
Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) is replacing Raul Bobadilla.

Tobias Werner produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) rises high to head the ball low into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 3:0.
Substitution. Alban Meha makes way for Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).

Markus Feulner (Augsburg) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top right corner. Lukas Kruse pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Augsburg force a corner. They send men into the box.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tim Matavz departs the field of play to be replaced by Sascha Molders (Augsburg).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Halil Altintop will be replaced by Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg).
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Baba Rahman (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Stefan Bell (Mainz).

Excellent touch by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.
Kasper Hjulmand has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) comes on the pitch for Junior Diaz.
A yellow card for a tackle by Gonzalo Jara (Mainz). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Loris Karius is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play. Bayer Leverkusen will have a chance to score from a corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Sami Allagui (Mainz) is replacing Jairo Samperio.

Loris Karius can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
Today's match ends for Heung-Min Son who will be replaced by Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Julian Brandt walks off.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Markus Schmidt after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) blows a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the left post.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Brosinski goes off and Philipp Wollscheid (Mainz) comes on.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the left post, but is stopped by a great save from Loris Karius and the score remains the same.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Karim Bellarabi.

Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) strikes the ball towards the right side of the goal despite being in a difficult position, but his shot is intercepted by one of the defenders. The linesman makes the right call and Bayer Leverkusen will have a corner.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) for his harsh tackle.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) finds Thomas Muller with a nice pass so he can go on towards the goal. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Felix Wiedwald, who makes a comfortable save.
Goal! The rebound fell to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Florian Meyer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and Robert Lewandowski have been trying to find each other with some accurate passes ever since the match started. These two definitely combine the most and are the team's most creative players. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) jumps above the defenders in order to convert a lofted cross with a nice header. Felix Wiedwald makes a reflexive save to block his effort from hitting the net. Bayern Munich force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:2.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.

Goal! Mario Gotze displays great vision and sends a pass to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:3.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Marc Stendera walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) will replace Robert Lewandowski.
Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Philipp Lahm.
Substitution. Franck Ribery walks off the pitch and Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Felix Wiedwald to get hold of the ball.
Today's match ends for Stefan Aigner who will be replaced by Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Sebastian Rode, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:4.
Substitution. Makoto Hasebe makes his way off the pitch and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as his replacement.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Great chance! Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort. Freiburg get a corner.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal! Christian Gunter (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:0.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Felix Zwayer pulls out a yellow card.
Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) has come on for Max Meyer.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Sidney Sam (Schalke) has had enough and is replaced by Chinedu Obasi (Schalke).
Felix Zwayer rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke).
Substitution. Sebastien Freis did his best and is replaced by Dani Schahin (Freiburg).
Goal! Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.
That will be all from Sebastian Kerk who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke) left the pitch, and Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) is coming on to help his team.
Substitution. Admir Mehmedi makes way for Karim Guede (Freiburg).

Dani Schahin (Freiburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Brilliant finish! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Tobias Strobl, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:0.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Pawel Olkowski (Koln) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the left post.
Matthias Lehmann (Koln) scores a great goal from the resulting free kick from mid-range. He sends the ball directly inside the right post.
Anthony Ujah (Koln) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Oliver Baumann with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:3.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) was waiting for a pass on the edge of the box. The ball duly arrived and he hammered it into the bottom left corner.

Kevin Volland sends a superb cross into the box. Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Timo Horn beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:3.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Yellow card. Anthony Ujah (Koln) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Matuszczyk leaves the pitch and Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) comes on.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make. FC Koln win a free kick.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch because Ermin Bicakcic simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Kevin Vogt (Koln) has tested the patience of referee Gunter Perl and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Pirmin Schwegler slides a brilliant pass into Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Hoffenheim earn a corner.
The game has come to an end for Tarik Elyounoussi. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
It is time for a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) is on for Pirmin Schwegler.
Substitution. Matthias Lehmann will be replaced by Dominic Maroh (Koln).
What a beauty from just outside the box! Pawel Olkowski (Koln) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
Here's the change. Dusan Svento leaves the pitch and Yuya Osako (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
That's it for today, Gunter Perl has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marcelo (Hannover) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom right corner, but Thomas Kraft pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.

Hiroshi Kiyotake produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Jimmy Briand (Hannover) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball inside the right post. What a brilliant finish. 0:1.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Golden chance! Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.

Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Thomas Kraft makes a decent save to deny his effort directed low to the middle of the target.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Fabian Lustenberger cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Peter Sippel and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It's time for a substitution. Ronny (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Valentin Stocker.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His glancing header goes over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.
John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
What was Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The substitution has been made. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) has replaced Genki Haraguchi.

Goal! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Thomas Kraft had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lars Stindl (Hannover) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Artur Sobiech (Hannover) on for Hiroshi Kiyotake.
Substitution. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jimmy Briand walks off.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the right post. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) picks up a caution. FC Koln are awarded the free kick.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) gets on the end of a cross from Dusan Svento, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Sebastian Kerk is replaced by Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
The players claim that Mergim Mavraj (Kln) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. It's a penalty! The ball is in the hands of Vladimir Darida (Freiburg).
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Golden chance! Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.

Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the roof of the net is blocked by Timo Horn, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Freiburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
It is time for a substitution. Anthony Ujah (Koln) is on for Matthias Lehmann.

Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Timo Horn guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Kevin Vogt (Koln) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
A decent save by Roman Burki. Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) finds some space near the penalty spot to meet a cross and head it down to the middle of the goal, but the effort is saved by the goalkeeper.
The substitution has been made. Bard Finne (Koln) has replaced Daniel Halfar.
Sebastien Freis comes off the pitch to be replaced by Karim Guede (Freiburg).
The substitution is prepared. Dani Schahin (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Admir Mehmedi.
Roman Burki (Freiburg) is booked by the referee.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.

Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post! The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Paderborn will have a goal kick.
Goal! Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 1:0.
Jochen Drees shows a yellow card to Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Marcel N'Djeng sends a superb cross into the box. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the top right corner, leaving Lukas Kruse beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card!
The goalkeeper is not tested by the free kick from the edge of the box by Alban Meha (Paderborn) as his effort only hit the wall. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Paderborn.

Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but his fine header towards the bottom right corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. The linesman points to the corner flag, Paderborn are going to take it.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) gets on the scoresheet! He latches on to a cross inside the 6-yard box and powers a header that goes in off the left post.
The substitution has been made. Ronny (Hertha Berlin) has replaced Hajime Hosogai.
The substitution is prepared. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Roy Beerens.
Substitution. Marvin Ducksch makes his way off the pitch and Christian Strohdiek (Paderborn) comes on as his replacement.
Alban Meha (Paderborn) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 18 metres out which goes into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Alban Meha leaves the pitch and is replaced by Suleyman Koc (Paderborn).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) is leaving the pitch, and Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) will replace him.
Mahir Saglik (Paderborn) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Thomas Kraft, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) gets booked for the first time in this match.
It's in the back of the net! Patrick Herrmann plays it into the box, and Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:0.
Goal Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim)! Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) was put through by Steven Zuber and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the left side of the net. 1:1.
Goal! Andre Hahn provides Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a strike into the middle of the goal. 2:1.
It's a yellow card for Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) comes on the pitch for Steven Zuber.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a fantastic save! Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the top right corner, but the effort is kept out. It will be a corner kick for B. Monchengladbach.

Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 3:1.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Oliver Baumann, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
OFF THE BAR! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.

Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Substitution. Anthony Modeste will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Here comes a substitution. Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) has had enough and is replaced by Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim).
The manager makes a subsitution with Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) coming on for Max Kruse.
Martin Stranzl is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch so that Patrick Herrmann can be given a rest.
Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) collects a pin-point pass inside the box and tries a snap shot into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper dives perfectly to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and crashes against the bar. That was a fantastic reflex save. Bayern Munich force their opponents to concede a corner.

OFF THE POST! Good play from Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes the right post! The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Manuel Neuer is alert and denies him.

It's a goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and planted his close-range header into the bottom left corner. Manuel Neuer was helpless.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.

What a great touch by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) as he controls a fine pass into the box and fires the ball to the left post, but the effort is brilliantly blocked. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Mats Hummels is replaced by Neven Subotic (Dortmund).

CHANCE! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot to the bottom right corner, but Roman Weidenfeller produces an excellent save. The ball is out of play and Bayern Munich manage to earn a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Bayern Munich have been awarded a free kick.
Jerome Boateng swings the cross over. Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa makes way for Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund).

Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Roman Weidenfeller is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Thomas Muller leaves the pitch and Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Pierre Aubameyang (Dortmund) left the pitch, and Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) is coming on to help his team.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Manuel Grafe blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Bayern Munich!
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Neven Subotic (Dortmund) for a tough tackle.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Robert Lewandowski comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Florian Meyer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Florian Meyer stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. Hamburger SV are awarded a penalty kick!
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Bernd Leno to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a yellow card. The referee Florian Meyer made the right call.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) for a heavy challenge. Bayer Leverkusen win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Valon Behrami (Hamburger) picks up a yellow card.
Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee. Bayer Leverkusen get a free kick.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The expression of the referee Florian Meyer is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
A yellow card for a tackle by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger). Florian Meyer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is badly mistimed and sails high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.

It is time for a substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Heung-Min Son.
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling makes his way off the pitch and Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.

Today's referee Florian Meyer rightly decides to book Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) for his harsh tackle.
That will be all from Lewis Holtby who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Gojko Kacar (Hamburger).
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) muscles his way past two defenders but his shot from inside the box smashes against the right post!

Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) latches on to a fine cross from the resulting corner and attempts to finish from the edge of the box. His shot, however, misses the target narrowly wide of the left post.
Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Maurice Hirsch (Hannover) for his blatant foul.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Felix Wiedwald leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Felix Wiedwald pulls off a great save to deny Joselu (Hannover), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. Hannover get a corner.
David Kinsombi (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) has had enough and is replaced by Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Sonny Kittel will be replaced by Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Artur Sobiech (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Leonardo Bittencourt.
Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and made an amazing save!

Goal Shinji Okazaki (Mainz)! Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) was put through by Ja-Cheol Koo and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Wolfgang Stark and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
What a big chance! Yunus Malli (Mainz) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Wolfgang Stark blows the whistle, Loris Karius (Mainz) is penalised for a foul. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Werder Bremen.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Loris Karius (Mainz) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the bottom left corner, but it's not enough to beat Loris Karius who easily stops the effort.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) gets to the rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the right post and makes it 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle to start the second half.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) meets a perfect cross from Felix Kroos deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:2.

Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
The substitution is prepared. Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ludovic Obraniak.
The free kick from the edge of the penalty box is taken by Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen). He curls his shot towards the left-hand post, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save to deny him.

Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a daisy-cutter shot towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper produces an amazing acrobatic dive to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and hits the post. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Werder Bremen.

Substitution. Fin Bartels makes his way off the pitch and Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) comes on as his replacement.

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Thorsten Kirschbaum with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Daniel Caligiuri cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Diego Benaglio guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!
Sercan Sararer (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Bastian Dankert had an easy-decision to make.

Sercan Sararer (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the right post.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

It's in the back of the net! Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) rises high inside the six-yard box to meet a cross by Kevin De Bruyne from the free kick. He heads home into the middle of the goal, making the score 0:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
It's a goal! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) scores with a brilliant low shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Vieirinha. The score is now 0:2.
Marcel Schafer goes off the pitch and Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) comes on.

Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, and he produces a promising goal-bound header to the bottom right corner, but Diego Benaglio pulls off a decent save to deny him.
Substitution. Sercan Sararer will be replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
What a sweet touch by Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Thorsten Kirschbaum to hold.
Oriol Romeu comes off the pitch to be replaced by Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart).
Georg Niedermeier is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart).

Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Julian Draxler doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tim Matavz (Augsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alexander Esswein.
The foul by Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.

Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
That will be all from Dominik Kohr who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Erik Thommy (Augsburg).

Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Dennis Aogo (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.

Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Manuel Neuer is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wriggles into space and fires the ball from the edge of the area, but one of the defenders is there to block the effort. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Dante (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The foul by Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.

Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Manuel Neuer pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.

Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) gets a yellow card.
A dangerous towering header by Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) from around the penalty spot goes just over the bar. This corner kick didn't change the score.

That will be all from Thomas Muller who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Manuel Neuer pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. It will be a corner kick for B. Monchengladbach.
