Atsuto Uchida (Schalke) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marco Hoger as he is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim Bellarabi departs the field of play to be replaced by Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen).
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Marco Fritz interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Pavel Krmas (Freiburg). PENALTY to Augsburg! Great chance to score.
Booking. Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) receives a caution from the referee.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) muscles his way past two defenders but his shot from inside the box smashes against the crossbar!

Tim Matavz (Augsburg) receives a lofted pass from the flank and shoots from close range, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) received a killer pass and let fly from close range. Unluckily for him, it flew just wide of the left post.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge. Freiburg earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Marwin Hitz.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
The game is over for Maximilian Philipp. Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) comes on for the second half.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the middle of the goal, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it. The linesman makes the right call and Augsburg will have a corner.
Substitution. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) on for Tim Matavz.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) meets a perfect cross from Alexander Esswein on the edge of the penalty area and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike straight into the bottom left corner. It's 1:0.
It's time for a substitution. Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) comes on in place of Felix Klaus.
Substitution. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) replaces Alexander Esswein.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Oliver Sorg leaves the pitch and Sascha Riether (Freiburg) comes on.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the left post is smartly dealt with by Roman Burki.
A substitution has been made. Halil Altintop is replaced by Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg).

Baba Rahman (Augsburg) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Baba Rahman (Augsburg). This could have been a legendary goal.
A yellow card for a tackle by Daniel Baier (Augsburg). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a sensational goal that would have been! Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 19 metres out. Ron-Robert Zieler stops the effort which is headed for the bottom left corner. Dortmund force a corner. They send men into the box.

What a great chance for Mats Hummels (Dortmund). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) collects a pass and has an effort from 19 metres out, but it flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Joselu (Hannover) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang links up with Marco Reus (Dortmund), who fires just over the bar from the edge of the box.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) was probably a bit loose with his words to Tobias Stieler, who decides to show him a yellow.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Tobias Stieler's book.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Now Dortmund have a corner.
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.

The booking goes to Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund). Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) is ready to take a free kick from a distance of 19 metres. Will he decide to have a direct shot at goal or will he cross the ball into the penalty box?
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) proves that he is an excellent free-kick taker after finding the back of the net with a clever shot that goes straight into the bottom left corner!

Roman Weidenfeller gets a well deserved ovation! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) produces a decent first-time strike towards the left post, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Joselu (Hannover) drills a low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic save.
Substitution. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) in, Ilkay Gundogan out.

Marcelo (Hannover) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee. A cross from the free kick is whipped in by Marco Reus (Dortmund), but one of the defenders steps in and averts the threat.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Marius Stankevicius leaves the pitch to be replaced by Maurice Hirsch (Hannover).
Hiroshi Kiyotake goes off the pitch and Artur Sobiech (Hannover) comes on.
Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Adrian Ramos comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Substitution. Sokratis (Dortmund) on for Erik Durm.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Ron-Robert Zieler stops the ball from going inside right post.
Tobias Stieler blows his whistle and Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) replacing Jimmy Briand.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

What a chance that is! Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees his header crash off the crossbar after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Goal! Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 1:0.
Sercan Sararer (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) was like a fox in the box, burying the ball into the bottom right corner of the goal. Excellent finish!
Goal! Alexandru Maxim provides Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 1:2.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Lucas Piazon is replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Half-time substitution. Takashi Inui is replaced by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Free kick. Stuttgart will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.

Alexandru Maxim produces a sweet pass and picks out Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:2!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Sercan Sararer (VfB Stuttgart) strikes the ball towards the right side of the goal despite being in a difficult position, but his shot is intercepted by one of the defenders. The ball is out of play and Stuttgart manage to earn a corner.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Goal! Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:3.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a perfect cross from Marco Russ deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 3:3.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) for Gotoku Sakai.

GOAL! Marc Stendera curls the free kick into the box. Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Thorsten Kirschbaum and into the bottom left corner. 1:2.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
Sercan Sararer comes off the pitch to be replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.

Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Thorsten Kirschbaum is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Substitution. Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) has come on for Florian Klein.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bamba Anderson departs the field of play to be replaced by Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt).

An amazing individual effort from Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 4:4. Felix Wiedwald was helpless.
Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card. A free kick to Stuttgart.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and fires the ball to the middle of the goal, but Felix Wiedwald is alert and thwarts the effort.
Goal! Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 4:5.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
That will be a straight red card for Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) is forced to stop his attacking move after the linesman signals for offside.
Good defending. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) tries to find Timo Werner inside the box, but the pass is cut out. Stuttgart have a corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Jaroslav Drobny makes a great save to stop his effort.

Great ball in from Roy Beerens. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Jaroslav Drobny with a brilliant diving save!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) makes his way off the pitch and Marcel N'Djeng comes on as his replacement.
Joe Zinnbauer has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Lewis Holtby comes on the pitch for Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Thorsten Kinhofer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) has tested the patience of referee Thorsten Kinhofer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Crossbar! Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.

Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Thomas Kraft guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Brilliant finish! Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Valentin Stocker, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:0.
Corner kick falls to Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin), who attempts to finish. Luck is not on his side today as the ball crashes against the right post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Johnny Heitinga (Hertha Berlin) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:0.
Today's match ends for Rafael van der Vaart who will be replaced by Julian Green (Hamburger).
Substitution. Valmir Nafiu (Hamburger) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Pierre-Michel Lasogga walks off.
Salomon Kalou will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Valentin Stocker.
Fantastic team goal! Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) was set free in the area by Per Skjelbred and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the right side of the net. 3:0.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle for a foul after Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) hacks down one of his opponents. PENALTY to Hoffenheim! Great chance to score.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) fails to convert the penalty kick! His effort hits the left post.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
What a big chance! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Mario Vrancic is replaced by Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn).
Lukas Kruse pulls off a great save to deny Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
It is time for a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) is on for Tarik Elyounoussi.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that Adam Szalai can be given a rest.
Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
Substitution. Idir Ouali (Paderborn) replaces Suleyman Koc.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) stands over the resulting free kick from around 19 metres out, but his terrific effort smashes against the left post!
Goal! Andreas Beck displays great vision and sends a pass to Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lukas Rupp leaves the pitch and Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) comes on.
A yellow card for a tackle by Michael Heinloth (Paderborn). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Idir Ouali (Paderborn) for a tough tackle.
Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Pirmin Schwegler.
Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Golden chance! Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The foul by Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Marcel Risse (Koln) produces a good shot from the resulting free kick. His effort, however, goes just wide of the left post.

That was a nice football moment. Daniel Halfar (1. FC Koln) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Raphael Wolf guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
The expression of the referee Felix Brych is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) wastes an opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires in a terrific shot from long range straight towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one! The ball goes out of play. Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Anthony Ujah (Koln) replacing Daniel Halfar.

Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Raphael Wolf pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The referee points to the corner flag and FC Koln will take a corner.
Goal! Anthony Ujah (Koln) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 0:1.

That was absolutely fantastic! Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the right post! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.
It will be a substitution. Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) is ready to enter the pitch as Luca Caldirola walks off.
It is time for a substitution. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) is on for Izet Hajrovic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dusan Svento departs the field of play to be replaced by Slawomir Peszko (Koln).
Here comes a substitution. Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Cedric Makiadi.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Simon Zoller walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dominic Maroh (Koln).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) strikes the ball towards goal from the middle of the penalty area, but his shot goes straight into the gloves of the goalkeeper.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) meets a cross from the flank and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies totally wide of the left post.
Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.

Takashi Inui looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from just outside of the box towards the bottom right corner and it ricochets in off the post. The score is 0:1.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Lukas Rupp as he is replaced by Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn).
Elias Kachunga will be replaced by Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn).
Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn) scores as he latches on to a pass and unleashes a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes into the top right corner of the goal and past the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Aleksandar Ignjovski leaves the pitch and is replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a precise pass. He pulls the trigger but only hits one of the opposition, who gets in the way of his effort.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.
Here's the change. Slobodan Medojevic leaves the pitch and Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) unleashes a quick low drive into the middle of the net and past the goalkeeper. Here is an example of luck being on your side.
Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Florian Hartherz (Paderborn) will replace Suleyman Koc.
A superb shot by Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) after a mid-range free kick! His attempt, however, flies just over the crossbar.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Stunning strike! Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise through ball from Roberto Firmino before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the back of the net from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:1.
This shall not pass! Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.

Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the top of the net, but Jaroslav Drobny keeps the ball out.

Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt. The ball is out of play. Hamburger SV will have a chance to score from a corner.
Dennis Diekmeier is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Ashton Gotz (Hamburger).

Goal! Tolgay Arslan displays great vision and sends a pass to Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.
Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Sippel ignores the protests.
Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Jaroslav Drobny pulls off a great save to deny Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is replacing Anthony Modeste.

Good touch by Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) is coming onto the pitch as Rafael van der Vaart cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) takes a shot from a mid-range free kick and the ball flies inches wide of the left post!
Substitution. Roberto Firmino will be replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
Yellow card. Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
That will be all from Tolgay Arslan who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).

Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just over the bar.
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Kevin Volland and he is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Maxim Choupo-Moting slides a brilliant pass into Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.

Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) is first to the rebound and sends a header goalwards but it's blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The referee blows his whistle, Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.

A perfect lofted pass from Julian Draxler finds Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Thomas Kraft had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.
Knut Kircher has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Anis Ben-Hatira will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).

Julian Draxler (Schalke) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and smashes the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
The foul by Atsuto Uchida (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Knut Kircher.
The substitution has been made. John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) has replaced Fabian Lustenberger.
Today's match ends for Valentin Stocker who will be replaced by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin).
Kevin-Prince Boateng will be replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) replaces Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke) comes onto the pitch so that Julian Draxler can be given a rest.
Knut Kircher is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) takes the free kick with a powerful low drive that goes inside the left-hand post and ends up behind the goalkeeper. A real jaw dropper!
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle after Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. A penalty is given to Bayern Munich!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) sends Raphael Wolf the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Goal! David Alaba slips it to Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he finds the right side of the net with a great effort. The score is 4:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Eljero Elia is replaced by Marnon Busch (Werder Bremen).
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) comes on the pitch for David Alaba.

Ambitious effort from Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
Here comes a substitution. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Arjen Robben.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) replacing Xabi Alonso.
Felix Kroos goes off the pitch and Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Xherdan Shaqiri, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 5:0.
Substitution. Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Franco Di Santo walks off.
Goal - 6:0! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Thomas Muller provided an assist for the goal.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Yellow card! It's like Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Marco Fritz agrees and books him.
Mats Hummels (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Marco Fritz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Marcel Risse slips it to Kevin Vogt (1. FC Koln) on the edge of the box and he lashes the ball low into the middle of the net. The score is 1:0.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Marco Reus feeds the ball through to Ciro Immobile (Dortmund), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the middle of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
Today's match ends for Dusan Svento who will be replaced by Slawomir Peszko (Koln).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yuya Osako (Koln) will replace Daniel Halfar.
Simon Zoller (Koln) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan walks off the pitch and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Sokratis (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.
It's in the back of the net! Yuya Osako plays it into the box, and Simon Zoller (Koln) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Ciro Immobile and he is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Substitution. Simon Zoller did his best and is replaced by Adam Matuszczyk (Koln).
A yellow card for a tackle by Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
It will be a substitution. Neven Subotic (Dortmund) is ready to enter the pitch as Ilkay Gundogan walks off.
That's it for today, Marco Fritz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Kevin De Bruyne, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:1.

Diego Benaglio gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) towards the top right corner. Nice goalkeeping skills! The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Freiburg.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) tried his luck from a long-range free kick, but the effort came back off the crossbar!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar.

Mike Frantz (Freiburg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and drills a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Diego Benaglio has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
The substitution is prepared. Christian Gunter (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mensur Mujdza.
Substitution. Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) has come on for Mike Frantz.
The substitution has been made. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) has replaced Ivan Perisic.
Substitution. Ivica Olic makes way for Bas Dost (Wolfsburg).
Here comes a substitution. Jonathan Schmid is given a rest as he is replaced by Felix Klaus (Freiburg).
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) misses a big opportunity after striking the ball towards the middle of the goal and the goalkeeper makes an easy save.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri will be replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).
Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

The ball hits the back of the net! Alvaro Dominguez showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it low inside the left post  0:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Havard Nordtveit is replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) takes the free kick with a powerful low drive that goes inside the left-hand post and ends up behind the goalkeeper. A real jaw dropper!
Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) finds his way to the ball inside the box from the free kick, but his header only hits the crossbar.
A substitution has been made. Ceyhun Gulselam is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
The foul by Christian Schulz (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Thorsten Kinhofer.
Golden chance! Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Patrick Herrmann.
Substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt will be replaced by Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
Today's match ends for Raffael who will be replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
Here comes a substitution. Hiroshi Kiyotake is given a rest as he is replaced by Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover).
Thorsten Kinhofer shows a yellow card to Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
Joselu (Hannover) attempts to turn the rebound in from close range. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save and stops the ball from hitting the net. Great goalkeeping.
Brilliant finish! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Thorgan Hazard, then produced a nice strike into the top of the net. The score is 0:3.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and produces a promising first-time shot towards the bottom right corner. His effort is blocked by Marwin Hitz with a brilliant diving save!
It's like he was asking for a caution. Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) receives a yellow card.

An amazing individual effort from Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 1:0. Marwin Hitz was helpless.
Goal! Jairo Samperio (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:0.

Niko Bungert (Mainz) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Tobias Stieler has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. Augsburg are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny his attempt towards the right side of the goal.

Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a sweet strike towards the left side of the goal. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out of the net. Great goalkeeping!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Nikola Djurdjic will not participate anymore and Tim Matavz (Augsburg) is coming on.
That will be all from Marcel de Jong who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Abdul Baba Rahman (Augsburg).

Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Jonas Hofmann is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Sami Allagui (Mainz).
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Sami Allagui (Mainz) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Junior Diaz (Mainz), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) produces a shot from a direct free kick on the edge of the box. His effort sails narrowly over the crossbar. The goalkeeper was lucky there.
That's the end of the game for Dominik Kohr, who is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Jairo Samperio (Mainz) is leaving the pitch, and Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) will replace him.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) heads the ball low inside the left post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Tobias Werner (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Elkin Soto (Mainz) comes onto the pitch for Christoph Moritz.
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes all the way into the top right corner. He makes it 0:1 with this magnificent strike.

What a chance that is! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) muscles his way past two defenders but his shot from inside the box smashes against the left post!

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes a big opportunity! He controls the ball after a nice low pass and shoots from a promising distance. His poor effort goes miles wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Thorsten Kirschbaum with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:3.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The game is over for Antonio Rudiger. Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) comes on for the second half.

It's a goal! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) makes it 0:3. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Florian Klein and planted his close-range header into the bottom left corner. Bernd Leno was helpless.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) left the pitch, and Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on to help his team.
The substitution has been made. Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Moritz Leitner.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Florian Klein (VfB Stuttgart) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the right post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Bernd Leno, so the score changes to 0:3.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a free kick from long range.
Armin Veh has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart).
GOAL! Filip Kostic curls the free kick into the box. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Bernd Leno and into the left side of the net. 1:3.
Here comes a substitution. Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Hakan Calhanoglu.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is leaving the pitch, and Josip Drmi (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace him.

Thorsten Kirschbaum pulls off a fantastic save! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out. Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge. Stuttgart are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) meets a nice cross deep inside the 18-yard box and produces a fine header towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is well positioned and punches the ball away, deflecting it onto the post. The referee blows his whistle, Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the top right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) probably handled the ball. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Mainz!
Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) picked up a yellow card from referee.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Filip Djuricic (Mainz) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Filip Djuricic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Christoph Moritz as he is replaced by Johannes Geis (Mainz).
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Fabian Johnson.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Patrick Herrmann (B. Moenchengladbach) is leaving the pitch, and Andre Hahn (B. Moenchengladbach) will replace him.
It's time for a substitution. Yunus Malli (Mainz) comes on in place of Jonas Hofmann.
Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Wow, what an escape. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Junior Diaz (Mainz) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Diego Benaglio is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The end of the first half.
Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.
It's time for a substitution. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Ivan Perisic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Francisco Caiuby departs the field of play to be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
A substitution has been made. Raul Bobadilla goes off and Tim Matavz (Augsburg) comes on.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) is leaving the pitch, and Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) will replace him.
What a big chance! Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Dominik Kohr makes way for Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg).
A substitution has been made. Maximilian Arnold is replaced by Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg).
Yellow card. Halil Altintop (Augsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the ball towards the right side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders.
Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. Some classy goalkeeping by Timo Horn stops the ball out of the bottom right corner.

Timo Horn hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches wide of the left post.

Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the top right corner, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it. The referee points to the corner flag and Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner.

A perfect lofted pass from Haris Seferovic finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Timo Horn had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Haris Seferovic sends a superb cross into the box. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Timo Horn beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised.
The referee gives a yellow card to Kevin Vogt (Koln).
It's time for a substitution. Slawomir Peszko (Koln) comes on in place of Daniel Halfar.
It's in the back of the net! Kevin Vogt plays it into the box, and Jonas Hector (Koln) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the middle of the net. 2:2.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Anthony Ujah (Koln) for Yuya Osako.

This is really unlucky! Kevin Wimmer (Kln) attempted to clear the ball away after the oppositions corner kick into the box, but he miskicked the clearance and placed it into his own net, specifically into the bottom right corner. He won't enjoy watching the highlights later.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Simon Zoller trots off the pitch and is replaced by Kazuki Nagasawa (Koln).
Good defending. Slawomir Peszko (1. FC Koln) tries to find Anthony Ujah inside the box, but the pass is cut out.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Haris Seferovic as he is replaced by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here comes a substitution. Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has had enough and is replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Alexander Meier will be replaced by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Wolfgang Stark is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) is yellow-carded.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Michael Heinloth (Paderborn) is coming onto the pitch as Jens Wemmer cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 16 metres out which goes into the bottom left corner.
The foul by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl.

Great first touch by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) after collecting a pass deep inside the box. He smashes the ball to the bottom right corner, but the keeper makes a brilliant reflex save and pushes it onto the post! Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.
Goal! Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 1:1.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) shows great individual ability and unleashes a beautiful strike from about 23 metres. His effort heads towards top right corner but is saved by Lukas Kruse. The score remains the same. The ball is out of play. Bayer Leverkusen will have a chance to score from a corner.
Gunter Perl shows the yellow card to Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lars Bender departs the field of play to be replaced by Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen).
Roger Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Hakan Calhanoglu.
Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) takes out his opponent with a nasty slide tackle and receives a straight red card from the referee!
Substitution. Elias Kachunga leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mario Vrancic (Paderborn).
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) gets to the rebound outside the penalty box and unleashes a long-range shot towards the top left corner, Bernd Leno makes a decent save to stop the effort.
Substitution. Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) has come on for Suleyman Koc.
Today's referee Gunter Perl rightly decides to book Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) for his harsh tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robbie Kruse (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Tin Jedvaj cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom right corner is thwarted by Bernd Leno. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Paderborn.
What an outstanding solo effort by Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a perfect cross from Robbie Kruse deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the left post. It's 2:2.

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Lukas Kruse pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going inside the right post.
Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) sees a yellow card from Gunter Perl after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Gunter Perl is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

It's a goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores with a brilliant low shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Rafinha. The score is now 0:0.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.

Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) hammers the ball goalwards from about 70 metres. The shot is directed to the roof of the net but is thwarted by a save from Ron-Robert Zieler. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 18 metres out. Ron-Robert Zieler stops the effort which is headed to the roof of the net. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass just outside the box and drills a glorious strike into the bottom left corner off the post. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Artur Sobiech (Hannover) aims for the middle of the goal, but that's an easy job for the goalkeeper. It will take more than that to test him! The linesman points to the corner flag, Hannover are going to take it.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Joselu will not participate anymore and Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) is coming on.
The game is over for Miiko Albornoz. Christian Pander (Hannover) comes on for the second half.
Substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Xherdan Shaqiri walks off.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
It is time for a substitution. Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) is on for Hiroshi Kiyotake.
Here comes a substitution. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Philipp Lahm.

An amazing individual effort from Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the right side of the goal and makes it 4:0. Ron-Robert Zieler was helpless.
Substitution. Xabi Alonso is replaced by Gianluca Gaudino (Bayern Munich).

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) meets an accurate cross inside the six-yard box and attempts a bullet header, but the goalkeeper denies him and makes the save. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Close! Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Sokratis (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and sends a low drive past the goalkeeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The game is over for Sven Bender. Milos Jojic (Dortmund) comes on for the second half.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) receives a yellow card!
Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger) earns the yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Milos Jojic (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt into the bottom corner fails to beat Roman Weidenfeller, who makes a sensational save.
Substitution. Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger) in, Dennis Diekmeier out.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger). Dortmund are awarded a free kick from long range.
Substitution. Erik Durm did his best and is replaced by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund).
Jaroslav Drobny makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) after a cross from the side.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Kevin Grosskreutz will be replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Good team movement sets up Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.

Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga makes his way off the pitch and Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
Here comes a substitution. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Nicolai Muller.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) releases Adam Szalai, who latched on to his perfect through pass and can continue with his team's attack. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Ralf Fahrmann.
Goal! Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) scores after an assist by Roberto Firmino that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.

Stunning strike! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise through ball from Roberto Firmino before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the roof of the net from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 2:0.
Yellow card. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Yellow card. Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Florian Meyer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Florian Meyer starts the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Marco Hoger is replaced by Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke).
Half-time substitution. Roman Neustadter will not participate anymore and Marvin Friedrich (Schalke) is coming on.
What was Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Adam Szalai leaves the pitch and is replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dennis Aogo (Schalke) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Joel Matip (Schalke) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Christian Fuchs (Schalke) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Here comes a substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting is given a rest as he is replaced by Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke).
RED CARD! Joel Matip (Schalke) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Florian Meyer. He can have an early bath.

Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) unleashes a promising shot towards the left side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Ralf Fahrmann thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same. Corner kick. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity.
What a hit that is! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) scores a great goal from approximately 18 metres out. His effort goes straight into the bottom right corner and he makes it 2:1.
Substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi walks off the pitch and Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.

Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ralf Fahrmann to get hold of the ball.
Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Roberto Firmino. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim).
That's it for full time as Florian Meyer ends the second half.
The match has just started.
Knut Kircher blows his whistle and signals a foul after Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) brought his opponent down. No point in arguing there. Freiburg will take a penalty kick.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!

Goal! Zlatko Junuzovic displays great vision and sends a pass to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the right post. The score is 1:1.
Knut Kircher has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Marc-Oliver Kempf is replaced by Stefan Mitrovic (Freiburg).
Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
Roman Burki pulls off a great save to deny Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.
Mike Frantz has picked up an injury and is replaced by Felix Klaus (Freiburg).
That's a clear yellow card. Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) goes into the book.
Substitution. Eljero Elia will be replaced by Davie Selke (Werder Bremen).
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is coming onto the pitch as Alejandro Galvez cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Karim Guede (Freiburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Admir Mehmedi walks off.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
It's in the back of the net! Florian Klein is the provider as he slips the ball to Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:1.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Thorsten Kirschbaum has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) makes a bad challenge and the referee blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY AWARDED to Hertha Berlin!
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Carlos Gruezo will be replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Thorsten Kirschbaum pulls off a great save to deny Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Johnny Heitinga (Hertha Berlin) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.

Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Thorsten Kirschbaum with a brilliant diving save! The linesman makes the right call and Hertha Berlin will have a corner.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) looks very eager to impress, does well to beat his man and force a cross into the box, where one of his teammates gets his head on the ball, but it's too easy for the keeper. (in this sentence the player crosses and heads his own cross!! So I created a different scenario). Stuttgart will take a corner kick.

An amazing individual effort from Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 2:1. Thorsten Kirschbaum was helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Salomon Kalou trots off the pitch and is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
Johnny Heitinga goes off the pitch and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Substitution. Oriol Romeu leaves the pitch and is replaced by Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart).

Anis Ben-Hatira sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the top of the net. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 3:1.
Substitution. Anis Ben-Hatira will be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).

What a chance! Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) squanders a promising opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the right post!
Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Totally disorientated Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) scores a goal. Unfortunately it's an own goal.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Valon Behrami (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Florian Meyer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and with a precise low drive puts the ball into the middle of the goal.
Lewis Holtby clips a neat ball into the box towards Valon Behrami (Hamburger), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Goal! Lewis Holtby plays a pass to the feet of Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) and he shoots low into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 1:1.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) is leaving the pitch, and Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace him.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to substitute Stefan Aigner and he is replaced by Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Tolgay Arslan makes way for Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch so that Lewis Holtby can be given a rest.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Florian Meyer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Lucas Piazon (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top right corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:2.
Here comes a substitution. Haris Seferovic is given a rest as he is replaced by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Nicolai Muller leaves the pitch and is replaced by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger).
Florian Meyer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the top of the net is smartly dealt with by Marwin Hitz. Hertha Berlin force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Thomas Kraft (Hertha Berlin) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him. Augsburg are about to take a penalty!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a low shot inside the left post.
Yellow card. Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Johnny Heitinga (Hertha Berlin) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Raul Bobadilla goes off the pitch and Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Johnny Heitinga is given a rest as he is replaced by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
A substitution has been made. Genki Haraguchi is replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Ronny Philp (Augsburg) will take his place on the pitch.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball low inside the left post, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players.

The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) replaces Dominik Kohr.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. The strike heads towards the right post, but it's deflected away thanks to a wonderful intervention by one of the defenders.

Marnon Busch (Werder Bremen) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
Peter Sippel has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Peter Sippel starts the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Sebastian Jung is given a rest as he is replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).

A perfect lofted pass from Vieirinha finds Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Raphael Wolf had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
Substitution. Nils Petersen leaves the pitch and is replaced by Davie Selke (Werder Bremen).
Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is replacing Aaron Hunt.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is coming onto the pitch as Izet Hajrovic cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The substitution is prepared. Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ivica Olic.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) goes for goal but he directs his effort just wide of the left post.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.

What a wasted opportunity by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich)! He creates himself some space inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the left side of the goal, but Timo Horn makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
