Adam Matuszczyk (Koln) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
Anthony Ujah (1. FC Koln) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net. The ball is out of play and FC Koln manage to earn a corner.
Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
That was close by Jonas Hector (1. FC Koln)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jerome Boateng leaves the pitch and Dante (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mehdi Benatia (Bayern Munich) replacing Thomas Muller.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yannick Gerhardt departs the field of play to be replaced by Marcel Risse (Koln).
What a bad luck! Daniel Halfar (Kln) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arjen Robben trots off the pitch and is replaced by Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich).
Kevin Vogt (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Halfar.
Substitution. Bard Finne (Koln) in, Anthony Ujah out.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
CHANCE! Felix Klaus (Freiburg) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the right post.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Booking. Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a caution from the referee.

Christian Gunter (Freiburg) releases a promising shot from the free kick on the edge of the box. His effort towards the bottom left corner is comfortably saved by Bernd Leno. Freiburg force their opponents to concede a corner.
Felix Brych has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Here's the change. Felix Klaus leaves the pitch and Sascha Riether (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) slams the ball goalwards from 40 metres out, but his decent effort flies a whisker over the crossbar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Julian Schuster (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Roman Burki makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is leaving the pitch, and mer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace him.
Substitution. Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Karim Guede walks off.

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the left side of the target, but Roman Burki easily deals with the threat.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) didn't hesitate to shoot from around the penalty spot and aimed towards the top of the net. Roman Burki was alert, made a superb save and parried the ball onto the bar.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Felix Brych shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
Substitution. Marc Torrejon (Freiburg) has come on for Jonathan Schmid.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Lars Bender will be replaced by Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen).
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a brilliant effort from the free kick, but the ball crashes against the bar. What a chance!
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Branimir Hrgota, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 0:2.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) spurns a great opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. The ball flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The main referee, Marco Fritz, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) is given a yellow card for dissent.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Raffael makes his way off the pitch and Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as his replacement.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 18 metres out. The ball goes towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a save and denies him.

OFF THE POST! Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann is replaced by Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach).

It's a goal! Jens Wemmer (Paderborn) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the top right corner. The assist goes to Moritz Stoppelkamp and the score changes to 1:2.
Substitution. Lukas Rupp makes way for Alban Meha (Paderborn).
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Branimir Hrgota.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christian Strohdiek (Paderborn) coming on for Mario Vrancic.
Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Joel Matip (Schalke) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Dennis Aogo. His bullet header went towards the middle of the goal and behind the goalkeeper. It's 1:0.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Roman Weidenfeller, who pulls off a stunning save!
Goal! Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.

Goal! Adrian Ramos displays great vision and sends a pass to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:1.
Sidney Sam (Schalke) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Christian Clemens (Schalke) will take his place on the pitch.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 20 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) left the pitch, and Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) is coming on to help his team.
Here's the change. Kevin Grosskreutz leaves the pitch and Milos Jojic (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christian Fuchs (Schalke) coming on for Kevin-Prince Boateng.
Substitution. Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) in, Marco Hoger out.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mats Hummels walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sokratis (Dortmund).
Joel Matip (Schalke) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

What an amazing save by Roman Weidenfeller! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails. Schalke will take a corner kick.
Peter Gagelmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Wow, what an escape. Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The ball goes out of play. Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The game is over for Carlos Gruezo. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) comes on for the second half.

It's unbelievable, Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) blows a huge opportunity! He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific daisy-cutter from point blank range. His first-time effort is directed towards the middle of the target, but Ron-Robert Zieler reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card.

Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) and he blasts it inside the right post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch so that Timo Werner can be given a rest.
Here comes a substitution. Ceyhun Gulselam is given a rest as he is replaced by Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
Yellow card. Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Joselu (Hannover) has an effort from close range after latching on to a precise pass, but he can't beat one of the defenders who makes a good block.
Substitution. Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) has come on for Christian Gentner.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Gunter Perl pulls out a yellow card.
The booking goes to Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart).
Today's match ends for Leon Andreasen who will be replaced by Jimmy Briand (Hannover).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Sami Allagui (Mainz) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Great touch by Filip Djuricic (Mainz) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.

Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the top right corner. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Mainz will take a corner kick.
Yellow card. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
Substitution. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) replaces Filip Djuricic.
That will be all from Anthony Modeste who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
It is time for a substitution. Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) is on for Kevin Volland.
It's time for a substitution. Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) comes on in place of Sami Allagui.
Johannes Geis goes off the pitch and Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) comes on.
Substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) has come on for Roberto Firmino.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
OFF THE POST! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot which smashes against the right post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.

What a wasted opportunity by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom left corner, but Jaroslav Drobny makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The ball is out of play and B. Monchengladbach manage to earn a corner.
He should have done better. Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) is afforded space to connect with a Thorgan Hazard cross, but his header from the centre of the box flies well wide of the right post.

Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.

A yellow card for a tackle by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. B. Monchengladbach have a free kick. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) quickly takes the free kick with a short pass.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) produces a good strike that sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels low towards the middle of the target, but Jaroslav Drobny easily deals with the threat.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.
The game has come to an end for Thorgan Hazard. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Zoltan Stieber walks off the pitch to be replaced by Tolcay Cigerci (Hamburger).
Substitution. Raffael leaves the pitch and is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Here comes a substitution. Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) has had enough and is replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
Substitution. Andre Hahn makes his way off the pitch and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is leaving the pitch, and Ashton Gotz (Hamburger) will replace him.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender.
That's it for today, Deniz Aytekin has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
Sascha Molders doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch to replace him.

A superb goal from great team play! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Vladlen Yurchenko (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Hakan Calhanoglu.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Bernd Leno guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball is out of play. Augsburg win a corner kick.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) cracked a first-time shot, but the goalkeeper pulled off an amazing save.
It's time for a substitution. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes on in place of Tobias Werner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim Bellarabi departs the field of play to be replaced by Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Dominik Kohr is replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) is unlucky with a low drive from the edge of the box. A decent save by Bernd Leno stops the ball from hitting the middle of the net.
Substitution. Heung-Min Son walks off the pitch and Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Nice individual effort by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Roman Weidenfeller does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.

OFF THE BAR! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
The end of the first half.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Christian Gentner, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Sokratis (Dortmund) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart). Dortmund have a free kick.
Substitution. Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) has come on for Sven Bender.
Goal - 0:2! Timo Werner laid the ball off to Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

An amazing individual effort from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball low into the middle of the goal and makes it 1:2. Sven Ulreich was helpless.
Here comes a substitution. Kevin Grosskreutz is given a rest as he is replaced by Mats Hummels (Dortmund).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Joseph-Claude Gyau (Dortmund) will replace Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
It's time for a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Timo Werner.
That will be all from Daniel Didavi who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart).
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Nice individual effort by Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a shot to the middle of the goal, but Roman Weidenfeller does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Marcel Schmelzer floats a lovely ball in from the free kick. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) gathers the ball and strikes it into the bottom right corner, increasing the score to 2:2.
The manager makes a subsitution with Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Christian Gentner.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) blows a good chance to score. He collects a pass inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the goal is brilliantly blocked. Great defending!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Joselu (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.

Yuya Osako (Koln) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ron-Robert Zieler to get hold of the ball.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Slawomir Peszko (Koln) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jimmy Briand walks off.
Here's the change. Yuya Osako leaves the pitch and Anthony Ujah (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Sawomir Peszko (Kln) has had enough and is replaced by Simon Zoller (Kln).

Jonas Hector (Koln) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Martins Felipe (Hannover) comes onto the pitch after Miiko Albornoz signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Anthony Ujah (Koln) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 25 metres out, but it flew just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pawel Olkowski (Koln) replaces Miso Brecko.
Substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt makes way for Artur Sobiech (Hannover).
Anthony Ujah (Koln) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.

Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The ball goes behind for a corner. Wolfsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.

It's a goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Marcel N'Djeng and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Diego Benaglio was helpless.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Robert Hartmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ivica Olic.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Hajime Hosogai (Hertha Berlin) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) replaces Junior Malanda.
Substitution. Vieirinha will be replaced by Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg).

Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. The referee blows his whistle, Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Johnny Heitinga makes way for Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Salomon Kalou did his best and is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Ronny walks off the pitch and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
Lukas Kruse pulls off a great save to deny Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.

Brilliant finish! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Philipp Lahm, then produced a nice strike into the top left corner. The score is 2:0.
Idir Ouali (Paderborn) latches on to an accurate pass into the box and immediately unleashes a low shot goalwards. His effort is well saved by the keeper.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Paderborn will have a goal kick.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
The game is over for Michael Heinloth. Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) comes on for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Jerome Boateng comes off for Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared. Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.
It's time for a substitution. Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) comes on in place of Idir Ouali.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) left the pitch, and Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) is coming on to help his team.
We are about to witness a substitution. Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn) is replacing Lukas Rupp.

Lukas Kruse pulls off a great save to deny Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Goal! Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top right corner. It's 3:0.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) is leaving the pitch, and Pierre Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich) will replace him.
Goal! Arjen Robben passes the ball to the feet of Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 4:0.

What a wonderful moment! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the top right corner. His effort fails to surprise Lukas Kruse, who makes a nice save. The ball is out of play and Bayern Munich manage to earn a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.

Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) has an effort from close range after latching on to a precise pass, but he can't beat one of the defenders who makes a good block.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee.

Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) steps up to send the ball in. Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball low towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Loris Karius with a fabulous save.

Stunning strike! Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) latches on to a precise through ball from Daniel Brosinski before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:1.

Superb finishing from Shinji Okazaki (Mainz). Daniel Brosinski plays a fantastic through ball and finds Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:2.
Goal - 1:2! Makoto Hasebe laid the ball off to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who unleashed a strong shot from close range into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
It's time for a substitution. Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) comes on in place of Yunus Malli.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) picks up a yellow card for a foul. A free kick has been awarded to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Lucas Piazon will be replaced by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jairo Samperio (Mainz) comes onto the pitch for Filip Djuricic.
The substitution is prepared. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Timothy Chandler.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) is booked.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The booking goes to Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Perfectly taken free kick!Marc Stendera sends a cross in and Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the top of the net and the score changes to 2:2.
Jonas Hofmann (Mainz) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Kevin Trapp.
Jonas Hofmann comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sami Allagui (Mainz).
Kevin Trapp doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Felix Wiedwald (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) is booked by the referee.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) controls the ball and sets off to face the goalkeeper, but deep inside the box the ball bounces up on the uneven surface and makes him miss the strike, sending the ball well over the goal.
Maximilian Philipp provides Mike Frantz (Freiburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) meets a perfect cross from Jonathan Schmid deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the top right corner. It's 0:2.
Goal! Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a low drive from the edge of the box into the middle of the net, leaving Roman Burki beaten. The score is 1:2.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) creates some space for himself and unleashes a strike from long range, but his effort sails just over the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Thorsten Kinhofer starts the second half.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) is given a yellow card.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card.
The whistle blows and Julian Schuster (Freiburg) is booked for an infringement.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eugen Polanski leaves the pitch and Pirmin Schwegler (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) strikes a fine 23-metre daisy-cutter of a free kick that goes inside the left post. Absolutely no chance of stopping that.
Here's the change. Julian Schuster leaves the pitch and Karim Guede (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) on for Adam Szalai.
Thorsten Kinhofer blows his whistle after Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. Freiburg are given a penalty!
Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Oliver Baumann to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
Mike Frantz comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sascha Riether (Freiburg).
We have witnessed a sending-off! Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Thorsten Kinhofer's decision is final.
A substitution has been made. Maximilian Philipp is replaced by Sebastien Freis (Freiburg).
The substitution is prepared. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Andreas Beck.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the left post.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is penalised.
Goal! Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 3:3.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

What a huge chance for Davie Selke (Werder Bremen). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
Wolfgang Stark shows the yellow card to Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Marco Hoger (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The foul by Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.

Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) does well to meet a cross from Klaas-Jan Huntelaar, but he directs his shot just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.

Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Ralf Fahrmann is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him. Werder Bremen will take a corner kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The game is over for Sidney Sam. Christian Clemens (Schalke) comes on for the second half.

Max Meyer (Schalke) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Raphael Wolf is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 0:1.

Roman Neustadter (Schalke) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Christian Fuchs. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 0:2.

Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the left by a whisker. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
Dennis Aogo (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Wolfgang Stark after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here comes a substitution. Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) has had enough and is replaced by Izet Hajrovi (Werder Bremen).

Marco Hoger (Schalke) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
Joel Matip (Schalke) comes onto the pitch because Marco Hoger simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) has come on for Eljero Elia.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The manager makes a subsitution with Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) coming on for Max Meyer.

Atsuto Uchida plays a lovely pass into Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Davie Selke.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Wolfgang Stark didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That's it for today, Wolfgang Stark has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Yann Sommer is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. FC Koln get a corner.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.
A precise cross aimed towards the penalty spot was met by Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the right post.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Yuya Osako (Kln) left the pitch, and Daniel Halfar (Kln) is coming on to help his team.
Kevin Vogt (Koln) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
That will be all from Anthony Ujah who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Simon Zoller (Koln).
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Christoph Kramer.
Substitution. Pawel Olkowski is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Koln).
Substitution. Andre Hahn walks off the pitch and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
A substitution has been made. Max Kruse is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) reacts stupidly and the referee shows him a deserved red card! PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Wolfsburg.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

OFF THE POST! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Vieirinha (Wolfsburg). This could have been a legendary goal.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Goal - 1:1! Karim Bellarabi laid the ball off to Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Goal! Ricardo Rodriguez clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Vieirinha (Wolfsburg), who gets on the end of it and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the right side of the goal. Bernd Leno had no chance of stopping that. 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Levin Oztunali comes off for Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen).
Half-time substitution. Lars Bender will not participate anymore and Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on.

It's in! Kevin De Bruyne spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The score is now 3:1.
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Karim Bellarabi.
Substitution. Daniel Caligiuri makes his way off the pitch and Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Goal - 4:1! Junior Malanda laid the ball off to Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) replacing Junior Malanda.
Here's the change. Naldo leaves the pitch and Timm Klose (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang clips a neat ball into the box towards Adrian Ramos (Dortmund), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) quickly picks up the rebound and shoots towards the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him.

OFF THE POST! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the right post! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Gunter Perl blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. The linesman makes the right call and Dortmund will have a corner.
Pierre Aubameyang (Dortmund) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared.
Sami Allagui goes off the pitch and Jairo Samperio (Mainz) comes on.
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) replaces Shinji Kagawa.
Substitution. Adrian Ramos will be replaced by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Goal! Jairo Samperio puts the ball on a plate for Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:0.
The players claim that Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. Dortmund have been awarded a penalty kick!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Shinji Okazaki (Mainz).
Penalty saved! Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) sends the penalty towards the bottom left corner, but Loris Karius pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.

This is a pitiful situation indeed. Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass, which went to one of the attacking players, into his own net. The score is 2:0.
Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) has tested the patience of referee Gunter Perl and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The game has come to an end for Sven Bender. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Mitsuru Maruoka (Dortmund).
Johannes Geis (Mainz) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Kasper Hjulmand has decided to substitute Christoph Moritz and he is replaced by Julian Koch (Mainz).
The substitution is prepared. Filip Djuricic (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jonas Hofmann.
A rebound lands at the feet of Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), whose promising strike from long range smashes against left post! What an opportunity that was!
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Santiago Garcia sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:1.
Brilliant finish! Daniel Baier (Augsburg) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Halil Altintop, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Great chance! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) has a good chance to get on the scoresheet and fires the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) picks up a caution.
Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card. Augsburg are awarded a penalty kick!
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.

Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) will try to find the head of one of his teammates from a corner kick. What a great chance for Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle. Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) commits a foul after dangerous play. The referee gives a penalty to Werder Bremen!
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) steps up to take the penalty and converts it with a shot into the roof of the net.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marnon Busch (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch so that Clemens Fritz can be given a rest.
The referee signals a substitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Eljero Elia.
Sascha Molders will be replaced by Tim Matavz (Augsburg).

Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) produced a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Marwin Hitz thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Substitution. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) has come on for Raul Bobadilla.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 2:2.
Substitution. Alejandro Galvez will be replaced by Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen).
That was close. Tobias Werner (Augsburg) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) comes on in place of Dominik Kohr.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
OFF THE POST! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot which smashes against the right post.
Goal! Tobias Werner passes the ball to the feet of Tim Matavz (Augsburg), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 4:2.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Here's the change. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg leaves the pitch and Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.

Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Jaroslav Drobny, who pulls off a decent save!
Nicolai Muller (Hamburger) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Rafinha walks off the pitch and Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
That's the end of the game for Xherdan Shaqiri, who is replaced by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tolgay Arslan departs the field of play to be replaced by Petr Jiracek (Hamburger).

Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the top right corner is, however superbly saved by Manuel Neuer!
Here comes a substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga is given a rest as he is replaced by Julian Green (Hamburger).
Valon Behrami (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ville Steinmann (Hamburger) is coming onto the pitch as Nicolai Muller cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayern Munich.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Jaroslav Drobny (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich) gets a yellow card, off the field.
The referee gives a yellow card to Manuel Neuer (Bayern Munich).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the top right corner is smartly dealt with by Ron-Robert Zieler. The linesman makes the right call and Paderborn will have a corner.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) volleys the ball towards the top right corner, but it is saved by the keeper.

Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee blows his whistle, Paderborn are awarded a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leon Andreasen (Hannover) comes onto the pitch so that Manuel Schmiedebach can be given a rest.
Substitution. Michael Heinloth did his best and is replaced by Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn).
Goal - 1:0! Uwe Hunemeier laid the ball off to Elias Kachunga (Paderborn), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Joselu limps off the pitch to be replaced by Jimmy Briand (Hannover).
The substitution has been made. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) has replaced Leonardo Bittencourt.
Here's the change. Suleyman Koc leaves the pitch and Marvin Bakalorz (Paderborn) comes on as a substitute.
The substitution is prepared. Marc Vucinovic (Paderborn) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Elias Kachunga.

Christian Schulz (Hannover) is strong enough to get to the ball and produces a header from close range. Even though the header was directed under the crossbar, Lukas Kruse didn't have a hard time stopping the attempt as it wasn't powerful enough. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) scores a goal! His accurate strike from 83 metres out finds its way behind the goalkeeper and into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) receives a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Ralf Fahrmann is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.
Goal! The rebound fell to Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.

An amazing individual effort from Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the top left corner and makes it 0:2. Ralf Fahrmann was helpless.
Yellow card. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Dennis Aogo (Schalke) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom right corner only for Kevin Trapp to dive and make a save. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Max Meyer (Schalke) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) handled the ball and gives away a free kick. A penalty for a foul is awarded to Schalke.
Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) converts the penalty with ease, Antonin Panenka style.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It's a goal! Julian Draxler (Schalke) makes it 1:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Maxim Choupo-Moting and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Kevin Trapp was helpless.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Constant Djakpa just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces him.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) must have forgotten about the first yellow card that he received because he is shown a second one by the referee after his bad challenge!
Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) is ordered to leave the field of play by the referee after receiving a red card!
Substitution. Aleksandar Ignjovski leaves the pitch and is replaced by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
We are about to witness a substitution. Tranquillo Barnetta (Schalke) is replacing Max Meyer.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar will be replaced by Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke).

Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card in the hand of Markus Schmidt. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is sent from the pitch.
Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting walks off the pitch and Marvin Friedrich (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What a save from Oliver Baumann! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim), who rises and produces an amazing header inside the right post.
Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went inches over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Peter Sippel blows his whistle to start the second half.
A substitution has been made. Gotoku Sakai is replaced by Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart).
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
The game has come to an end for Steven Zuber. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim).
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Substitution. Martin Harnik is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
Substitution. Oriol Romeu leaves the pitch and is replaced by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart).

Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Pirmin Schwegler cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Sven Ulreich with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
Here comes a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Anthony Modeste.
Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Jonathan Schmid takes the corner and Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) rises highest in the middle of the box to plant a precise header into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:0.

Ronny (Hertha Berlin) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight into the top right corner. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Florian Meyer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Florian Meyer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
We are about to witness a substitution. Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) is replacing Oliver Sorg.
That will be all from Julian Schieber who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
The referee cannot ignore such behaviour. John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card and needs to watch himself for the rest of the game.

What an opportunity! Felix Klaus (Freiburg) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the bottom left corner, but Thomas Kraft reacts superbly to keep the ball out. Freiburg will take a corner kick.

Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the top right corner, but Thomas Kraft was alert and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Philipp departs the field of play to be replaced by Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
Substitution. Genki Haraguchi leaves the pitch and is replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Fabian Lustenberger leaves the pitch to be replaced by Johnny Heitinga (Hertha Berlin).
Karim Guede plays a neat ball into the path of Felix Klaus (Freiburg), who makes room for a shot and fires in off the right post! 2:1.
Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Substitution. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) on for Vladimir Darida.
Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) is shown a harsh red card by the referee as his tackle warranted no more than a yellow card!
It's a goal! Ronny (Hertha Berlin) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. The ball ends up inside the left post. Superb strike!
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) latched on to a brilliant cross and struck a perfect header inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance.
Artur Sobiech (Hannover) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The foul by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.
Substitution. Julian Green makes his way off the pitch and Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.

What a huge chance for Nicolai Muller (Hamburger). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
The substitution has been made. Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) has replaced Matthias Ostrzolek.

Christian Schulz (Hannover) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Jaroslav Drobny, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Marcelo (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kenan Karaman (Hannover) is coming onto the pitch as Artur Sobiech cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Valon Behrami goes off the pitch and Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) comes on.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover) replacing Hiroshi Kiyotake.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jimmy Briand (Hannover) for Leonardo Bittencourt.
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger) leaps high to meet a lofted pass around the penalty spot, but his header crashes against the crossbar!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Marwin Hitz, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Eintracht Frankfurt force a corner. They send men into the box.
What was Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) jumps for a header from the resulting corner kick and sends the ball in on goal, but the goalkeeper makes a very good save.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A substitution has been made. Makoto Hasebe is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) gets to a rebound just outside the penalty area and unleashes a fabulous low effort that goes in off the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Marco Russ walks off the pitch to be replaced by Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Takashi Inui comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) is booked for saying more than Manuel Grafe was willing to tolerate.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Markus Feulner (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Halil Altintop walks off.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is leaving the pitch, and Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) will replace him.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Tobias Werner (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.

OFF THE POST! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Daniel Baier as he is replaced by Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg).
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Markus Feulner (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Andre Hahn (B. Moenchengladbach) does his best to catch the ball into the box from a cross, but he isn't successful.
Goal! Max Kruse provides Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 1:0.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.

What a wasted opportunity by Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Yann Sommer makes an astonishing save to thwart him.

OFF THE POST! Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
What was Marco Hoger (Schalke) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Roman Neustadter (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
Felix Brych has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Today's match ends for Tony Jantschke who will be replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Fuchs trots off the pitch and is replaced by Julian Draxler (Schalke).

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) wriggles into space inside the box with excellent ball control, but his effort on goal is well blocked. The referee blows his whistle, B. Monchengladbach are awarded a corner kick.

Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) celebrates his beautiful goal. He rises above the defence inside the box and scores with a bullet header from the free kick. The ball goes into the middle of the goal and the goalkeeper didn't have a chance to save that close-range header.
Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) handles the ball inside the penalty area. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Schalke.
Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke) brilliantly executes a penalty kick as he sends the ball straight into the bottom left corner, bouncing in off the post. No chance for Yann Sommer to stop this shot.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach). Raffael plays a fantastic through ball and finds Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 3:1.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Marco Hger (Schalke) is leaving the pitch, and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) will replace him.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
The substitution has been made. Marvin Friedrich (Schalke) has replaced Dennis Aogo.
Lucien Favre has decided to substitute Max Kruse and he is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) places a fabulous effort into the top left corner after collecting a brilliant pass inside the box. What a strike that is!
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Raffael.
Andre Hahn (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Ralf Fahrmann, who makes a comfortable save.
What a great touch by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) as he controls a fine pass into the box and fires the ball to the left post, but the effort is brilliantly blocked.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Sven Ulreich, who pulls off a stunning save! Bayern Munich force their opponents to concede a corner.

Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
Oriol Romeu (VfB Stuttgart) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and slots the ball low into the middle of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gianluca Gaudino (Bayern Munich) is coming onto the pitch as Holger Badstuber cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Vedad Ibisevic is replaced by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee gives a yellow card to Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) will replace Christian Gentner.
OFF THE POST! Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) takes a shot from outside the box and hits the right post!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) hides his face in shame! He blows a big chance to score from the rebound and sees his shot smash against the right post!
Moritz Leitner goes off the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.

Goal! Robert Lewandowski displays great vision and sends a pass to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
Substitution. Robert Lewandowski leaves the pitch and is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
Thorsten Kinhofer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Roman Burki was forced into action to thwart Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. Dortmund have a corner.
Sokratis (Dortmund) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Goal! Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Kevin Grosskreutz, then sends the ball into the roof of the net. 1:0.

Close! Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
Goal! Adrian Ramos displays great vision and sends a pass to Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:0.
Admir Mehmedi comes off the pitch to be replaced by Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the roof of the net. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Roman Weidenfeller makes a comfortable save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Freiburg.
The foul by Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
CHANCE! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) for Shinji Kagawa.

Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Roman Burki makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
Today's match ends for Adrian Ramos who will be replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
What an outstanding solo effort by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Vladimir Darida will be replaced by Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
Substitution. Sven Bender (Dortmund) replaces Milos Jojic.
It will be a substitution. Philipp Zulechner is ready to enter the pitch as Felix Klaus (Freiburg) walks off.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge.
Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a clinical finish!
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What was Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Chance! Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards goal, but Loris Karius is alert and makes a great save to deny him.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. His dangerous effort is blocked by Thomas Kraft, who makes a glorious save!
What a hit! Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the top right corner. 0:1.
Sami Allagui (Mainz) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Per Skjelbred did his best and is replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
Junior Diaz (Mainz) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
