The manager has decided to make a substitution and Ja-Cheol Koo walks off the pitch to be replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) left the pitch, and Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is coming on to help his team.
Goal! Junior Diaz rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Sami Allagui (Mainz), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 0:2.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christoph Moritz (Mainz) coming on for Sami Allagui.
Roy Beerens (Hertha Berlin) is booked by the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch for Jens Hegeler.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Niko Bungert (Mainz). The referee makes the call - penalty to Hertha Berlin!
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Niko Bungert (Mainz) gets booked.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Jonas Hofmann will be replaced by Philipp Wollscheid (Mainz).
It's in the back of the net! Yunus Malli sprays a pass out to Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:3.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.
Markus Gisdol has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) comes on the pitch for Sejad Salihovic.
Goal! Andreas Beck puts a cross into the box and finds Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim), who latches on to it and strikes the ball low into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:0.

Ivica Olic slides a brilliant pass into Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Substitution. Junior Malanda is replaced by Aaron Hunt (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) on for Anthony Modeste.
The foul by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) as he is replaced by Nicklas Bendtner.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Luiz Gustavo limps off the pitch to be replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Sebastian Rudy walks off the pitch and Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri displays great vision and sends a pass to Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Oliver Baumann to dive and make a save.
RED CARD! Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Wolfgang Stark. He can have an early bath.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) meets an excellent cross and from the edge of the penalty box unleashes a fantastic header towards the bottom right corner of the goal, but it's blocked by a defender.
That's it for today, Wolfgang Stark has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal, but Timo Horn shows his agility and makes a save.

Patrick Ziegler (Paderborn) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar.
What a big chance! Miso Brecko (Koln) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh and Peter Gagelmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Peter Gagelmann starts the second half.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Matthias Lehmann (Koln), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Timo Horn, who pulls off a stunning save!
A substitution has been made. Simon Zoller goes off and Slawomir Peszko (Koln) comes on.
Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Idir Ouali (Paderborn) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lukas Rupp.
Here comes a substitution. Yuya Osako (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Anthony Ujah.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marvin Ducksch comes onto the pitch so that Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) can be given a rest.
Kevin Vogt just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Yannick Gerhardt (Koln) replaces him.
Daniel Bruckner has picked up an injury and is replaced by Thomas Bertels (Paderborn).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Good touch by Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.

Stefan Kiessling looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot that ricochets in off the crossbar. The score is 1:0.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Raphael Wolf made a crucial save!
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the bottom left corner, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Raphael Wolf. What a save!
Unbelievable miss! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar!
OFF THE BAR! Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) finds some space to meet the corner kick and unleashes a shot that only crashes against the bar!
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Raphael Wolf.
Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks accuracy and flies well over the crossbar.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen). Santiago Garcia plays a fantastic through ball and finds Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) has too much to say to the referee and receives a caution.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Christian Dingert lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.

Goal! Zlatko Junuzovic displays great vision and sends a pass to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
The referee signals a substitution. Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Levin Oztunali.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!

Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Bernd Leno to get hold of the ball. It will be a corner kick for Werder Bremen.
The main referee, Christian Dingert, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Substitution. Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Lars Bender.
Robin Dutt has decided to substitute Davie Selke and he is replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) received a clever through ball which could have put him in a promising position, but the defence was alert to the danger. Werder Bremen forced their opponent to concede a corner.
Goal - 3:2! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Tin Jedvaj provided an assist for the goal.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) is replacing Eljero Elia.
It is time for a substitution. Marnon Busch (Werder Bremen) is on for Clemens Fritz.
Nils Petersen plays a neat ball into the path of Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen), who makes room for a shot and fires in off the crossbar! 3:3.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) protests to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Josip Drmic (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Stefan Kiessling out.
That's it for today, Christian Dingert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dani Schahin (Freiburg). Peter Gagelmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) in, Dani Schahin out.

An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach). Peter Gagelmann saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul. Penalty awarded! Freiburg will take a penalty kick.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) misses the penalty! His poor effort goes well over the crossbar.
Here comes a substitution. Branimir Hrgota is given a rest as he is replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals a substitution. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Ibrahima Traore.
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a caution.
A substitution has been made. Christoph Kramer goes off and Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mike Frantz (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Felix Klaus can be given a rest.
That's the end of the game for Admir Mehmedi, who is replaced by Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg).
Peter Gagelmann shows a yellow card to Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Christian Schulz (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Joselu (Hannover) meets an accurate cross inside the six-yard box and attempts a bullet header, but the goalkeeper denies him and makes the save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hannover.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players. The ball is out of play. Hannover will have a chance to score from a corner.
That's the end of the game for Yunus Malli, who is replaced by Filip Djuricic (Mainz).
It is time for a substitution. Artur Sobiech (Hannover) is on for Hiroshi Kiyotake.
The substitution has been made. Devante Parker (Mainz) has replaced Ja-Cheol Koo.
Sascha Stegemann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

This was a piece of cake for Ralf Fahrmann. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores after an assist by Sebastian Rode that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marco Hoger (Schalke) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) has a sight of goal and shoots from long range but his ambitious effort flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. A free kick has been awarded to Schalke.
Jan Kirchhoff doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Roman Neustadter (Schalke) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) comes close to scoring with a glancing header towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies him by making a save.
The manager makes a subsitution with Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) coming on for Mario Gotze.
The substitution is prepared. Dante (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jerome Boateng.
The ball finds its way to Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) after a confusing situation inside the goalmouth. He finds some space and easily knocks the ball in with his body and alters the score to 0:1.
The game is interrupted. Sidney Sam (Schalke) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Here comes a substitution. Xabi Alonso is given a rest as he is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich).
Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Dennis Aogo (Schalke) will take his place on the pitch.
Felipe Santana has picked up an injury and is replaced by Christian Fuchs (Schalke).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

A cross to the edge of the box finds Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) who takes a nice first touch and tries to beat the keeper with a quick shot towards the top of the net. Rune Jarstein pulls off a good save and the score remains the same.
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) who, trying to avert a cross inside the six-yard box, sends the ball behind his keeper's back. The score is 0:1.
Wow, what an escape. Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Roger Schmidt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Heung-Min Son.

Superb finishing from Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen). Gonzalo Castro plays a fantastic through ball and finds Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.
Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.

Perfectly taken free kick! Hakan Calhanoglu sends a cross in and Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the bottom left corner and the score changes to 2:2.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge. A free kick has been awarded to Bayer Leverkusen.
The manager makes a subsitution with Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) coming on for Tin Jedvaj.
Johannes van den Bergh goes off the pitch and Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Here's the change. Simon Rolfes leaves the pitch and Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
Off the post! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the right post.
Goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top left corner. It's 3:2.
Substitution. Hajime Hosogai is replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch for Nico Schulz.

Hakan Calhanoglu sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 4:2.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Rene Adler makes a great save to stop his effort. Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.

Rene Adler can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stopped the close-range effort from Suleyman Koc (Paderborn). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner.
Goal! Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Rafael van der Vaart leaves the pitch to be replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hamburger).
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Substitution. Tolgay Arslan did his best and is replaced by Zoltan Stieber (Hamburger).
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marcell Jansen slides a brilliant pass into Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Suleyman Koc (Paderborn) is leaving the pitch, and Lukas Rupp (Paderborn) will replace him.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Rene Adler with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:2.
Substitution. Marcell Jansen leaves the pitch and is replaced by Matthias Ostrzolek (Hamburger).
A substitution has been made. Marvin Bakalorz goes off and Stefan Kutschke (Paderborn) comes on.

Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Lukas Kruse guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Vrancic leaves the pitch and Marc Vucinovic (Paderborn) comes on.

Daniel Bruckner sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Moritz Stoppelkamp (Paderborn) latches on to it and finishes with a quick low shot into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:3.
That's it for today, Bastian Dankert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Anthony Ujah (Kln) gets himself onto the end of the corner, but his header is thwarted.
Goal! The rebound fell to Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.
Anthony Ujah (Koln) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. Although the shot low to the middle of the goal isn't very precise, it ends up in the net.
Yellow card. Marcel Risse (Koln) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Martin Harnik is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Miso Brecko (Koln) for his blatant foul.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) for Alexandru Maxim.
Marcel Risse comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pawel Olkowski (Koln).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Gotoku Sakai will be replaced by Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart).
Substitution. Anthony Ujah will be replaced by Simon Zoller (Koln).
Adam Matuszczyk (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yuya Osako.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.

Great solo effort by Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Vedad Ibisevic, but he hits a shot just over the crossbar.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Sebastian Rudy plays a terrific cross over to Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) will not participate anymore and David Abraham is coming on.

Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is quickest inside the box and jumps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it flies just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.

A good lofted pass from Franco Di Santo finds Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) on the edge of the area. He collects the ball and rips in a wonderful shot which ends up in the bottom right corner. The score is now 0:1.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
A substitution has been made. Izet Hajrovic goes off and Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Davie Selke (Werder Bremen) left the pitch, and Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) is coming on to help his team.

Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
Tarik Elyounoussi will be replaced by Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim).

Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Sebastian Rudy as he is replaced by Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim).
Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) gets into a promising shooting position on the edge of the box after a nice lofted pass, but his effort is deflected onto the post by one of the defenders.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
What a lucky goal from the free kick by Naldo (Wolfsburg)! An explosive knuckleball shot from long range sails past the goalkeeper.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
It is an own goal! Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) unluckily beats his own goalkeeper.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
The substitution has been made. Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) has replaced Luiz Gustavo.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Nelson Valdez limps off the pitch to be replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
Here comes a substitution. Vieirinha is given a rest as he is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicklas Bendtner (Wolfsburg) replaces Ivica Olic.

Goal! Kevin De Bruyne displays great vision and sends a pass to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:1.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Lucas Piazon cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Here's the change. Makoto Hasebe leaves the pitch and Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) leaps high to meet a deep cross and gives the goalkeeper no chance with a bullet header into the middle of the net.

Kevin Trapp can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card.
Gunter Perl is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
It's in the back of the net! Kevin Grosskreutz slips the ball through to Marco Reus (Dortmund), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.

Sokratis (Dortmund) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Marco Reus. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the left post behind the goalkeeper. It's 0:2.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Knut Kircher had an easy-decision to make.
The referee shows a yellow card to Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg). No wonder. A clear yellow for bad language.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
What was Milos Jojic (Dortmund) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shawn Parker leaves the pitch and Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) comes on.
Milos Jojic goes off the pitch and Sven Bender (Dortmund) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Tim Matavz (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Markus Feulner.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Grosskreutz trots off the pitch and is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Dortmund).
Sven Bender (Dortmund) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.
Goal! The rebound fell to Adrian Ramos (Dortmund) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:3.
Substitution. Nikola Djurdjic did his best and is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).

Abdul Baba Rahman sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) latches on to it and finishes with a quick low shot into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:3.
The game has come to an end for Marco Reus. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund).

The ball hits the back of the net! Abdul Baba Rahman showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Tim Matavz (Augsburg) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it into the middle of the net  2:3.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Ibrahima Traore sends a terrific cross into the box. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Christian Gentner, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Substitution. Branimir Hrgota will be replaced by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Didavi leaves the pitch and Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Havard Nordtveit.
Here comes a substitution. Andre Hahn is given a rest as he is replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) attempts to discuss the decision with Christian Dingert, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
It will be a substitution. Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Alexandru Maxim walks off.
Goal! Alvaro Dominguez tees up Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Martin Harnik.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) takes the set piece and smashes the ball across the turf to the bottom left corner. The keeper reacts amazingly and denies the attempt.
Goal! Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.

Goal! Elias Kachunga (Paderborn) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Loris Karius had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:1.
Daniel Bruckner (Paderborn) receives a yellow card from the referee, but it seems like a very harsh decision.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Peter Sippel starts the second half.
The manager makes a subsitution with Gonzalo Jara (Mainz) coming on for Nikolce Noveski.
Mario Vrancic (Paderborn) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Daniel Brosinski as he is replaced by Christoph Moritz (Mainz).
Joo-Ho Park (Mainz) is given a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Elias Kachunga, who is replaced by Marvin Ducksch (Paderborn).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Suleyman Koc and he is replaced by Marc Vucinovic (Paderborn).
Substitution. Stefan Kutschke is replaced by Lukas Rupp (Paderborn).
Here's the change. Filip Djuricic leaves the pitch and Yunus Malli (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.

Goal  2:1! Marvin Bakalorz sends a superb cross into the box. Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header into the top right corner, leaving Loris Karius beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the crossbar!
Uwe Hunemeier (Paderborn) tackles a bit over-zealously and Peter Sippel blows for a foul. The referee gives a penalty after pointing to the spot!
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Brilliant finish! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Sebastian Boenisch, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) takes the free kick from the edge of the box. His decent attempt goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked. It's a free kick to Dortmund, but it's in no position for a direct shot on goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul. Marco Reus (Dortmund) will take a free kick. Is he going to strike the ball directly at the goal? Let's find out!
The substitution has been made. Stefan Reinartz (Bayer Leverkusen) has replaced Simon Rolfes.
Milos Jojic (Dortmund) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
The substitution is prepared. Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marco Reus.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) will replace Milos Jojic.
The game has come to an end for Heung-Min Son. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Hakan Calhanoglu cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Matthias Ginter (Dortmund) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the right side of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Dortmund.

Bernd Leno pulls off a great save to deny Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.

A superb goal from great team play! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot straight into the roof of the net. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Christian Streich probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Mike Frantz. He is replaced by Felix Klaus (Freiburg).

Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) wastes a huge opportunity. He attempts to knock a rebound into the top right corner with a delicate header, but Roman Burki dives to keep the ball from hitting the net.
That's the end of the game for Martin Lanig, who is replaced by Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Florian Meyer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Thomas Schaaf decides to make a substitution. Takashi Inui will be replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Karim Guede can be given a rest.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Thomas Schaaf has decided to substitute Nelson Valdez and he is replaced by Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here is a change. Christian Gunter is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg).
Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

What a huge chance for Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.

Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Timo Horn shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Yellow card. Matthias Lehmann (Koln) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Yuya Osako will be replaced by Kevin Vogt (Koln).
Johan Djourou (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Marcel Risse (Koln) picked up a yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
Substitution. Marcel Risse will be replaced by Pawel Olkowski (Koln).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Jens Keller is forced to make a change. Sead Kolasinac is unable to continue due to injury, Christian Fuchs (Schalke) comes on.
Joselu (Hannover) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

Ron-Robert Zieler makes a brilliant save! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the top right corner but is saved by the keeper! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Schalke will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Maxim Choupo-Moting puts the ball on a plate for Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
Miiko Albornoz goes off the pitch and Hiroshi Kiyotake (Hannover) comes on.

Ron-Robert Zieler was forced into action to thwart Maxim Choupo-Moting (Schalke). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt produces a great pass that finds Edgar Prib (Hannover) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
What a goal! Joselu (Hannover) receives an accurate pass and tries his luck with a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb strike that goes into the right post and behind the goalkeeper.
Here comes a substitution. Julian Draxler (Schalke) has had enough and is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Here is a change. Sidney Sam is going off and Jens Keller gives the last tactical orders to Christian Clemens (Schalke).
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leonardo Bittencourt departs the field of play to be replaced by Ceyhun Gulselam (Hannover).
Joselu (Hannover) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
Substitution. Artur Sobiech (Hannover) replaces Joselu.
Edgar Prib (Hannover) is booked.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

A perfect lofted pass from Roy Beerens finds Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Raphael Wolf had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.

A neat pass is well received by Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot.

Close! Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) stands over the resulting free kick from around 22 metres out and his shot goes just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Thorsten Kinhofer starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Robin Dutt decided to make a change. Felix Kroos is replaced by Davie Selke (Werder Bremen).
What a great touch by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Goal! Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.
The referee shows the yellow card to Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen).
GOAL! Zlatko Junuzovic curls the free kick into the box. Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Thomas Kraft and into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Goal! The rebound fell to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) and he fired home from close range. The score is 2:2.
Close! Ronny (Hertha Berlin) takes the resultant free kick from 18 metres out and his shot goes just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Peter Niemeyer departs the field of play to be replaced by Jens Hegeler (Hertha Berlin).
Jos Luhukay decides to make a substitution. Ronny will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
A yellow card for a tackle by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin). Thorsten Kinhofer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Izet Hajrovic will be replaced by Marnon Busch (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Julian Schieber is going off and Jos Luhukay gives the last tactical orders to Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).
Cedric Makiadi goes off the pitch and Alejandro Galvez (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Thorsten Kinhofer shows a yellow card to Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee for a bad sliding tackle on an opponent.
Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make. Hoffenheim have a free kick.
Goal! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:0.
Goal! Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Roberto Firmino, then sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Daniel Baier (Augsburg) for his blatant foul. Free kick. Hoffenheim will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Tobias Werner (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Francisco Caiuby will be replaced by Shawn Parker (Augsburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that Roberto Firmino can be given a rest.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Halil Altintop and he is replaced by Nikola Djurdjic (Augsburg).

Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Augsburg are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) will take his place on the pitch.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sascha Molders (Augsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Tim Matavz cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It's time for a substitution. Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Kevin Volland.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) shoots the rebound towards the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows the goalkeeper to pull off a stunning save.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save. Bayern Munich win a corner.
Goal! Arjen Robben provides Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
The end of the first half.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dieter Hecking probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Aaron Hunt. He is replaced by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg).

Wonderful movement! Robert Lewandowski is in a good position inside the box but decides to pass the ball to Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), who keeps his cool and blasts the ball inside the left post. What a finish that is  1:0.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the left side of the net.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Max Grun.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
It is time for a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) is on for Vieirinha.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich).
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) replaces Luiz Gustavo.
That's the end of the game for Robert Lewandowski, who is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich).
Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Manuel Neuer, who pulls off a decent save!
Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.

The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside. Flag goes up against Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and the referee blows his whistle for offside.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich) will replace Gianluca Gaudino.
Crossbar! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) throws the chance away as he attempts to produce a shot from inside the box, but his attempt only rattles the crossbar! The goalkeeper can remain calm.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
